Title: Baby Storytime
Description: A half-hour of baby focused play with several activities modeled for you to repeat at home. The activities are deigned to help baby create connections mentally, physically, and emotionally to their world. This program is designed for babies who aren’t walking yet. Caregivers are encouraged to bring a blanket or mat for baby lay on comfortably.

From colorful crafts to interactive play, toddlers will delight in a fun-filled experience that fosters learning, laughter, and the joy of storytelling!

Description:
If you want to play Mah Jongg, the library is a place you can go for that! On Tuesdays from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm there is Mah Jongg. Take the time and mark Tuesday on your calendar and come out and meet new people and play Mah Jongg.  

Players are encouraged to wear masks. 

Sponsored by the Friends of Rocky Bluff Library.

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.

Title: Meditation: Path to Inner Peace
Description:
Come join us in this introductory workshop to explore the basics of mindfulness meditation:  Its theory and practice as well as its physical, mental and spiritual benefits.  All levels are welcome.  Taught by Manching Tom, certified Meditation Teacher.  Registration is required.  

Consider bringing a cushion or pillow for additional support in your chair.  This is optional.

***Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed for this workshop.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Bingo
Description: Join us every 1st Tuesday of the month for a round of BINGO! Make new friends, win prizes, and have FUN!

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description:
Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources. 

To register, call 800-272-3900.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Family Storytime
Description: Join us for a fun-filled hour of stories, music, dancing, and crafts! No registration required.

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Books on Tap Book Club
Description:
Books on Tap is a monthly book club that meets at 3 Keys Brewing & Eatery, 2505 Manatee Ave. E. in Bradenton. We have a very informal and relaxed setup. Come ready to talk about any book you’re reading, ask for recommendations, or just enjoy some bookish company. 

Anyone 21 and up is welcome to join us!

Enjoy good books, good beer, and good conversation!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Watch their eyes light up as they explore the wonders of science through engaging stories and playful, age-appropriate activities, fostering a love for learning and discovery!

An informal and casual teen writer’s monthly workshop that allows young people the opportunity to grow both as writers and readers. Teens will participate in fun prompts and exercises and while sharing is encouraged, it is never mandatory.


Workshop will be led by Teen Librarian, Rachel Scharbo, who holds a Bachelor of Arts in Writing and Rhetoric.

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Cupid's Corner Romance Book Club
Description:
Romance readers, 18+, will meet to discuss the genre. Members will choose their own titles based on monthly themes. Let’s bond over our favorite sub-genres, tropes, groveling heroes/heroines, grand gestures, and happily ever afters! What moments make you swoon and sigh?

The theme for January is SOMETHING BLUE. Banish the January blues by cozying up with a romance featuring the color blue on its cover.

Title: Lego Family Fun Day!
Description:
This is educational free play with Legos, blocks, puzzles, games. All ages welcome – parents or caregivers encouraged to accompany young children.

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.
Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club - Killers of a Certain Age by Deanna Raybourn
Description:
Billie, Mary Alice, Helen, and Natalie have worked for the Museum, an elite network of assassins, for forty years. Now their talents are considered old-school and no one appreciates what they have to offer in an age that relies more on technology than people skills.

When the foursome is sent on an all-expenses paid vacation to mark their retirement, they are targeted by one of their own. Only the Board, the top-level members of the Museum, can order the termination of field agents, and the women realize they’ve been marked for death.

Now to get out alive they have to turn against their own organization, relying on experience and each other to get the job done, knowing that working together is the secret to their survival. They’re about to teach the Board what it really means to be a woman—and a killer—of a certain age.(from Amazon)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: History Talk - Uncovering the Past: Exploring the Rich History of the Ellenton and Rocky Bluff Area
Description:
What happened to the town of Ellenton? How did Rocky Bluff get its name? Who were the first settlers in this area? Join librarian Katie Fleck for a talk on the history of Ellenton and Rocky Bluff.

Katie Fleck is a graduate of the University of South Florida with MAs in History and Library Science. She has worked in Information Services for the Manatee County Public Library since 2018. Katie is a native of Manatee County, Florida and has a passion for local history.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Fairy Origami
Description: The first tales of fairies date back to Greek mythology, where fairies protected the Earth with vigor and might. In modern day, fairies have been associated with children's books, resulting in the term, “fairy tales.” Join Certified Zentangle Teacher and origami artist, patsy monk, as you learn how to fold a beautiful fairy ornament. These little creatures will be constructed with enthusiasm, friendliness, and compassion. They are to remind us to smile.  They can be hung or stood up as decoration or shared with someone who needs a smile. All supplies are provided.

Title: FNDMNTLS Calligraffiti Art Installation at the LWR Library
Description:
Join us at 2:00 pm in the outdoor space for a LIVE calligraffiti art installation in celebration of the Lakewood Ranch Library Grand Opening! His friend, known as Swirly Painter, will also be joining us for the opening to collab on the piece.

FNDMNTLS, fun·da·men·tals, is a Florida-based artist who integrates letter forms into abstract compositions combining the traditions of calligraphy, typography, and graffiti into large-scale street installations, as well as custom work in a style known as Calligraffiti. He utilizes multiple scripts, fonts, alphabets, and mythologies, to create an aesthetic experience rather than a legibly written message. 

Check out his Instagram, Online Gallery, and Online Store for a preview and learn more about FNDMNTLS!
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Tech Class: PC Basics

Title: Art Alliances Playreaders Present: The Odd Couple (female version)

Title: Mr  Stevey and Friends
Description:
Enjoy this free community program geared towards pre-school and elementary school aged children and their families to engage in mindfulness activities and create art in all its various forms. Local teaching artists guide participants in activities, make-and-take art projects, and read-alongs. 

Each event includes a free, healthy lunch for the whole family, and each child will receive free books to help build their at home library, and a special prize to take home at the end of the day.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: The Arc of Flash Fiction: An Introduction
Description:
Flash Fiction, Micro Fiction, and Sudden Fiction are small, bite-size stories. They can be as long as two pages or simply a sentence. They offer a taste, a feel, a character, a choice, a start, an end. What is Flash Fiction? In this introduction, we will look at the elements and arcs of these micro pieces and the wonderful worlds they create.

A writer of short stories and essays, Julieanna Blackwell's work has appeared in Lunch Ticket, Literary Orphans, Slippery Elm Literary Journal, MoonPark Review, and elsewhere. The Naples Daily News published her humorous column of personal essays. She was also the Flash Fiction editor for the award-winning 805Lit, the first literary journal published by a public library in the country. She developed and leads the Elements and Arcs series of writing classes and workshops, which are designed for adult and teen library patrons. Find more at www.JulieannaBlackwell.com

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

The theme for January is SOMETHING BLUE. Banish the January blues by cozying up with a romance featuring the color blue on its cover.

Title: Hike with a Librarian--Emerson Point Preserve
Description:
Meet us at the Emerson Point Preserve on Snead Island! 

We will discuss a nature themed nonfiction book with a Manatee County Librarian while enjoying Florida's scenery. After our book discussion, a Manatee County Parks & Natural Resources guide will talk about the local fauna and flora as we walk around the preserve at a leisurely pace. 

Hike with a Librarian programs involve easier walks through local preserves. Further instruction on the meet-up spot and trails will be emailed closer to the event date. 

Book title: Birds and Us : A 12,000-Year History from Cave Art to Conservation by: Tim Birkhead. 

This hike will be bird themed!
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks, Science/Nature/Environment

Title: Author Talk: Three Ringling Circus, by Sandra Gurvis
Description:
Sarasota would not be what it is today without the influence of the Ringling family, particularly John Ringling and his wife Mable. 

Focusing on two main “characters,” John Ringling and his family, and the city of Sarasota, THREE RINGLING CIRCUS is divided into three sections: The history of Sarasota, the story of the Ringlings and the Ringling effect on the city.  The book covers everything from the early days of the natives, Blacks and settlers to the origins of the Ringling family and ahead-of-their-time ways of developing their circus to the massive amounts of finagling that went into the creation of the Art Museum and Ca d’Zan. The book bears witness to the Ringlings’ fabulous lifestyle, their behind-the-scenes heartbreak and triumph and often Machiavellian grab for wealth and power.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Creating Small Gardens
Description: Come learn how to create small container gardens from Mack Lessig, of our County Extension Service.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

Title: Author Talk: Three Ringling Circus, by Sandra Gurvis
Description:
Sarasota would not be what it is today without the influence of the Ringling family, particularly John Ringling and his wife Mable. 

Focusing on two main “characters,” John Ringling and his family, and the city of Sarasota, THREE RINGLING CIRCUS is divided into three sections: The history of Sarasota, the story of the Ringlings and the Ringling effect on the city.  The book covers everything from the early days of the natives, Blacks and settlers to the origins of the Ringling family and ahead-of-their-time ways of developing their circus to the massive amounts of finagling that went into the creation of the Art Museum and Ca d’Zan. The book bears witness to the Ringlings’ fabulous lifestyle, their behind-the-scenes heartbreak and triumph and often Machiavellian grab for wealth and power.

Title: ¡Juguemos Lotería! Let’s play Lotería! (Bilingüe / Bilingual)
Description:
Únase a nosotros para jugar Lotería. Los juegos se jugarán tanto en español como en inglés, ¡así que todos pueden unirse para tener la oportunidad de ganar algunos premios!

Join us to play Lotería, a traditional game of chance similar to bingo which is enjoyed by many in Latin-American countries. Games will be played in both Spanish and English, so everyone is welcome to join for a chance to win some prizes!

Title: Caught Red Handed Book Club - Abandoned in the Everglades by Faye Henderson
Description:
Love tea shops and quilts and plucky, sleuthing, intelligent characters? Want to read captivating murder mysteries without the gross parts? Join us for a spirited discussion each month in our Cozy Murder Mystery Book Club!  Tea provided.

 

Abandoned in the Everglades by Faye Henderson

Janene Ramsey's decision to resign her teaching position in Ohio and move to Florida to get away from her cheating ex-boyfriend, is the first of many dangerous choices. When she stumbles upon a murdered woman, and the police are moving too slow to solve it, she starts her own investigation. But the killer will stop at nothing to keep his identity a secret. And Janene finds herself running for her life. In this first book of a new Cozy Mystery series, the story takes a turn into the Florida Everglades that is beyond frightening, but it’s all done with a load of laughs from an ensemble cast of quirky-fun characters.(from Amazon.)

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

Title: Cupid's Corner Romance Book Club
Description:
Romance readers, 18+, will meet to discuss the genre. Members will choose their own titles based on monthly themes. Let’s bond over our favorite sub-genres, tropes, groveling heroes/heroines, grand gestures, and happily ever afters! What moments make you swoon and sigh?

The theme for February is CLINCH COVERS. “Clinch cover” is the term for the iconic, instantly recognizable cover style featuring two leads embracing. In honor of Valentine’s Day, celebrate their impact on the genre and their relevance today by reading a romance with your favorite clinch cover (bonus points if it has a stepback!).

Title: Creative Aging: Figurative Drawing
Description:
Figurative art, sometimes written as figurativism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. Join teaching artist, Kamalee Harris, for this exciting course.

Sign up for this first class and you will be automatically enrolled in all four classes. Students are expected at each class.

Students are encouraged to bring their drawing own supplies.  Paper will be provided.

Class 1- Learning about drawing from life. 

Class 2 – The human form and interpreting movement.

Class 3 – Learning the art of drawing draping materials.

Class 4 – Putting the lessons on paper.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

Title: 'Murder by the Book' Book Club: Daisy Darker, by Alice Feeney
Description: After years of avoiding each other, Daisy Darker’s entire family is assembling for Nana’s 80th birthday party in Nana’s crumbling gothic house on a tiny tidal island. Finally back together one last time, when the tide comes in, they will be cut off from the rest of the world for eight hours. The family arrives, each of them harboring secrets. Then at the stroke of midnight, as a storm rages, Nana is found dead. And an hour later, the next family member follows…With a wicked wink to Agatha Christie’s And Then There Were None, Daisy Darker’s unforgettable twists will leave readers reeling. (Good Reads)

Title: Author Talk: Three Ringling Circus by Sandra Gurvis
Description:
Sarasota would not be what it is today without the influence of the Ringling family, particularly John Ringling and his wife Mable. 

Focusing on two main “characters,” John Ringling and his family, and the city of Sarasota, THREE RINGLING CIRCUS is divided into three sections: The history of Sarasota, the story of the Ringlings and the Ringling effect on the city.  The book covers everything from the early days of the natives, Blacks and settlers to the origins of the Ringling family and ahead-of-their-time ways of developing their circus to the massive amounts of finagling that went into the creation of the Art Museum and Ca d’Zan. The book bears witness to the Ringlings’ fabulous lifestyle, their behind-the-scenes heartbreak and triumph and often Machiavellian grab for wealth and power.
Categories: FLORIDA, History & Genealogy, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Mah Jongg
Description:
If you want to play Mah Jongg, the library is a place you can go for that! On Tuesdays from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm there is Mah Jongg. Take the time and mark Tuesday on your calendar and come out and meet new people and play Mah Jongg.  

Players are encouraged to wear masks. 

Sponsored by the Friends of Rocky Bluff Library.

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Description: Mah Jongg Club for experienced players. This program is intended for those who already know how to play.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Manatee County Historical Society Talk
Description: Join us the society presents a speaker who will talk about some aspect of local Manatee County history. This month USF student Madilyn Frick wil discuss the history of Rye Preserve in eastern Manatee County. Ms, Frick has recently completed a research paper on the early pioneer settlement and the current park preserve.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rocky Bluff Trivia NIght
Description: Trivia night returns to Rocky Bluff Library! Bring a team or join a team.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Book Discussion Group: The Vaster Wilds, by Lauren Groff
Description: A taut and electrifying novel from celebrated bestselling author Lauren Groff, about one spirited girl alone in the wilderness, trying to survive. Lauren Groff’s new novel is at once a thrilling adventure story and a penetrating fable about trying to find a new way of living in a world succumbing to the churn of colonialism. The Vaster Wilds is a work of raw and prophetic power that tells the story of America in miniature, through one girl at a hinge point in history, to ask how—and if—we can adapt quickly enough to save ourselves. (Goodreads)

Title: Gardening Club
Description:
Join us at the Palmetto Library to help weed, plant, and maintain the new library learning garden! Water, gardening gloves, and some tools provided, but feel free to bring your own, too. 
All ages welcome, but 12 and under need parent/guardian to participate with them. Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library. 
*May be cancelled at any time due to unforeseen circumstances.

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club - The Wish by Nicholas Sparks
Description:
1996 was the year that changed everything for Maggie Dawes. Sent away at sixteen to live with an aunt she barely knew in Ocracoke, a remote village on North Carolina’s Outer Banks, she could think only of the friends and family she left behind . . . until she met Bryce Trickett, one of the few teenagers on the island. Handsome, genuine, and newly admitted to West Point, Bryce showed her how much there was to love about the wind-swept beach town—and introduced her to photography, a passion that would define the rest of her life.

By 2019, Maggie is a renowned travel photographer. She splits her time between running a successful gallery in New York and photographing remote locations around the world. But this year she is unexpectedly grounded over Christmas, struggling to come to terms with a sobering medical diagnosis. Increasingly dependent on a young assistant, she finds herself becoming close to him.

As they count down the last days of the season together, she begins to tell him the story of another Christmas, decades earlier—and the love that set her on a course she never could have imagined. (from Amazon)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

Title: Tech Class: Write to the Point--Creating Letters,  Resumes, and Other Communication
Description: Learn the basics of creating digital documents using word processing software such as Microsoft Word, Google Docs, and Open Office. Bring along your laptop and be ready for hands on practice. A few devices are available to borrow for those with desktop computers. If you want to play Mah Jongg, the library is a place you can go for that! On Tuesdays from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm there is Mah Jongg. Take the time and mark Tuesday on your calendar and come out and meet new people and play Mah Jongg.

Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.

Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Homecoming: Black History in Florida
Description: Join us on an immersive journey into Black history, music, and communities in Florida. Explore the rich cultural heritage of African Americans, spanning various eras and genres of music. This program is a unique opportunity to celebrate and learn about the profound impact of Black culture on the Sunshine State.

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Tech Class: Make it Official--PDFs and Other Digital Document Software

Title: The Art Corner: Watercolor Painting with Ken Snyder
Description:
The Art Corner is a space for all artists and aspiring artists to socialize, share, and create. Creativity and camaraderie around the corner!

This week: learn watercolor techniques from award-winning artist Ken Snyder. Beginners to professionals are invited to come and learn.

Mr. Snyder has been an artist and professional art teacher for over 30 years. He and his daughter, Kim, are the authors of the coffee table book “There’s a Goose In My Bed”, and were featured on ABC Action News in 2022. 

Basic supplies will be provided, but artists are encouraged to bring their own supplies.

Description:
Join Áit Shona PC Yoga’s instructor Laura McHugh on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Join us on Thursday, March 7th, 14th, and 28th for Basic Yoga on the rooftop and Rooftop Yoga with SHACK yoga + fitness on March 21st!

Description:
Meet us at the Leffis Key Preserve on Anna Maria Island!

We will discuss a nature themed nonfiction book with a Manatee County Librarian while enjoying Florida's scenery. After our book discussion, a Manatee County Parks & Natural Resources guide will talk about the local fauna and flora as we walk around the preserve at a leisurely pace. 

Hike with a Librarian programs involve easier walks through local preserves. Further instruction on the meet-up spot and trails will be emailed closer to the event date. 

Book title: Secrets of the manatee : an insider's guide to Florida's most iconic marine mammal (By: Diane Morgan)

Title: Caught Red Handed Book Club - Birder She Wrote by Donna Andrews
Description:
Love tea shops and quilts and plucky, sleuthing, intelligent characters? Want to read captivating murder mysteries without the gross parts? Join us for a spirited discussion each month in our Cozy Murder Mystery Book Club!  Tea provided.

 

Birder She Wrote by Donna Andrews

Meg is relaxing in the hammock, taste-testing Michael’s latest batch of Arnold Palmers and watching the hummingbirds at their feeders when her hopes for a relaxing early summer morning are dashed.

First her father recruits her to help him install a new batch of bees in the hive in her backyard. Then Mayor Shiffley recruits her to placate the NIMBYs (Not in my backyard), as she calls them – a group of newcomers to Caerphilly who have built McMansions next door to working farms and then do their best to make life miserable for the farmers. And finally Meg’s grandmother, shows up, trailed by a nosy reporter who is writing a feature on her for a genteel Southern ladies’ magazine.

Cordelia drafts Meg to accompany her and Deacon Washington of the New Life Baptist Church – and the reporter, alas – in their search for a long-lost African-American cemetery. Unfortunately what they discover is not an ancient cemetery but a fresh corpse. Can Meg protect her grandmother – and Caerphilly – from the reporter who seems to see the worst in everything . . . and help crack the case before the killer finds another victim. (from Amazon).

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia

The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

Title: Author Talk: Three Ringling Circus by Sandra Gurvis
Description:
Sarasota would not be what it is today without the influence of the Ringling family, particularly John Ringling and his wife Mable. 

Focusing on two main “characters,” John Ringling and his family, and the city of Sarasota, THREE RINGLING CIRCUS is divided into three sections: The history of Sarasota, the story of the Ringlings and the Ringling effect on the city.  The book covers everything from the early days of the natives, Blacks and settlers to the origins of the Ringling family and ahead-of-their-time ways of developing their circus to the massive amounts of finagling that went into the creation of the Art Museum and Ca d’Zan. The book bears witness to the Ringlings’ fabulous lifestyle, their behind-the-scenes heartbreak and triumph and often Machiavellian grab for wealth and power.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia

Title: Creative Aging: Figurative Drawing Series
Description:
This class is for those who have attended the beginning drawing class as well as those who have a little experience in drawing. We will explore figurative art. Figurative art, sometimes written as figuratism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. Class #1 will focus on learning about drawing from life.

Students are encouraged to bring their own drawing supplies. Paper will be provided.

Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

If you sew, come join them as they look for opportunities to give, using their talents, time, and interest.

Title: Hike with a Librarian--Conservatory Park
Description:
Meet us at Conservatory Park for an accessible walk/hike (this trail is fully paved)! 

Address: 8027 Conservatory Dr, Sarasota, FL 34243

Discuss a nature themed nonfiction book with a Manatee County Librarian while enjoying Florida's scenery. After our book discussion, a Manatee County Parks & Natural Resources guide will talk about the local fauna and flora as we walk around the preserve at a leisurely pace. 

Hike with a Librarian programs involve easier walks through local preserves. Further instruction on the meet-up spot and trails will be emailed closer to the event date. 

Theme: Plants

Read one of the following books for our plant discussion:

Trees, leaves, flowers & seeds : a visual encyclopedia of the plant kingdom

The secret world of plants : tales of more than 100 remarkable flowers, trees, and seeds
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Starting with Podcasting

Description: Bring a mat, 2 yoga blocks, and wear clothes you can stretch and move in. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified yoga teacher.

Title: Author Talk: Seeing Colors, by Tirena Say
Description: The Author was told she would probably never work again, that the odds were against her ever living a normal life, that in all likelihood she would get sick again, and end up in a psychiatric ward for the rest of her life. Somehow, Tirena brought herself back from this bleak future of mental and emotional sickness. This is a true, turn-around story of how a young woman brought herself back – not just back to a level of normal functioning – but to enjoy a prosperous, joyous, and happy life that anyone would want. Seeing Colors tells you her inspiring story, but also how you can do it too!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Happy Birthday, Dr. Seuss!
Description: Celebrate Dr. Seuss' birthday with crafts and other activities!

Title: Sisters in Crime: Murder & Mysteries in Paradise
Description:
From cozy to hard-boiled, from greed to love betrayed, what is it about murder that makes mysteries an enduring reader's favorite? The Braden River Library has put together a panel of talented mystery authors from the Florida Gulf Coast Chapter of Sisters in Crime. Join them  in exploring the mystery genre’s search for truth and justice in a world of secrets and lies. Come early to meet and greet authors, then settle in for a great panel discussion of the genre. FREE. Enjoy refreshments, book sales, and drawings for prizes, including copies of the chapter’s anthology, MURDER IN PARADISE. No registration required, but you can earn an extra prize drawing entry by signing up for event reminders here:

www.meetup.com/florida-gulf-coast-chapter-of-sisters-in-crime/events/297044409/
Categories: Creative Writing, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks, Reader's Advisory

Title: Juicing, Nutrition, and Health
Description: The Desautels will be here to discuss the benefits of juicing as well as touching on food moderation, eating healthy, reading food labels, and more. They will be demonstrating juicing and will have samples available to taste. Participants are encouraged to bring their own fruits and vegetables to juice during the presentation. Please bring your own containers if you plan to do this. Dr. Barb has a computer science background with homeopathy and aroma therapy among her hobbies. Mr. Desautels is a registered nurse, with experience in cardiac care, and as a home-based primary care nurse for the U.S. Veterans Health Administration.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Create a Coiled Flower Spring Coaster

This hands-on crafting experience invites you to explore the art of coiling to create a stunning, vibrant flower-shaped coaster. Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Description: In the digital age where a seemingly infinite amount of information is at our fingertips, it is important to learn skills to keep yourself safe. Learn how to stay secure as you are using your email, navigating the internet, and even as you are sending and receiving calls and text messages
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Manatee County Historical Society Talk: "Miguel's Bay" Discussion and Author Event
Description: Join us as the society presents a speaker who will talk about some aspect of local Manatee County history. This month local historians and authors Peggy Donoho and Ron Prouty will be here to discuss their recent book "Miguel's Bay", a historical novel that takes place in the early pioneering days of Manatee County. They will also have copies of the book available to purchase and will be signing them.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Book Discussion Group: Angela's Ashes, by Frank McCourt
Description: So begins the Pulitzer Prize winning memoir of Frank McCourt, born in Depression-era Brooklyn to recent Irish immigrants and raised in the slums of Limerick, Ireland. Angela's Ashes, imbued on every page with Frank McCourt's astounding humor and compassion, is a glorious book that bears all the marks of a classic. (Goodreads)Set in the mountains of southern Appalachia, this is the story of a boy born to a teenaged single mother in a single-wide trailer, with no assets beyond his dead father's good looks and copper-colored hair, a caustic wit, and a fierce talent for survival. In a plot that never pauses for breath, relayed in his own unsparing voice, he braves the modern perils of foster care, child labor, derelict schools, athletic success, addiction, disastrous loves, and crushing losses. Through all of it, he reckons with his own invisibility in a popular culture where even the superheroes have abandoned rural people in favor of cities. (Goodreads)

Title: Gardening Club
Description:
Join us at the Palmetto Library to help weed, plant, and maintain the new library learning garden! Water, gardening gloves, and some tools provided, but feel free to bring your own, too. 
All ages welcome, but 12 and under need parent/guardian to participate with them. Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library. 
*May be cancelled at any time due to unforeseen circumstances.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Chair Yoga

Title: Creative Aging: Figurative Drawing Series
Description:
This class is for those who have attended the beginning drawing class as well as those who have a little experience in drawing. We will explore figurative art. Figurative art, sometimes written as figuratism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. Class #1 will focus on learning about drawing from life.

Students are encouraged to bring their own drawing supplies. Paper will be provided.

Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Art Instruction

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club - The Kingdoms of Savannah by George Dawes Green
Description:
It begins quietly on a balmy Southern night as some locals gather at Bo Peep’s, one of the town’s favorite watering holes. Within an hour, however, a man will be murdered and his companion will be “disappeared.” An unlikely detective, Morgana Musgrove, doyenne of Savannah society, is called upon to unravel the mystery of these crimes. Morgana is an imperious, demanding, and conniving woman, whose four grown children are weary of her schemes. But one by one she inveigles them into helping with her investigation, and soon the family uncovers some terrifying truths—truths that will rock Savannah’s power structure to its core.

Moving from the homeless encampments that ring the city to the stately homes of Savannah’s elite, Green’s novel brilliantly depicts the underbelly of a city with a dark history and the strangely mesmerizing dysfunction of a complex family. (from Amazon)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.

Title: 'Murder by the Book' Book Club: Everyone Here is Lying, by Shari Lapena
Description: William Wooler is a family man, on the surface. But he's been having an affair, an affair that ended horribly this afternoon at a motel up the road. So when he returns to his house, devastated and angry, to find his difficult nine-year-old daughter Ella unexpectedly home from school, William loses his temper. Hours later, Ella's family declare her missing. As witnesses come forward with information that may or may not be true, Ella's neighbors become increasingly unhinged. Who took Ella Wooler? (Good Reads)

Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Musical Motion
Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Description:
Come join us in this introductory workshop to explore the basics of mindfulness meditation:  Its theory and practice as well as its physical, mental and spiritual benefits.  All levels are welcome.  Taught by Manching Tom, certified Meditation Teacher.  Registration is required.  

Consider bringing a cushion or pillow for additional support in your chair.  This is optional.

***Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed for this workshop.

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: A Forgotten People, A Forgotten Place: The Story of Rye
Description: Celebrate Manatee Heritage Days by learning some local history! This presentation will follow the history of Rye, a ghost town in East Manatee County, from its beginnings in the late 1800s through the present day. You will also learn about the key individuals from the settlement's story, the years following the end of the town, the physical reminders of the past, and about the area as it exists in the modern day.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Chair Yoga

Title: Creative Aging: Figurative Drawing Series
Description:
This class is for those who have attended the beginning drawing class as well as those who have a little experience in drawing. We will explore figurative art. Figurative art, sometimes written as figuratism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. Class #1 will focus on learning about drawing from life.

Students are encouraged to bring their own drawing supplies. Paper will be provided.

Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Art Instruction

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Coral Reef Science with Mote
Description:
Dive into the captivating world of coral reef research with ocean experts from Mote Marine Laboratory. In this immersive program we explore the science, wonders, and challenges of restoring these fragile ecosystems. We will uncover the latest research, innovative techniques, and successful efforts to save Florida's iconic coral reefs. Discover the unique biodiversity, economic impact, and ecological importance of our reefs through stunning visuals, compelling storytelling, and interactive discussions. Whether you're an ocean lover, a conservation advocate, or simply curious about the fascinating world of coral reefs, this presentation is a must-attend event.

Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library

Title: Supporting Our Families Educational Seminar
Description:
Join a representative from Groover Funeral Home for a candid conversation about making final arrangements in advance. When you plan ahead, you make your wishes known and ease the way for the people who love you. Though you can’t protect your family from grief, you can help lessen their burden.

What to expect:

* Learn how and what to prepare.

* Review frequently asked questions.

* Discover resources to help you through a time of loss.

Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers' social skills, language skills, motor skills, and more.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Create a Coiled Flower Spring Coaster
Description: Embark on a creative journey with our Coiled Flower Spring Coaster Workshop! This hands-on crafting experience invites you to explore the art of coiling to create a stunning, vibrant flower-shaped coaster. Learn the intricacies of shaping and arranging the coil into beautiful floral patterns, resulting in a unique and functional coaster that adds a touch of elegance to any space. Perfect for beginners and crafting enthusiasts alike, this workshop promises a delightful blend of creativity and craftsmanship. Join us and coil your way to a beautiful floral coaster! Space is limited.

Title: Mindfulness Meditation
Description:
Join author/instructor Ruth Fishel to learn how to incorporate mindfulness meditation into your life. 

Audience: 18+

Title: Rock Garden Rock Painting
Description:
Join local artist volunteer Cheryl to paint beautiful rocks to add to our very own Island Library Rock Garden! Learn how to get involved in this global kindness project to paint rocks and hide around the community. All materials provided!

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description: One-on-One tech assistance: Androids, iPhones, tablets, laptops, e-books/audiobooks, and more. NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: Beginning Line Dancing
Description: Join dance Instructor Chako Isgro for a fun-filled ninety minutes of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Book Talk: A Book Club for Teens
Description: Come and hang out with other teens to discuss what you’re reading right now and make a book-related craft! Snacks will be provided.

Title: Manatee County Utilities
Description:
Need help accessing the new Manatee County Utilities' Customer Service Portal? In-Service Assistance will be available at our Central Library every Saturday in March.

Please, bring your utilities "upgrade" letter , if you received one in the mail.

Any questions, please call the Utilities customer service team at 941-792-8811, ext. 5399.

Title: Manatee Patchworkers
Description: Manatee Patchworkers is a group of quilters ranging from beginner to expert how make items such as quilts, dog beds, cat mats, and other items to donate to local groups. Come help us make things for those in need!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga at the Lakewood Ranch Library
Description:
Join Áit Shona PC Yoga’s instructor Laura McHugh on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Join us on Thursday, March 28th for Basic Yoga on the rooftop and Thursday, April 18th for Rooftop Yoga with SHACK yoga + fitness!

Title: Ask a Master Gardener!
Description: A Master Gardener with the Manatee County Extension Office will have a table set up in the library's lobby to answer your gardening questions.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: History Talk - Rough and Tumble Women of Manatee County
Description:
Step back in time with librarian Katie Fleck to meet the fearless and determined women who shaped the rugged landscape of Manatee County. In this hour-long program, we will delve into the lives of the women who were instrumental in the region’s agriculture, cattle ranching, and rodeo traditions.

Katie Fleck is a graduate of the University of South Florida with MAs in History and Library Science. She has worked in Information Services for the Manatee County Public Library since 2018. Katie is a native of Manatee County, Florida and has a passion for local history.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Intro to Computers 3
Description: A more comprehensive examination of email and internet searching, the different parts of web pages, and the best tools for emailing, searching, and finding whatever you need!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Read to a Dog
Description: Come visit the Kids Space at the Lakewood Ranch Library and read to a certified therapy dog! Perfect for those who want to practice and build their literacy skills in a low-stress environment.
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Families

Title: Read 2 Dogs
Description: Come read to our Florida Therapy Dogs: They love to listen!   All ages: No Reservations needed/ Literacy based.

Title: Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 yoga blocks, and wear clothes you can stretch and move in. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified yoga teacher.

Title: Arte y Manualidades: Crea tu Propia Candela
Description: Utilice cera de soya y aceites esenciales para crear su vela personalizada. ¡Traiga su propio recipiente único o use un frasco de vidrio que le proporcionamos!

Title: Art + Book = Create
Description: Kids, join us as we learn about Concentric circles through Peter H. Reynolds’ book, the Dot” and make our own masterpiece!

Title: STEAM Saturday
Description: Each month we’ll bring out a fun new science, technology, engineering, art, or math activity. We’ll also have Legos and crafts!

Title: Family Movie Day – A Goofy Movie (PG)
Description: It’s Day 1 of the Rocky Bluff Spring Break Week. Join us for popcorn and lemonade and a showing of A Goofy Movie (rated PG). Feel free to bring your own snacks too. We will start the movie at 9:30, so feel free to arrive a bit early to find a good seat.
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years)

Title: AARP Tax Help
Description: Representatives from AARP will be on hand to help prepare your tax return. Priority for tax preparation service will be given to those who make appointments. Walk-ins may not be served depending upon availability of a volunteer tax preparer. To schedule an appointment go on-line to: www.AARP.org/findtaxhelp. Librarians at Manatee County libraries are available to help you make an appointment.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Title: Gentle Yoga
Description:
Enjoy this gentler style of hatha yoga practice with yoga instructor, Delphine. Gentle Yoga is performed at a slower pace, with less intense positions, and usually includes extended time for meditation, yogic breath work, and relaxation.

Please, bring your own mat.

Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. For ages 0-5!

You must have knowledge of 10 basic chords andknow how to shuffle strum and island strum.  We will be learning Chuck and country strumming.  The instructor will aslo add new chords and new songs.

If you want to play Mah Jongg, the library is a place you can go for that! On Tuesdays from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm there is Mah Jongg. Take the time and mark Tuesday on your calendar and come out and meet new people and play Mah Jongg.  

Players are encouraged to wear masks. 

Sponsored by the Friends of Rocky Bluff Library.

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.

Title: Building Your Imaginarium
Description: This class will help you rediscover the creative spirit that lives within each of us. Join us as we use visual journaling, found images, acrylic paint, and recycled materials to build a container for creativity. You'll learn how to use your Imaginarium for self-discovery, planning, healing, and creating anything new. No art or writing experience is necessary.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Memoir Group
Description: Join other memoir writers working on personal stories. This collaborative group of writers contribute stories and provide a friendly supportive working team. Registration is for all sessions.

Title: Mario Kart Tournament
Description:
Come join us for a kart-tastic time in the Teen & YA Room at the Lakewood Ranch Library! You will be competing to see who the first Mario Kart Champion of our first biannual Mario Kart Tournament is. Sign up ahead of time to ensure your spot in the race. A medal will be given to the winner! Participation prizes will be handed out as well. 

Race Rules are as follows: 


	Must be 13-17 years old to participate 
	No smart steering/auto acceleration allowed 
	Races will be set to 150cc 
	If a competitor is found to be disrespectful to the game or their fellow competitors, they may be subject to disqualification
Presenter: Miranda Johnson, Hayley Rigatti, Julia Richardson

Title: Marvel Trivia
Description: Calling all Marvel fans! Test your knowledge with some fun marvel trivia!

Title: Welcome to Our World: Forty Carrots
Description: Support for new parents navigating the newborn phase with topics and information.

Description: Representatives from AARP will be on hand to help prepare your tax return. Priority for tax preparation service will be given to those who make appointments. Walk-ins may not be served depending upon availability of a volunteer tax preparer. To schedule an appointment go on-line to: www.AARP.org/findtaxhelp. Description: Come into the Makerspace and play some of your favorite board games with friends and soon-to-be friends!

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Game Night
Description: Come join us as we play cool games and take part in occasional tournaments.

Description: It’s Day 3 of the Rocky Bluff Spring Break Week. Join us for a live animal presentation with Wildlife Inc. and learn about owls, snakes, and tortoises.
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years)

Title: Bilingual Preschool Storytime
Description: Join us for a fun-filled hour of English and Spanish stories, music, dancing, and crafts! No registration required.

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Creative Aging: Figurative Drawing Series
Description:
This class is for those who have attended the beginning drawing class as well as those who have a little experience in drawing. We will explore figurative art. Figurative art, sometimes written as figuratism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. Class #1 will focus on learning about drawing from life.

Students are encouraged to bring their own drawing supplies. Paper will be provided.

Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Art Instruction

Title: Drop-in Art
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 AM for a simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Join Miss Chris for stories and fun! 

Limited to 40 children

Title: Downsizing and Decluttering: You Can't Take it with You
Description: Having too much stuff can impede people from relocating or getting health care into their homes. This engaging presentation explores why stuff is so important for some people and teaches practical, easy-to follow tips on downsizing and decluttering. Learn how to get started!

Title: 70s Aerobics
Description: Get your disco groove on with this exciting aerobics class!

Title: Meditation to De-Stress
Description:
The program is for anyone interested in learning to meditate.  It is geared to beginners, however, experienced meditators are welcomed to join and share their experience.



The class is designed to be ongoing and you do not have to attend the first class to participate.  It is non-denominational and meditations are done in silence.



The scope of the program will be mindfulness meditation--a method that is popular and easy to learn.  The instructor, Jim Angerame, is an experienced meditator who has taught the program for a number of years.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Description: Come make your own comic book! Design your own character and story.

Title: Vincent van Gogh: Genius in the Service of Art
Description:
Join us as Nick Hauser presents on Vincent van Gogh: Genius in the Service of Art! Vincent van Gogh was a Post-Impressionist Dutch painter who only sold one painting while he lived. His work today is remarkable for its vibrancy and color. Learn more about his life, his vibrant color theories, his use of textile swatches and colored balls of twine. Discover new facets of his Studio of the South, a cooperative effort with the bigger than life Paul Gauguin. Van Gogh’s career was short but he left the world many jewels that are cherished everywhere. 

Sponsored by the Friends of the Lakewood Ranch Library. Space is limited of 84 guests.
Categories: Art & Art History, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library
