Title: Caught Red Handed Book Club - Cat Me if You Can by Miranda James
Description:
Love tea shops and quilts and plucky, sleuthing, intelligent characters? Want to read captivating murder mysteries without the gross parts? Join us for a spirited discussion each month in our Cozy Murder Mystery Book Club!  Tea provided.

 

Cat Me if You Can by Miranda James

Charlie and Diesel along with Charlie's fiancée, Helen Louise Brady, are heading to Asheville, North Carolina to spend a week at a boutique hotel and participate in a gathering of a mystery reader's club composed of patrons of the Athena Public Library. In addition to seeing the local sights, the members will take turns giving talks on their favorite authors. 

The always spry Ducote sisters, friends of the hotel’s owners, are helping underwrite the expenses, and they’ve insisted that Charlie, Helen, and Diesel join them. Anxious to get Helen Louise away from her bistro for a vacation, Charlie readily agrees. While Charlie is looking forward to relaxing with Helen Louise and Diesel, other members of the group have ulterior motives including a long-standing score to settle.

When an intrusive, uninvited guest turns up dead, only one mystery club member with a connection to the deceased appears to have a motive to kill. But could the answer really be that simple? Charlie and Diesel, along with the detecting Ducote sisters, know that every murder plot has an unexpected twist. (from Amazon).

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

To register, call 800-272-3900.

Title: Books on Tap Book Club
Description:
Books on Tap is a monthly book club that meets at 3 Keys Brewing & Eatery, 2505 Manatee Ave. E. in Bradenton. We have a very informal and relaxed setup. Come ready to talk about any book you’re reading, ask for recommendations, or just enjoy some bookish company. 

Anyone 21 and up is welcome to join us!

Enjoy good books, good beer, and good conversation!

Title: Claude Monet: Impressionist Genius
Description: Join us as Nick Hauser presents on Claude Monet: Impressionist Genius! Claude Monet was an Impressionist painter who started out in Normandy. Learn about the roots of Impressionism, Monet’s use of color, his critical relationship with his brother, who owned a new coal tar dyeworks. One hundred years before Andy Warhol, Claude Monet serialized his painting, painting large series of landscapes at Etretat, haystacks, poplar trees, church facades under different light and finally water lilies in a pond. His final works set the stage for the revolution called Modern Art. Sponsored by the Friends of the Lakewood Ranch Library.
Categories: Art & Art History, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Hike with a Librarian programs involve easier walks through local preserves. Further instruction on the meet-up spot and trails will be emailed closer to the event date. 

Book title: The secret life of fungi : discoveries from a hidden world

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Manatee County Historical Society Talk: Movie Theaters of Manatee County

Title: 'Rethinking Libraries' Community Meeting

Title: Author Talk: Three Ringling Circus by Sandra Gurvis
Description:
Sarasota would not be what it is today without the influence of the Ringling family, particularly John Ringling and his wife Mable. 

Focusing on two main “characters,” John Ringling and his family, and the city of Sarasota, THREE RINGLING CIRCUS is divided into three sections: The history of Sarasota, the story of the Ringlings and the Ringling effect on the city.  The book covers everything from the early days of the natives, Blacks and settlers to the origins of the Ringling family and ahead-of-their-time ways of developing their circus to the massive amounts of finagling that went into the creation of the Art Museum and Ca d’Zan. The book bears witness to the Ringlings’ fabulous lifestyle, their behind-the-scenes heartbreak and triumph and often Machiavellian grab for wealth and power.
Categories: FLORIDA, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks

Title: Rocky Bluff Trivia NIght

Title: Book Discussion Group: Yellowface, by R.F. Kuang
Description: Authors June Hayward and Athena Liu were supposed to be twin rising stars: same year at Yale, same debut year in publishing. But Athena's a cross-genre literary darling, and June didn't even get a paperback release. Nobody wants stories about basic white girls, June thinks. So when June witnesses Athena's death in a freak accident, she acts on impulse: she steals Athena's just-finished masterpiece, an experimental novel about the unsung contributions of Chinese laborers to the British and French war efforts during World War I. So what if June edits Athena's novel and sends it to her agent as her own work? So what if she lets her new publisher rebrand her as Juniper Song--complete with an ambiguously ethnic author photo? Doesn't this piece of history deserve to be told, whoever the teller? That's what June claims, and the New York Times bestseller list seems to agree. But June can't get away from Athena's shadow, and emerging evidence threatens to bring June's (stolen) success down around her. As June races to protect her secret, she discovers exactly how far she will go to keep what she thinks she deserves. (Goodreads)

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club - 44 Scotland Street by Alexander McCall Smith
Description:
Welcome to 44 Scotland Street, home to some of Edinburgh's most colorful characters. There's Pat, a twenty-year-old who has recently moved into a flat with Bruce, an athletic young man with a keen awareness of his own appearance. Their neighbor, Domenica, is an eccentric and insightful widow. In the flat below are Irene and her appealing son Bertie, who is the victim of his mother’s desire for him to learn the saxophone and italian–all at the tender age of five.

Love triangles, a lost painting, intriguing new friends, and an encounter with a famous Scottish crime writer are just a few of the ingredients that add to this delightful and witty portrait of Edinburgh society, which was first published as a serial in The Scotsman newspaper. (from Amazon)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: 'Murder by the Book' Book Club: None of This is True, by Lisa Jewell
Description: Celebrating her forty-fifth birthday at her local pub, popular podcaster Alix Summers crosses paths with an unassuming woman called Josie Fair. Josie, it turns out, is also celebrating her forty-fifth birthday. They are, in fact, birthday twins. A few days later, Alix and Josie bump into each other again, this time outside Alix’s children’s school. Josie has been listening to Alix’s podcasts and thinks she might be an interesting subject for her series. Josie’s life appears to be strange and complicated, and although Alix finds her unsettling, she can’t quite resist the temptation to keep making the podcast. Slowly she starts to realize that Josie has been hiding some very dark secrets, and before she knows it, Josie has inveigled her way into Alix’s life—and into her home. But, as quickly as she arrived, Josie disappears. Only then does Alix discover that Josie has left a terrible and terrifying legacy in her wake, and that Alix has become the subject of her own true crime podcast, with her life and her family’s lives under mortal threat. Who is Josie Fair? And what has she done? (Goodreads)

Title: Aspiring Authors Club for Teens
Description:
An informal and casual teen writer’s monthly workshop that allows young people the opportunity to grow both as writers and readers. Teens will participate in fun prompts and exercises and while sharing is encouraged, it is never mandatory.


Workshop will be led by Teen Librarian, Rachel Scharbo, who holds a Bachelor of Arts in Writing and Rhetoric.

Title: Manatee County Utilities
Description:
Need help accessing the new Manatee County Utilities' Customer Service Portal? In-Service Assistance will be available at our Central Library every Saturday in March.

Please, bring your utilities "upgrade" letter , if you received one in the mail.

Any questions, please call the Utilities customer service team at 941-792-8811, ext. 5399.

Title: Yarn Power Hour
Description: Collaborate and create with others in this dynamic knitting/crochet club! All levels welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: American Sewing Guild
Description: This community sewing guild is associated with the Sarasota Gulf Coast Chapter of the American Sewing Guild. The "Creative Sassy Sewers," as they call themselves, make items for anyone in need: babies, children, adults, seniors, and pets! If you sew, come join them as they look for opportunities to give, using their talents, time, and interest.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga at the Lakewood Ranch Library
Description:
Join Áit Shona PC Yoga’s instructor Laura McHugh on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat and registration is required, thank you!

Join us on Thursday, April 18th for Rooftop Yoga with SHACK yoga + fitness!

Title: Ask a Master Gardener!

Description:
Birds of a feather read together! Join us to chat about nature-themed books and a walk with an Audubon education representative. All ages are welcome to join with their families! 

Participants will meet at Felts Audubon Preserve: 4600 24th Ave. E, Palmetto, FL 34221.

Title: Investing Basics
Description: Join volunteers from BetterInvesting to learn the importance of investing in achieving your retirement dreams. As April is Financial Literacy month, use this opportunity to learn about the stock market and why time is of the essence.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Description:
Enjoy this free community program geared towards pre-school and elementary school aged children and their families to engage in mindfulness activities and create art in all its various forms. Local teaching artists guide participants in activities, make-and-take art projects, and read-alongs. 

Each event includes a free, healthy lunch for the whole family, and each child will receive free books to help build their at home library, and a special prize to take home at the end of the day.

Title: Teen Advisory Board (TAB)
Description:
Want to have an impact on your library? We want to hear from YOU! Join the Teen Advisory Board to earn volunteer hours, build leadership experience, and get involved with your local libraries. Must be 16+ to receive volunteer hour credit.

Email Rachel Scharbo to apply: Rachel.scharbo@mymanatee.org

Title: Mat Pilates
Description:
Pilates training is a system of knowledge and exercises for anyone interested in improving core strength, flexibility, mobility, muscle balance, physical endurance, posture, effective breathing, and body awareness. 

This donation-based mat pilates class is designed for any age and fitness level, but does require participants to have the ability to move on and off the floor.

It is recommended that individuals bring 1-2 mats (as we will be lying and sitting on the ground) and comfortable and loose clothing. Optional equipment: Yoga blocks (for comfort while sitting), yoga socks, and an exercise band.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Read Around the Globe Book Club: The Orphan's Tale, by Pam Jennof
Description: A powerful novel of friendship set in a traveling circus during World War II, The Orphan's Tale introduces two extraordinary women and their harrowing stories of sacrifice and survival. Sixteen-year-old Noa has been cast out in disgrace after becoming pregnant by a Nazi soldier and being forced to give up her baby.

Title: Dollar-A-Day Boys: A Musical Tribute to the Civilian Conservation Corps
Description:
Did you know that the Civilian Conservation Corps built 15 Florida State Parks?

The Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) was a voluntary government work relief program that ran from 1933 to 1942 in the United States for unemployed, unmarried men ages 18–25 and eventually expanded to ages 17–28. A major part of President Franklin D Roosevelt's New Deal, the CCC supplied manual labor jobs related to the conservation and development of natural resources in rural lands owned by federal, state, and local governments to alleviate the effects of The Great Depression. (Wikipedia)

Entertainment Historian, Bill Jamerson, will discuss the CCC and provide a musical tribute to the boys of the CCC. According to him, "the story of the CCC has universal appeal because it's about underdogs who are given a second chance." Jamerson's presentation has been described as a cross between Woody Guthrie and Garrison Keillor. It's the oral tradition of sharing our national stories with humor, storytelling, and song.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Mat Pilates
Description:
Pilates training is a system of knowledge and exercises for anyone interested in improving core strength, flexibility, mobility, muscle balance, physical endurance, posture, effective breathing, and body awareness. 

This donation-based mat pilates class is designed for any age and fitness level, but does require participants to have the ability to move on and off the floor.

It is recommended that individuals bring 1-2 mats (as we will be lying and sitting on the ground) and comfortable and loose clothing. Optional equipment: Yoga blocks (for comfort while sitting), yoga socks, and an exercise band.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia

Please bring a yoga mat and registration is required, thank you!

Title: History Talk - Parrish: Past and Present
Description:
Join librarian Katie Fleck and dive into the rich history of Parrish, from its early days as a rural community to the vibrant town it is today.

Katie Fleck is a graduate of the University of South Florida with MAs in History and Library Science. She has worked in Information Services for the Manatee County Public Library since 2018. Katie is a native of Manatee County, Florida and has a passion for local history

Title: Sisters in Crime: An Afternoon of Thrills & Suspense
Description:
Danger, high stakes, twists, cliffhangers, action, and psychological suspense—do you enjoy these story elements in the books you read? If so, Braden River Library has put together a THRILLER of an afternoon for you. Join in the fun with authors from Florida Gulf Coast Sisters in Crime on Saturday, April 13 from 2-5 pm. Come early to meet and greet authors, then settle in for a gripping panel discussion of the genre. FREE. Enjoy refreshments, book sales, and drawings for prizes, including copies of the chapter’s anthology, MURDER IN PARADISE. No registration required, but you can earn an extra prize drawing entry by signing up for event reminders here: 

www.meetup.com/florida-gulf-coast-chapter-of-sisters-in-crime/events/297046794.
Categories: Creative Writing, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks, Reader's Advisory

Title: Creative Aging: Back to Basics --The Basics of Drawing
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a series of art classes focusing on the basics of drawing and color! Students will register once for the whole series.

This class is for beginners and not suitable for those who have taken previous classes with our teaching artist.

Those 55 and over who are able to attend all six classes are invited to register!

Classes include:

4/29 The Basics of Drawing – This class helps to build a foundation for students, so they understand composition, perspective, and shading.

5/6  Drawing Landscapes – The class works with the student to develop a landscape drawing in one sitting, helping them understand composition, perspective and shading.

5/13 Color Magic –Watercolor - This class helps the student understand color mixing, hues and values.  A small project should be completed by the end of the session.

5/20  Watercolor Student Project – The first part of the class is discussing watercolor techniques. The student should bring in an 8x10 photo of that they would like to paint.

6/3  Project Continuation – The student will work on their project with each student receiving individual help.

6/10 Finish Project – The student will complete the project and we will have a “show and tell”
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Mat Pilates
Description:
Pilates training is a system of knowledge and exercises for anyone interested in improving core strength, flexibility, mobility, muscle balance, physical endurance, posture, effective breathing, and body awareness. 

This donation-based mat pilates class is designed for any age and fitness level, but does require participants to have the ability to move on and off the floor.

It is recommended that individuals bring 1-2 mats (as we will be lying and sitting on the ground) and comfortable and loose clothing. Optional equipment: Yoga blocks (for comfort while sitting), yoga socks, and an exercise band.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle
Description:
Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn!

About Pinochle: Pinochle, also called pinocle or penuchle, is a trick-taking, Ace-Ten card game typically for two to four players and played with a 48-card deck. It is derived from the card game bezique; players score points by trick-taking and also by forming combinations of cards into melds. Wikipedia
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description:
Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources. 

To register, call 800-272-3900.

Title: Kick Start Your Creative Writing
Description:
Have you always wanted to write a memoir, novel, or short story, but don’t know how to get started? Attend this four-session workshop to learn the basics of crafting characters, plot, setting, and dialogue! Each session will include in-class writing prompts to help you go from ideas in your head to words on paper fast. Attendance for each week encouraged, but not required.

Week One: Story fundamentals & goal-setting

Week Two: Characters & dialogue

Week Three: Setting & description

Week Four: Revising & submitting

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: One Blood Bloodmobile
Description:
The One Blood Bus will be available in Palmetto Branch's north parking lot to all those who would like to donate blood.

Online appointments are encouraged.

To make an appointment to donate blood, please visit: https://donor.oneblood.org/donor/schedules/drive_schedule/1485381

There are health benefits of donating blood. Below are just a few of the Benefits:

1. A Healthier Heart System and Vascular System: Helps to decrease blood pressure

2. A Calorie-Free Snack – Your body burns about 500 calories while replacing the blood you donated

3. Lowers the Risk for: Liver, lung, colon, stomach and throat cancer

4. Stimulation of New Blood Cells – New Cells help to Oxygenate your body better.

5. Loss of Wight – You can lose 1% of your body weight

6. Iron – For those that have higher levels of iron, donating helps to decrease the level of iron to healthier level.

7. Cholesterol – Helps to reduce cholesterol levels

8.  Each donations helps to save up to  3 lives.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Creative Aging: Back to Basics --The Basics of Drawing
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a series of art classes focusing on the basics of drawing and color! Students will register once for the whole series.

This class is for beginners and not suitable for those who have taken previous classes with our teaching artist.

Those 55 and over who are able to attend all six classes are invited to register!

Classes include:

4/29 The Basics of Drawing – This class helps to build a foundation for students, so they understand composition, perspective, and shading.

5/6  Drawing Landscapes – The class works with the student to develop a landscape drawing in one sitting, helping them understand composition, perspective and shading.

5/13 Color Magic –Watercolor - This class helps the student understand color mixing, hues and values.  A small project should be completed by the end of the session.

5/20  Watercolor Student Project – The first part of the class is discussing watercolor techniques. The student should bring in an 8x10 photo of that they would like to paint.

6/3  Project Continuation – The student will work on their project with each student receiving individual help.

6/10 Finish Project – The student will complete the project and we will have a “show and tell”
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Title: Your Elder Superpower: Sharing Your Legacy
Description:
You are a rich chapter in your family history and by sharing yourself you will leave a legacy that will last for generations.   

In this interactive program you’ll learn the importance of gifting your family legacy. We’ll discuss ways to enhance the personal history experience by using photos and other prompts to enhance family history engagement. During this fun program we’ll explore other tools and methods for sharing personal history stories. You’ll come away inspired to take the next steps toward sharing your legacy.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Movie Night: Jaws (PG)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Jaws came out in the summer of 1975 and is considered to be the first ever summer blockbuster. It was the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer; it grossed over $235 million in the U.S.A and spawned 3 sequels. Jaws kicked off the era of big Summer Movies that we live in now! So come on out and enjoy a fin-tastic movie! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 2 hours and 4 minutes.

Title: Mat Pilates
Description:
Pilates training is a system of knowledge and exercises for anyone interested in improving core strength, flexibility, mobility, muscle balance, physical endurance, posture, effective breathing, and body awareness. 

This donation-based mat pilates class is designed for any age and fitness level, but does require participants to have the ability to move on and off the floor.

It is recommended that individuals bring 1-2 mats (as we will be lying and sitting on the ground) and comfortable and loose clothing. Optional equipment: Yoga blocks (for comfort while sitting), yoga socks, and an exercise band.

Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Kick Start Your Creative Writing
Description:
Have you always wanted to write a memoir, novel, or short story, but don’t know how to get started? Attend this four-session workshop to learn the basics of crafting characters, plot, setting, and dialogue! Each session will include in-class writing prompts to help you go from ideas in your head to words on paper fast. Attendance for each week encouraged, but not required.

Week One: Story fundamentals & goal-setting

Week Two: Characters & dialogue

Week Three: Setting & description

Week Four: Revising & submitting

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club: The House in the Cerulean Sea, by TJ Klune
Description:
Linus Baker leads a quiet, solitary life. At forty, he lives in a tiny house with a devious cat and his old records. As a Case Worker at the Department in Charge Of Magical Youth, he spends his days overseeing the well-being of children in government-sanctioned orphanages.

When Linus is unexpectedly summoned by Extremely Upper Management he's given a curious and highly classified assignment: travel to Marsyas Island Orphanage, where six dangerous children reside: a gnome, a sprite, a wyvern, an unidentifiable green blob, a were-Pomeranian, and the Antichrist. Linus must set aside his fears and determine whether or not they’re likely to bring about the end of days.

But the children aren’t the only secret the island keeps. (Barnes & Noble)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: A Forgotten People, A Forgotten Place: The Story of Rye
Description: This presentation will follow the history of Rye, a ghost town in East Manatee County, from its beginnings in the late 1800s through the present day. You will also learn about the key individuals from the settlement's story, the years following the end of the town, the physical reminders of the past, and about the area as it exists in the modern day.

Title: Ask a Master Gardener
Description: Learn how to turn all thumbs into green thumbs! Stop by the Ask a Master Gardener table in the library - these gardeners have the answers for home and container gardeners.

Title: Introduction to Computers 1, 2 & 3
Description:
Learn the fundamentals of starting off on computers, what do you need, where do you start, and what kind of tools are available to help you on beginning your computer journey.

NOTE: Registering for this class will automatically register you for Introduction to Computers 2 and 3.

May 7 (2 PM)

May 9 (2 PM)

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Enjoy this free community program geared towards pre-school and elementary school aged children and their families to engage in mindfulness activities and create art in all its various forms. Local teaching artists guide participants in activities, make-and-take art projects, and read-alongs. 

Each event includes a free, healthy lunch for the whole family, and each child will receive free books to help build their at home library, and a special prize to take home at the end of the day.

Title: Mad Hatter Tea Party

Title: Creative Aging: Back to Basics --The Basics of Drawing
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a series of art classes focusing on the basics of drawing and color! Students will register once for the whole series.

This class is for beginners and not suitable for those who have taken previous classes with our teaching artist.

Those 55 and over who are able to attend all six classes are invited to register!

Classes include:

4/29 The Basics of Drawing – This class helps to build a foundation for students, so they understand composition, perspective, and shading.

5/6  Drawing Landscapes – The class works with the student to develop a landscape drawing in one sitting, helping them understand composition, perspective and shading.

5/13 Color Magic –Watercolor - This class helps the student understand color mixing, hues and values.  A small project should be completed by the end of the session.

5/20  Watercolor Student Project – The first part of the class is discussing watercolor techniques. The student should bring in an 8x10 photo of that they would like to paint.

6/3  Project Continuation – The student will work on their project with each student receiving individual help.

6/10 Finish Project – The student will complete the project and we will have a “show and tell”
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Manatee County Historical Talk: Pioneer Women of Manatee County
Description: Join us the society presents a speaker who will talk about some aspect of local Manatee County history. For this month, step back in time with librarian Katie Fleck to meet the fearless and determined women who shaped the rugged landscape of Manatee County. In this hour-long program, we will delve into the lives of the women who were instrumental in the region’s agriculture, cattle ranching, and rodeo traditions.

Title: Book Discussion Group: Isaac's Storm, by Erik Larson
Description: September 8, 1900, began innocently in the seaside town of Galveston, Texas. Even Isaac Cline, resident meteorologist for the U.S. Weather Bureau failed to grasp the true meaning of the strange deep-sea swells and peculiar winds that greeted the city that morning. Mere hours later, Galveston found itself submerged in a monster hurricane that completely destroyed the town and killed over six thousand people in what remains the greatest natural disaster in American history--and Isaac Cline found himself the victim of a devastating personal tragedy. Using Cline's own telegrams, letters, and reports, the testimony of scores of survivors, and our latest understanding of the science of hurricanes, Erik Larson builds a chronicle of one man's heroic struggle and fatal miscalculation in the face of a storm of unimaginable magnitude. Riveting, powerful, and unbearably suspenseful, Isaac's Storm is the story of what can happen when human arrogance meets the great uncontrollable force of nature. (Goodreads)

Title: Kick Start Your Creative Writing
Description:
Have you always wanted to write a memoir, novel, or short story, but don’t know how to get started? Attend this four-session workshop to learn the basics of crafting characters, plot, setting, and dialogue! Each session will include in-class writing prompts to help you go from ideas in your head to words on paper fast. Attendance for each week encouraged, but not required.

Week One: Story fundamentals & goal-setting

Week Two: Characters & dialogue

Week Three: Setting & description

Week Four: Revising & submitting

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: Lifestyle Longevity: Setting Your Course for Lasting Wellness
Description:
It’s one thing to live a long life but how can we live it well? In this workshop, we’ll discuss components of a healthy lifestyle that can enhance our longevity and areas where a few small changes may yield big results in the quality of our lives long-term. You’ll come away with some ideas of how to readily apply some improvements to your life that set you on a healthy course. 



This is part of a Wellness Workshop Series presented by National Board Certified Health Coach, Carrie Ehrlich (NBC-HWC) of Transform Wellness. Learn more: transformwellnessllc.com

Join us on June 25 for Strength in Motion: Empowering Wellness Through Active Living

Join us on July 18 for Feeding Your Vitality: Exploring the Connection Between Food and Wellness

Title: Science Fiction/Fantasy Book Club: The Colour of Magic, by Terry Pratchett
Description: Come read with us across galaxies and through enchanted forests by joining our Science Fiction/Fantasy book group!  This book club meets the third Saturday of every month. We read not only sci-fi and fantasy classics, but also newer and more diverse voices in the genre. We’ll read graphic novels and short story collections, too! For our first meeting in May, we’ll be discussing Terry Pratchett’s first discworld book, The Color of Magic.

Title: Creative Aging: Back to Basics --The Basics of Drawing
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a series of art classes focusing on the basics of drawing and color! Students will register once for the whole series.

This class is for beginners and not suitable for those who have taken previous classes with our teaching artist.

Those 55 and over who are able to attend all six classes are invited to register!

Classes include:

4/29 The Basics of Drawing – This class helps to build a foundation for students, so they understand composition, perspective, and shading.

5/6  Drawing Landscapes – The class works with the student to develop a landscape drawing in one sitting, helping them understand composition, perspective and shading.

5/13 Color Magic –Watercolor - This class helps the student understand color mixing, hues and values.  A small project should be completed by the end of the session.

5/20  Watercolor Student Project – The first part of the class is discussing watercolor techniques. The student should bring in an 8x10 photo of that they would like to paint.

6/3  Project Continuation – The student will work on their project with each student receiving individual help.

6/10 Finish Project – The student will complete the project and we will have a “show and tell”
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Title: Digital Sketchbook Studio
Description:
Bring a digital touchscreen device with your favorite art app and engage in a variety of fun, introductory and experimental drawing, painting, and composition techniques.

Activities will also include discussion and practice of mindfulness as a part of the creative process.

(The free Sketchbook app is recommended for those new to digital art, but participants may use the drawing app of their choice.  Stylus tool provided.)

Title: Family Movie Night: The Avengers (PG-13)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Marvel is known for releasing super-tastic movies around the start of May to kick off the summer movie season. So come on out in you comfy PJs, bring your fuzzy blankets and join us for a family movie night watching Marvel’s The Avengers in the library! The Avengers was a movie unlike any other, it brought together heroes from different movies into a hugely successful movie! It became the highest grossing summer movie of 2012 by making over $623 million at the U.S. box office. Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks as well. The movie will start at 5:00 pm and run for 2 hour and 23 minutes.

Title: Book Discussion Event: Three Ringling Circus"
Description:
Sarasota would not be what it is today without the influence of the Ringling family, particularly John Ringling and his wife Mable.

Focusing on two main “characters,” John Ringling and his family, and the city of Sarasota, THREE RINGLING CIRCUS is divided into three sections: The history of Sarasota, the story of the Ringlings and the Ringling effect on the city.  The book covers everything from the early days of the natives, Blacks and settlers to the origins of the Ringling family and ahead-of-their-time ways of developing their circus to the massive amounts of finagling that went into the creation of the Art Museum and Ca d’Zan. The book bears witness to the Ringlings’ fabulous lifestyle, their behind-the-scenes heartbreak and triumph and often Machiavellian grab for wealth and power.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Kick Start Your Creative Writing
Description:
Have you always wanted to write a memoir, novel, or short story, but don’t know how to get started? Attend this four-session workshop to learn the basics of crafting characters, plot, setting, and dialogue! Each session will include in-class writing prompts to help you go from ideas in your head to words on paper fast. Attendance for each week encouraged, but not required.

Week One: Story fundamentals & goal-setting

Week Two: Characters & dialogue

Week Three: Setting & description

Week Four: Revising & submitting

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Creative Aging: Back to Basics --The Basics of Drawing
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a series of art classes focusing on the basics of drawing and color! Students will register once for the whole series.

This class is for beginners and not suitable for those who have taken previous classes with our teaching artist.

Those 55 and over who are able to attend all six classes are invited to register!

Classes include:

4/29 The Basics of Drawing – This class helps to build a foundation for students, so they understand composition, perspective, and shading.

5/6  Drawing Landscapes – The class works with the student to develop a landscape drawing in one sitting, helping them understand composition, perspective and shading.

5/13 Color Magic –Watercolor - This class helps the student understand color mixing, hues and values.  A small project should be completed by the end of the session.

5/20  Watercolor Student Project – The first part of the class is discussing watercolor techniques. The student should bring in an 8x10 photo of that they would like to paint.

6/3  Project Continuation – The student will work on their project with each student receiving individual help.

6/10 Finish Project – The student will complete the project and we will have a “show and tell”
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Movie Night: Star Wars: A New Hope (PG)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Star Wars: A New Hope came out in the summer of 1977. Initially called just Star Wars, no one knew that it was going to be the force hit that it became. It was the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer, grossing over $240 million in the U.S.A and spawned a whole franchise. Come on out and enjoy the movie! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 2 hours and 4 minutes.

Title: Live Poet's Society
Description: Join us to celebrate, read, and share poetry from past and present.

Title: Bingo Night!
Description: Play bingo, have fun, win books!

Title: Macrame Coaster Set Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of macrame at our Macrame Coaster Workshop! Learn the art of knotting to create your own stylish coasters. Our expert instructor will guide you through the process, ensuring a fun and creative experience. Perfect for all skill levels, this workshop promises a relaxing time crafting personalized coasters. Join us for a hands-on, bohemian-inspired session and leave with unique, handmade additions to elevate your home decor. Multiple accent colors will be available.

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play - Central Branch
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Title: Family Storytime
Description: Calling all Families for creative play and interactive fun.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Families, Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Florida Public Archaeology Network Presents Pyrotechnology
Description:
Come learn about fire from an archaeologist. Rachael will introduce kids to precontact culture and the ways local indigenous people used fire to meet their daily needs. You’ll also learn about real dig sites around Florida that you can check out. 

To ensure the smooth flow of our program and out of respect for our presenters and attendees, we kindly request punctual arrival. Late arrivals may find it challenging to join the program once it has started.
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families
Categories: Science/Nature/Environment, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Description: Join us for a class on vegetable gardening in Florida, presented by Mack Lessig, Community Gardens Program Specialist from the University of Florida IFAS Extension. Topics include site selection, varieties, seasons, and techniques.

Description:
Calllin gall Mahjong players! Come play with new friends and neighbors at the Rocky Bluff Branch every Tuesday.

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.

Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.

Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Description: Drop in with projects, questions, or inspiration for an afternoon with expert volunteers who are happy to assist you along your sewing journey.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Recycled Map/Atlas Art!
Description: Join us for fun afternoon of creating a beautiful art piece from recycled atlases/maps!

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Florida Public Archaeology Network Presents Pyrotechnology
Description: Come learn about fire from an archaeologist. Rachael K, Director of the Florida Public Archaeology Network (West and Central regions) will introduce kids to precontact culture and the ways local indigenous people used fire to meet their daily needs so many years ago. You’ll also learn about real dig sites around Florida that you can check out with your family.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Bingo!
Description: Join us every 1st Tuesday of the month for a round of BINGO! Make new friends, win prizes, and have FUN!

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Drop-in Art for Preschoolers
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 for simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!

Title: Family Storytime

Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Description: Enjoy books, rhymes, songs, and activities with your preschooler. For ages 3-5 with an adult caregiver.

Get trained on how to use the Cricut Machine to create, and then press our cut vinyl onto shirts for your own custom designs.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Bits 'N Pieces Puppets Presents: The Adventures of Robin Hood
Description:
Bits N Pieces Puppet Theatre presents their merry marionettes in “The Adventures of Robin Hood.” Seek adventure in Sherwood Forest. Watch Robin Hood help the rich give to the poor. Feel excitement as Maid Marion is saved by the bow and bravery of Robin Hood. Laugh when Marion shows Robin she knows best. Cheer Huzzah! at the Happy Ending!

Sponsored by Friends of the Lakewood Ranch Library
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Families
Categories: Arts & Entertainment, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Description: On June 6th, 1944, eighty years ago, one of the greatest armadas ever seen launched the invasion of western Europe. It was a titanic effort of men, machines and supplies. Learn how the invasion unfolded and the Axis attempts to avert or defeat it.

Title: Books on Tap Book Club
Description:
Books on Tap is a monthly book club that meets at 3 Keys Brewing & Eatery, 2505 Manatee Ave. E. in Bradenton. We have a very informal and relaxed setup. Come ready to talk about any book you’re reading, ask for recommendations, or just enjoy some bookish company. 

Anyone 21 and up is welcome to join us!

Enjoy good books, good beer, and good conversation!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Chair Yoga with Manching

A new class designed for absolutely everyone 

regardless of age or fitness level. This is a perfect class

Title: Comic Book Writing For Kids
Description: Join Bat City Comic Professionals to learn the quick and easy way to develop the essentials of a great story for any medium! From believable characters to problems that create layers for your characters to trudge through to a solution that can leave your readers wowed - and maybe wanting a little bit more! We'll craft our stories and learn how to apply them to the art of making comic books along the way.
Categories: Art Instruction, Creative Writing, Summer Learning

The "Creative Sassy Sewers," as they call themselves, make items for anyone in need: babies, children, adults, seniors, and pets! If you sew, come join them as they look for opportunities to give, using their talents, time, and interest.

Title: Mr  Stevey and Friends
Description:
Enjoy this free community program geared towards pre-school and elementary school aged children and their families to engage in mindfulness activities and create art in all its various forms. Local teaching artists guide participants in activities, make-and-take art projects, and read-alongs. 

Each event includes a free, healthy lunch for the whole family, and each child will receive free books to help build their at home library, and a special prize to take home at the end of the day.

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Drop-in Knitting
Description: Join other knitters for an afternoon of knitting. We’ll meet in the new Maker Space and you may bring your knitting projects. This program suitable for knitters of all levels; needles and yarn available for on-site use.

Title: Minecrafter's Guild
Description:
Guild members will be welcomed each week for a 2-hour interest driven meet up filled with creative arts, technology, book clubs, games, snacks, and friends! Wi-Fi is available for crafters to play in the virtual world on their own devices. Building tutorials will be provided by Guild Master K8ykat and Peers. Craft Friendships, build skills, and have fun.

Intended for ages 7+

Title: Creative Aging: Back to Basics --The Basics of Drawing
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a series of art classes focusing on the basics of drawing and color! Students will register once for the whole series.

This class is for beginners and not suitable for those who have taken previous classes with our teaching artist.

Those 55 and over who are able to attend all six classes are invited to register!

Classes include:

4/29 The Basics of Drawing – This class helps to build a foundation for students, so they understand composition, perspective, and shading.

5/6  Drawing Landscapes – The class works with the student to develop a landscape drawing in one sitting, helping them understand composition, perspective and shading.

5/13 Color Magic –Watercolor - This class helps the student understand color mixing, hues and values.  A small project should be completed by the end of the session.

5/20  Watercolor Student Project – The first part of the class is discussing watercolor techniques. The student should bring in an 8x10 photo of that they would like to paint.

6/3  Project Continuation – The student will work on their project with each student receiving individual help.

6/10 Finish Project – The student will complete the project and we will have a “show and tell”
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Title: 'Murder by the Book' Book Club: Racing the Light, by Robert Crais
Description: Adele Schumacher isn't a typical worried mom. When she hires Elvis to find her missing son, a controversial podcaster named Josh Shoe, she brings a bag filled with cash, bizarre tales of government conspiracies, and a squad of professional bodyguards. Finding Josh should be simple, but Elvis quickly learns he isn't alone in the hunt—a deadly team of mysterious strangers are determined to find Josh and girlfriend first. With dangerous secrets lurking behind every lead, Elvis needs his friend Joe Pike more than ever to uncover the truth about Josh, corrupt politicians, and the vicious business cartels rotting the heart of Los Angeles from within. And when Elvis's estranged girlfriend, Lucy Chenier, and her son, Ben, return, he learns just how much he has to lose...if he survives. (Goodreads)

Title: The Women: A Vietnam Army Nurse's Response
Description:
In celebration of Women Veteran Day, please join us on June 13th from 2-3 pm for a lecture by Colonel Lorna House, U.S. Army Nurse Corps, retired. This program will highlight women who served in the armed forces in Vietnam alongside a discussion about The Women by author, Kristin Hannah. 

The Women is the story of one woman gone to war, but it shines a light on all women who put themselves in harm’s way and whose sacrifice and commitment to their country has too often been forgotten. A novel about deep friendships and bold patriotism, The Women is a richly drawn story with a memorable heroine whose idealism and courage under fire will come to define an era. Credit: Goodreads

**Please note: capacity is set at 84 participants. Please join us again for an additonal presentation on Women in the U.S. Military on Thursday, June 27th from 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm**

Description: Teens! Get your creative juices flowing with us on the second Thursday of each month for a night of crafting fun. We’ll provide the materials with a suggested theme. You create.

Title: Adventure Starts Here: Youth RPG Guild!
Description: Enter a magical land full of adventure, mystery, and just a sprinkle of danger. Band together to complete quests, collect unique items, and create stories the likes of which will be told for years to come! Reading and writing are required skills for a young adventurer.

Title: Town Hall with County Commissioner George Kruse
Description: Manatee County Commissioner At Large, George Kruz, invites Manatee County residents to join him for discussion and Q&A on topics related to the county.

Title: Literary Travel Through the US Book Club--Kentucky: The Giver of Stars, by Jojo Moyes
Description: Based on a true story rooted in America's past, The Giver of Stars is unparalleled in its scope. At times funny, at others heartbreaking, this is a richly rewarding novel of women's friendship, of true love, and of what happens when we reach beyond our grasp for the great beyond.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rooftop Sunset Zumba
Description: If you love Dancing, you will LOVE this Zumba class. All the Zumba happy vibes, with a dash of classic and contemporary moves. Come and join instructor Juan Baquero for this HIGH INTENSITY class on the Lakewood Ranch Library rooftop.

Title: The Art Corner
Description: The Art Corner is a space for all artists and aspiring artists to socialize, share, and create. Creativity and camaraderie around the corner!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play--Braden River
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 10 families.

Description:
Join instructor Jean Markley for a fun-filled hour of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.


	Learn to dance
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social

Description: Beginners and experienced players welcome! Game sets are not provided by the library.

	Learn new dance moves
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social

Description: Are you interested in role playing games? Come join us for a beginner guide for junior role players.

Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers' social skills, language skills, motor skills, and more.

Title: Warhammer Day Camp
Description: Dive into the epic game of Warhammer! Build and paint models, design your own army, and learn to play the world's most popular tabletop wargame!

Title: Intro to Cricut Class
Description: For those DIY enthusiasts who want to begin creating their own crafts that are both professional-quality and easy to make, the Cricut is the greatest tool to achieve your goal. Come learn the basics! In this beginner's course, you'll discover the materials, tools, and resources you'll need to get started. (Participants must be at least 13 years old and sign a Workshop Waiver. This course is a prerequisite to attending any Cricut Open Hours hosted at Lakewood Ranch Library.)
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Rock Garden Rock Painting for Kids!
Description:
Join local artist volunteer Cheryl to paint beautiful rocks to add to our very own Island Library Rock Garden! Learn how to get involved in this global kindness project to paint rocks and hide around the community. All materials provided!

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Title: Parrish Arts Council: Decoupage Pots (FOR TWEENS AND TEENS)
Description: Kids ages 8 and up are invited to decorate clay pots with the help of artists from the Parrish Arts Council. All supplies will be provided. Just bring your imagination! Seating is limited and registration is required to ensure we have enough supplies.

Title: Beginning Line Dancing
Description: Join dance Instructor Chako Isgro for a fun-filled ninety minutes of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Introduction to Computers 3
Description:
Learn the fundamentals of starting off on computers, what do you need, where do you start, and what kind of tools are available to help you on beginning your computer journey.

NOTE: Registering for this class will automatically register you for Introduction to Computers 2 and 3.

June 11 (2 PM)

June 13 (2 PM)

June 15 (10-11 AM)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: RCC Farms Petting Zoo
Description: Do you love cuddling and touching animals? We do too! At RCC Farms, we bring the farm to you allowing children of all ages to experience the love and joy that comes from caring for animals! This is a live animal show. No registration required.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Families

Title: Read to a Dog
Description: Come visit the Kids Space at the Lakewood Ranch Library and read to a certified therapy dog! Perfect for those who want to practice and build their literacy skills in a low-stress environment.
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Families

Title: Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 yoga blocks, and wear clothes you can stretch and move in. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified yoga teacher.

Description: Hop aboard the Pirate Ship for a story read by a real Pirate! Enjoy crafts and pirate lore!
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)

Title: Ask a Master Gardener
Description: A Master Gardener with the Manatee County Extension Office will have a table set up in the library's lobby to answer your gardening questions.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Drop-in Knitting
Description: Join other knitters for an afternoon of knitting. We’ll meet in the new Maker Space and you may bring your knitting projects. This program suitable for knitters of all levels; needles and yarn available for on-site use.

Title: Origami Class
Description: Come join us as we learn the art of origami. Supplies are furnished.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Minecrafter's Guild
Description:
Guild members will be welcomed each week for a 2-hour interest driven meet up filled with creative arts, technology, book clubs, games, snacks, and friends! Wi-Fi is available for crafters to play in the virtual world on their own devices. Building tutorials will be provided by Guild Master K8ykat and Peers. Craft Friendships, build skills, and have fun.

Intended for ages 7+

Title: Science Fiction/Fantasy Book Club: How Long 'Til Black Future Month? by N.K. Jemisin
Description: Come read with us across galaxies and through enchanted forests by joining our Science Fiction/Fantasy book group!  This book club meets the third Saturday of every month. We read not only sci-fi and fantasy classics, but also newer and more diverse voices in the genre. We’ll read graphic novels and short story collections, too! In June, we’ll be discussing a short story collection by N.K. Jemisin called How Long ‘til Black Future Month?

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Title: Gentle Yoga
Description:
Enjoy this gentler style of hatha yoga practice with yoga instructor, Delphine. Gentle Yoga is performed at a slower pace, with less intense positions, and usually includes extended time for meditation, yogic breath work, and relaxation.

Please, bring your own mat.

Title: Monday Matinee Movies: Wish
Description: Spend your Monday morning relaxing in front of the big screen! Come grab a seat at and some snacks!
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.


Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Summer Learning Event: Digeradoo Down Under
Description: Join us for an epic adventure to the Land Down Under, where we’ll hear otherworldly sounds from the didgeridoo and explore the Great Barrier Reef.
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)
Categories: Education, Science/Nature/Environment, Special Event, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Description:

Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Title: Crafternoons
Description:
Get together with friends and family and get creative! Each week will be a different craft that is appropriate for ages 10+. Hosted by local artist, Enith Marin. Supplies are provided. Registration is required. 

Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Cricut Drop-In Session
Description:
Join us either June 17th or July 19th, same time!

Interested in creating cards, t-shirt designs, and more? Come learn about our Cricut cutting machine and other supplies available in our South Manatee Branch Makerspace! You will learn how this machine can be used by crafters of all kinds, and how you can begin to make your own projects using our machine for free! Registration appreciated but not required. We hope to see you there!
Event Organizer: Kira Thoenes - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Digital Sketchbook Studio
Description:
Bring a digital touchscreen device with your favorite art app and engage in a variety of fun, introductory and experimental drawing, painting, and composition techniques.

Activities will also include discussion and practice of mindfulness as a part of the creative process.

(The free Sketchbook app is recommended for those new to digital art, but participants may use the drawing app of their choice.  Stylus tool provided.)

Title: Dungeons & Dragons for Teens
Description: Join Dungeon Master Lauren and jump into the magical world of Dungeons & Dragons. Create your own character to journey through a campaign specially created for teens. Beginners welcome! Registration is required.

Title: Empty Bowls
Description: Unleash your creativity and paint unique designs on pottery. Items to be sold with benfits going to the Food Bank of Manatee County. All supplies will be provided. No registration required.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Family Movie Night: Shrek (PG)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Shrek came out in the summer of 2001 where it was a commercial and critical success. It was the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer, grossing over $260 million domestically. Come on out to the swamp in your comfy pjs! Bring your fuzzy blankets! And have a swamp-tastic time watching Shrek! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families, Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Trivia Night!
Description: Join the fun! Come as a team or come alone and team up with a few others to play a few rounds of trivia! A different theme each month. Winners receive a prize book! Presenters are seasoned trivia hosts.

Title: JiggleMan!
Description:
A spectacular physical comedy show by children's performer JiggleMan! JiggleMan has performed many times on the David Letterman show and does performances at schools, libraries, and festivals around the world. This wacky show is perfect for the whole family!

To ensure the smooth flow of our program and out of respect for our presenters and attendees, we kindly request punctual arrival. Late arrivals may find it challenging to join the program once it has started.
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Families
