Title: Brain Health Presentation
Description:
Join us for a presentation on Brain Health with Ashley McIntyre, MS Clinical Nutrition, a Holistic Health Coach and Nutrition Intern. Topics will include:


	What does an Elevated Plate look like?
	Brain Health definition & importance 
	What does the science say in terms of Nutrition & Brain Health
	Mediterranean Diet versus the Mind Diet
	Antioxidants: what are they and how do they elevate health?
	Top foods to include to preserve Brain Function
	Sleep and Brain Health


Ashley's Website: www.theelevatedplate.com

Ashley's Facebook & Instagram: @the.elevated.plate

Ashley's Email: ashley@theelevatedplate.com

Title: Sewing Lab with the American Sewing Guild
Description: Drop in with projects, questions, or inspiration for an afternoon with expert volunteers who are happy to assist you along your sewing journey.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Hollywood Comes to AMI
Description: Did you know that several movies were filmed on Anna Maria Island and that it was once a hangout for old Hollywood actors? Would you be surprised to learn that the Island was once slated to become the Hollywood of the tropics? Join Librarian Katie Fleck for a talk about all this and more.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Description: Meet some amazing animals who live at the Sarasota Jungle Gardens.

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop: Special Guest Shann from Bat City Comics
Description:
Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling. 

*This day will feature a special guest, Shann from Bat City Comic Professionals, who will share her knowledge on writing and formatting comic books.*

Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: One Blood Bloodmobile
Description:
The One Blood Bus will be available in Palmetto Branch's north parking lot to all those who would like to donate blood.

Online appointments are encouraged. To make an appointment to donate blood, please visit: https://donor.oneblood.org/donor/schedules/drive_schedule/1391135

There are health benefits of donating blood. Below are just a few of the Benefits:

1. A Healthier Heart System and Vascular System: Helps to decrease blood pressure

2. A Calorie-Free Snack – Your body burns about 500 calories while replacing the blood you donated

3. Lowers the Risk for: Liver, lung, colon, stomach and throat cancer

4. Stimulation of New Blood Cells – New Cells help to Oxygenate your body better.

5. Loss of Wight – You can lose 1% of your body weight

6. Iron – For those that have higher levels of iron, donating helps to decrease the level of iron to healthier level.

7. Cholesterol – Helps to reduce cholesterol levels

8.  Each donations helps to save up to  3 lives.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Presentation: Women in the U.S. Military
Description:
In celebration of Women Veteran Day observed on June 12th, please join us for a presentation by U.S. Military Commander Donna Fournier, U.S. Navy, retired. This program will highlight women in the U.S. military and provide information about their early military service, which includes: The Revolutionary War, War of 1812, Civil War, WWII, Korean War, and Vietnam War.

Commander Fournier received her BA in history and an MAT in American Studies from Northeastern Illinois University and she also is a 2002 graduate of the Naval War College. With her specialization in researching the history of women in the military, she became a Special Consultant to Assistant Secretary of Defense for Manpower and Military Equal Opportunity, the Pentagon. CDR Fournier retired after 26 years as a Naval Reserve Intelligence Officer.

Title: 20s and 30s Book Club: Gone Girl, by Gillian Flynn
Description:
Looking to meet others in their 20s and 30s? Join us this month as we discuss the suspense-thriller Gone Girl by Gillian Flynn. Attendees are also encouraged to watch the 2014 movie adaptation of Gone Girl by director David Fincher for some additional conversation. Copies of both are available through the Manatee County Public Library system, so reserve yours today! 



Whether you loved it, liked it, or hated it, we hope to see you for a fun and interesting discussion!



Disclaimer: This is a suspense-thriller that includes mature content and depictions of violence. 



This event is intended for those aged 20-39. Registration is required.
Event Organizer: Kira Thoenes - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Crafty Attic Series

Title: Getting Started with Podcasting
Description: Take a dive into the basics of podcasting, from coming up with topics, to brainstorming, to the basics of the different varieties of tools and technology are available. Take some time to learn and ask questions about how to get started.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Up, Up 7 Away!
Description: This spellbinding special event introduces children to the principles of air and pressure. Children are amazed as a soda bottle is crushed before their very eyes and understand how pressure affects the world around us. A hot air balloon will be created and a giant beach ball will levitate. Giant fog vortexes will be created, and in the grand finale, volunteers will experience the power of air pressure, and frictionless motion as they ride around on our amazing Mad Science hovercraft. No registration required.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Who Was Alexander Hamilton?
Description: This presentation provides an overview of the life and accomplishments of Alexander Hamilton, one of the United States of America’s most important founders. It covers his time as a soldier in the American Revolution, his career as a lawyer, his role as the first Secretary of the Treasury, and much more!

Title: Youth Birding Workshop with Manatee County Audubon Society

Title: Movie Night: Men In Black (PG-13)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Here come the Men in Black! In the summer of 1997, Men in Black grossed over $230 million domestically making it the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer. The MiB movie was based on a series of Marvel comics and the movie in turn spawned 3 more movies, an animated tv series, video games and a ride at Universal. Come on out to the library and enjoy the movie! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 1 hour and 38 minutes.

Title: Digeridoo Down Under
Description:
Join us on an epic adventure to the Land Down Under, where we'll hear otherworldly sounds from the didgeridoo, we'll explore the Great Barrier Reef and the Outback, we'll learn about amazing creatures like kangaroos and koalas ... and much more! The DDU Show is an energetic fusion of Australian music, culture, comedy, character building, storytelling, and audience participation. It's interactive, educational, motivational, and super fun for all ages!

To ensure the smooth flow of our program and out of respect for our presenters and attendees, we kindly request punctual arrival. Late arrivals may find it challenging to join the program once it has started.
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)

Title: Poisonous Plants: Understanding Plant Toxicity’
Description: What exactly do we mean when we say a plant is poisonous? What is the reason for plants producing poisonous compounds? This class will cover all of this and more! Learn about the most acutely toxic plants in Florida so you are sure to stay clear or live safely with them if you choose!

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Adulting 101 Presents: Cooking in College
Description: Back by popular demand! Teens will be introduced to practical skills for adult life in this fun and interactive series of classes. This week, join Rachel and Liz to learn all and try some of the different meals you can make in a dorm, both healthy and delectable!

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources.

Description: Get creative in Studio70! Try out 3D print pens, jewelry making, arts & crafts, vinyl sticker making and more. All supplies are provided, just bring your creativity!

Title: Teen Workshop Wednesday
Description: Teens, are you artistic? Crafty? Or simply enjoy DIY? Join us for this month’s makerspace activity. Drop in anytime between 5 and 7 pm as we explore the realms of art and creativity!
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Makerspace, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Books on Tap Book Club
Description:
Books on Tap is a monthly book club that meets at 3 Keys Brewing & Eatery, 2505 Manatee Ave. E. in Bradenton. We have a very informal and relaxed setup. Come ready to talk about any book you’re reading, ask for recommendations, or just enjoy some bookish company. 

Anyone 21 and up is welcome to join us!

Enjoy good books, good beer, and good conversation!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play--Braden River
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: We sing, play, dance, rhyme and read all while promoting your baby’s development and literacy skills. No registration required.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Mahjong Club
Description: Beginners and experienced players welcome! Game sets are not provided by the library.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Wiggle Worms Storytime (BABIES TO 5 YEARS)
Description: Bring your little one to Wiggle Worms Family Storytime every Friday of every month. This fun and interactive story-time will have you and your little one reading, singing, and learning.

Title: Mahjong for Experienced Players
Description: Mahjong Club for experienced players. This program is intended for those who already know how to play.

Title: Chess Club
Description: Come play with friends and friends-to-be every Friday!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Cricut Certification Class
Description: For those DIY enthusiasts who want to begin creating their own crafts that are both professional-quality and easy to make, the Cricut is the greatest tool to achieve your goal. Come learn the basics! In this beginner's course, you'll discover the materials, tools, and resources you'll need to get started. (Participants must be at least 13 years old and sign a Workshop Waiver. This course is a prerequisite to attending any Cricut Open Hours hosted at Lakewood Ranch Library.)
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description: One-on-One tech assistance: Androids, iPhones, tablets, laptops, e-books/audiobooks, and more. NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: Beginning Line Dancing
Description: Join dance Instructor Chako Isgro for a fun-filled ninety minutes of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: CANCELLED Pins & Needles Neighbor Sewing Group
Description: Join the Sarasota Gulf Chapter of the American Sewing Guild for a monthly sewing club. Each month, a Guild member will demonstrate a project which everyone will then work on together.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Fort Night, not Fortnite
Description: Let’s journey into building forts! The library will have the supplies, and you can bring your creativity. Each fort will be different and fun. Camping snacks, books, games, and puzzles will be provided so you can snuggle up together under your masterpiece! No registration required.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Knitting and Crochet Club
Description: Come join us for our knitting and crochet club. All levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Tee to Tote
Description: Get ready to rock your style at the "Tee to Tote" library bash, where teens can transform their old t-shirts into trendy tote bags without any sewing needed! Dive into the world of DIY fashion and eco-friendly fun as you turn your tees into fabulous accessories, all while watching a classic fashion movie.

Title: Family Lego Day
Description: Have fun with Legos, Blocks, and Puzzles, plus an exciting craft!

Title: Family Movie Matinee
Description: Join us for a family-friendly movie the first Saturday of the month.

Title: Internet and Online Security
Description: In the digital age where a seemingly infinite amount of information is at our fingertips, it is important to learn skills to keep yourself safe. Learn how to stay secure as you are using your email, navigating the internet, and even as you are sending and receiving calls and text messages.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Minecrafter's Guild - Unplugged
Description:
Guild members will be welcomed each week for a 2-hour interest driven meet up filled with creative arts, games, snacks, and friends! Legos, cardboard, and other building building materials provided for a fun day of unplugged crafting fun! Craft Friendships, build skills, and have fun.

Intended for ages 7+

Title: Science and Minecraft Crew
Description: Explore the amazing world of science and share your love of Minecraft! From 3D printing to circuitry and creative Minecraft builds.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Title: Canva Basics
Description: Learn to create eye-popping flyers, posters, greeting cards, stationary, mini videos, and more with Canva. This free program is used by teachers, students, designers or anyone looking to grab attention to their cause. During this session you’ll be introduced to the various tools this program offers. Canva can be used on a laptop, tablet or cell phone. Bring your laptop or other device and be leave inspired to create your own visual masterpiece.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.


Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Summer Learning Event: Adventures in Slime!
Description: Join us for a slime making adventure!
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!

Description:
Get together with friends and family and get creative! Each week will be a different craft that is appropriate for ages 10+. Hosted by local artist, Enith Marin. Supplies are provided. Registration is required. 

Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Dungeons & Dragons for Teens
Description: Join Dungeon Master Lauren and jump into the magical world of Dungeons & Dragons. Create your own character to journey through a campaign specially created for teens. Beginners welcome! Registration is required.

Title: Puzzle Competition for Adults!
Description: Go on a puzzle adventure and compete against other teams to finish your puzzle the fastest! Winner gets a prize. Do you think you could complete a puzzle in an hour and a half? Get a team together, up to 5 people per team, and compete against other teams for your chance to prove you are the ultimate puzzlers. A puzzle themed prize will go to whoever completes their puzzle first (or whoever gets the closest in the timeframe). Snacks will be provided!

Title: Jazzercise on the Rooftop!
Description:
What IS Jazzercise? We're a fun, effective full body workout set to the best music! We're heart pumping cardio, muscle sculpting & mood boosting stretching! We’re the original group fitness class but we're current & change with the times! Seriously, we know what we're doing! Is Jazzercise for you? We're for everyBODY, every age, stage & fitness level. 

We’re excited to bring Jazzercise to the rooftop! Join us for a super fun sweat sesh packed with dance cardio, strength training & stretching! It’s our HIIT class we call Power Sculpt! Dress to sweat, bring water, a yoga mat, and handheld weights (optional: class can be done all standing without weights). Our studio is located at 9009 Town Center Parkway, we have 27 classes, morning and night, 7 days a week! For more information, please visit www.jazzerciselwr.com

Please note: This is a donation-based class, we appreciate your generosity and cash donations are appreciated! Thank you!

GiGi and her dog, Super Zeus, celebrate their love of comedy, sing-alongs- and circus in a performance packed with fun for all. The show includes magic, comedy, dance, juggling, dog tricks, and a ukulele sing-along.

To ensure the smooth flow of our program and out of respect for our presenters and attendees, we kindly request punctual arrival. Late arrivals may find it challenging to join the program once it has started.

Description: Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers' social skills, language skills, motor skills, and more.

Title: Needle Arts Studio-Open Sew and Knit
Description: Do you sew, knit, quilt, crochet, do handwork or English paper piecing? Bring your projects and join us! Get some inspiration or assistance if needed. Participants must bring their own fabric, patterns, thread, and notions necessary for their personal projects, but tools will be provided. We have 4 Janome sewing machines, 2 sergers, and large cutting mats.
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: 3D Printer Drop In
Description: Come by to check out our 3D printer during open hours in our makerspace room, Tinker Tank 26. Here you can make something and take it home.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Adulting 101 Presents: Money Matters
Description: Back by popular demand! Teens will be introduced to practical skills for adult life in this fun and interactive series of classes. Money management is an important lesson for teens and young adults to understand! Join Nelly Nelson with The University of Florida IFAS Extension Manatee County to learn the basics of how checking and savings accounts work, setting SMART goals when creating a budget, learn how to write a check, and what credit is and how it works.

Title: GiGi and Friends Musical Comedy Show

Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: History Talk
Description: Join us Manatee County Historical Society presents a speaker who will talk about some aspect of local Manatee County history. This month Melissa Morgan will be here to talk about Palmetto's Manatee County Agricultural Museum and its collection.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Description: Trivia night returns to Rocky Bluff Library! Bring a team or join a team.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Book Discussion Group: Trust, by Hernan Diaz
Description: At once an immersive story and a brilliant literary puzzle, TRUST engages the reader in a quest for the truth while confronting the deceptions that often live at the heart of personal relationships, the reality-warping force of capital, and the ease with which power can manipulate facts.

Title: Gardening Club
Description:
Join us at the Palmetto Library to help weed, plant, and maintain the new library learning garden! Water, gardening gloves, and some tools provided, but feel free to bring your own, too. 


All ages welcome, but 12 and under need parent/guardian to participate with them. Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library. 
*May be cancelled at any time due to unforeseen circumstances.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rooftop Yoga with SHACK yoga + fitness
Description: Join us for a donation-based rooftop yoga class at 9:30 am with yoga instructor, Jenna from SHACK yoga + fitness! Please bring a mat and register for this event - we can't wait to see you there!

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Drop-in Art for Preschoolers
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 for simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!

Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Title: Silly Goose Preschool Storytime
Description: Enjoy books, rhymes, songs, and activities with your preschooler. For ages 3-5 with an adult caregiver.

Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Toddler Storytime
Description:
Join Miss Chris for stories and fun! 

Limited to 40 children

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club - The Bonesetter's Daughter by Amy Tan
Description:
Ruth Young and her widowed mother, LuLing, have always had a tumultuous relationship. Now, before she succumbs to forgetfulness, LuLing gives Ruth some of her writings, which reveal a side of LuLing that Ruth has never known. . . .

In a remote mountain village where ghosts and tradition rule, LuLing grows up in the care of her mute Precious Auntie as the family endures a curse laid upon a relative known as the bonesetter. When headstrong LuLing rejects the marriage proposal of the coffinmaker, a shocking series of events are set in motion–all of which lead back to Ruth and LuLing in modern San Francisco. The truth that Ruth learns from her mother’s past will forever change her perception of family, love, and forgiveness. (From Goodreads)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Description: Join us on the Lakewood Ranch Library rooftop and learn how to move on the beat! In this class, you’ll learn a variety of dance styles like jazz, Latin, and hip-hop that you can apply through the form of dance! This is open to all dancing abilities from beginner to advanced - no dance experience is required to have fun at this program!

Title: Sweat and Swagger
Description: Join Sweat & Swagger instructor Adrienne Quarlena for a wildly addictive dance cardio workout that fuses Hip-Hop and Latin beats with easy-to-follow steps.

Title: Sword Fighting for History!
Description:
The battle of blades is leaping off the pages of your favorite storybook and into your local library! Join the Instructors of Steel Ring Academy, a historical sword fighting school, for a presentation on the history of Renaissance-era sword fighting with live fighting demonstrations. Hear the clashing of steel ringing in your ears instead of your imagination as you learn about this exciting chapter of history.

Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Title: Toddler Storytime with FIT4MOM Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota
Description: Join us for this special beach themed story time event for toddlers hosted by FIT4MOM Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota! We will be reading a couple summer themed books and there will be chalk and bubbles at the end! Space is limited so please register ahead of time!

Title: One-on-One Tech Help
Description:
Basic one-on-one technology help with a library staff member. 30-minute session to assist with androids, iPhones, tablets, laptops, and library e-book and audiobook resources.

NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.
Event Organizer: Sylva Osbourne- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.
Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Summer Stories
Description: Dive into summer story time at the library! Enjoy captivating story followed by a fun craft that brings the tale to life. It's a perfect mix of reading and creativity for young ones.

Title: Game Day
Description: Game Day is a combination of Scrabble, Mahjong and Bridge. Beginners, Intermediate and Skilled players are welcome.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers' social skills, language skills, motor skills, and more.

Title: Sunshine Stitchers Knit and Crochet
Description: Like to knit or crochet? Join us to knit or crochet for family, friends, and charity - along with a fun afternoon of sharing patterns, yarns, and conversation. Learn to knit or crochet (teenagers and adults) or enhance your skills (any age) during the summer from 1-3 p.m. Supplies provided. Ages 12 & up.

Title: 'Murder by the Book' Book Club: Walking Shadows, by Faye Kellerman
Description: Detective Peter Decker and his wife, Rina Lazarus, risk life and limb to solve a pair of brutal murders that may be tied to a crime from more than twenty years ago in this intense and addictive mystery from New York Times bestselling author Faye Kellerman. (Goodreads)

Title: Chair Yoga with Manching
Description: A new class designed for absolutely everyone regardless of age or fitness level. Taught by Manching Tom, Certified Yoga Instructor. This is a perfect class for anyone who’s new to yoga or coming back from any injury.

Description: Teens! Get your creative juices flowing with us on the second Thursday of each month for a night of crafting fun. We’ll provide the materials with a suggested theme. You create.

Description: Enter a magical land full of adventure, mystery, and just a sprinkle of danger. Band together to complete quests, collect unique items, and create stories the likes of which will be told for years to come! Reading and writing are required skills for a young adventurer.

Description: Join our free, confidential support program for Veterans, Service Members, and their families, offered in a welcoming, non-medical setting. Learn how to connect with additional resources through Veterans Affairs in your community. Strengthen your support network with this valuable opportunity.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Literary Travel Through the US Book Club--Louisians: A Confederacy of Dunces, by John Kennedy Toole
Description: A Confederacy of Dunces is an American comic masterpiece featuring John Kennedy Toole's hero, Don Quixote of the French Quarter. His story bursts with wholly original characters, denizens of New Orleans' lower depths, incredibly true-to-life dialogue, and the zaniest series of high and low comic adventures.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rooftop Sunset Zumba
Description: If you love Dancing, you will LOVE this Zumba class. All the Zumba happy vibes, with a dash of classic and contemporary moves. Come and join instructor Juan Baquero for this HIGH INTENSITY class on the Lakewood Ranch Library rooftop.

Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 10 families.

Title: Explore the Shore
Description: Shells, sharks, and seaweed- Oh my! Explore the wonders that cover the shore and learn about the wildlife that calls Manatee County waters home. Using hands-on exploration and games, peek into the adventurous world beneath the waves. No registration required.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Line Dancing--Beginners
Description:
Join instructor Jean Marcley for a fun-filled hour of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.


	Learn to dance
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social

Title: Make Your Own Dice!
Description: Do you play Dungeons and Dragons? Do you like tabletop games? In this program, you will get to create your own unique dice from resin molds! Create cool dice by using Mica powder, food dye, glitter, random objects or mini 3d prints! The possibilities are endless

Title: Musical Motion
Description: Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers' social skills, language skills, motor skills, and more.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Craft & Cork: Upcycled Wine Bottle Craft
Description:
Join us for an afternoon of wine bottle decorating! Unleash your creativity alongside fellow craft enthusiasts as we transform ordinary wine bottles into stunning works of art. Bring along your favorite rub-on and let your imagination run wild!

We'll provide a variety of supplies to inspire your crafting journey, including:


	Wine bottles
	Wine bottle lights with cork
	Decorative napkins (nautical, butterflies, beachy, birds, etc.)
	Ribbon and twine
	Corks
	Yarn
	Rub-ons
	Gems
	Paints
	Tissue paper
	Mod Podge, glue, scissors, ruler, glue gun


Let's uncork our creativity and make beautiful creations together!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description: One-on-One tech assistance: Androids, iPhones, tablets, laptops, e-books/audiobooks, and more. NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: Yarn Power Hour
Description: Collaborate and create with others in this dynamic knitting/crochet club! All levels welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: American Sewing Guild
Description: This community sewing guild is associated with the Sarasota Gulf Coast Chapter of the American Sewing Guild. The "Creative Sassy Sewers," as they call themselves, make items for anyone in need: babies, children, adults, seniors, and pets! If you sew, come join them as they look for opportunities to give, using their talents, time, and interest.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Ask a Master Gardener
Description: Learn how to turn all thumbs into green thumbs! Stop by the Ask a Master Gardener table in the library - these gardeners have the answers for home and container gardeners.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Little World Travelers: Storytime
Description: Come and travel around the world with us. Join us for storytime, songs and interactive playing for kids ages 4-7. Registration is required.

Title: Paws & Pages: A Dog Adoption Event
Description: Embark on a literary adventure with furry companions at "Paws & Pages." Join us for an unforgettable dog adoption event, where families can meet and greet adoptable dogs from MCAW while enjoying special storytimes and craft activities inspired by the magic of books — and dogs, of course!

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 yoga blocks, and wear clothes you can stretch and move in. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified yoga teacher.

Title: Drop-in Knitting
Description: Join other knitters for an afternoon of knitting. We’ll meet in the new Maker Space and you may bring your knitting projects. This program suitable for knitters of all levels; needles and yarn available for on-site use.

Title: RPGs at the Library for TEENS
Description:
Join Joel for roleplaying games at the Library! No experience necessary. Ages 13-18.

LOCATED IN THE CONFERENCE ROOM.

Title: Friends of the South Manatee Library Book Sale
Description: It's time for the Friends of South Manatee Library's annual book sale. Come on out and browse their selection and support the Friends, who in turn support the library's programming and supplies
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor
Categories: Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Minecrafter's Guild
Description:
Guild members will be welcomed each week for a 2-hour interest driven meet up filled with creative arts, technology, book clubs, games, snacks, and friends! Wi-Fi is available for crafters to play in the virtual world on their own devices. Building tutorials will be provided by Guild Master K8ykat and Peers. Craft Friendships, build skills, and have fun.

Intended for ages 7+

Title: Taylor Swift Eras Party
Description: Calling all Swifties! Are You Ready For It? Don’t have a Cruel Summer, come join us for an afternoon of celebrating all things Taylor Swift. There will be crafts and activities from each era and Don’t You worry, we’ll have some light snacks and drinks too. It’s going to be The Best Day! Ages 10+

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Florida Health Department of Manatee County
Description: Come visit the Florida Department of Health table to get valuable health information on the month’s topics. Representative: Hannah Sanborn, Health Educator Consultant. Today's topics include: UV Safety Month, Minority Mental Health Month, and Dental Hygiene.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Instrument Petting Zoo
Description: Join us for an exiting adventure where kids and their families have an opportunity to see, touch, hear, and play the instruments of the orchestra.

Title: Introduction to FamilySearch
Description:
Please join us for a one-hour introduction class on FamilySearch offered by Regina Negrycz. We will be learning how to research ship passenger records, military records, census records, and how to use the FamilySearch Wiki.

FamilySearch is a website offering genealogical records operated by the LDS Church. They maintain a collection of records, resources, and services designed to help people learn more about their family history. Registration is required, thank you!

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Musical Motion
Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Title: Science Drop -in
Description: Hosted by the science department at SCF, kids will dive into the world of science with funky glowing bacteria, cool critters, interactive science experiments and more with this drop-in science program. For families and their children.

Title: Crafternoons
Description:
Get together with friends and family and get creative! Each week will be a different craft that is appropriate for ages 10+. Hosted by local artist, Enith Marin. Supplies are provided. Registration is required. 

Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Digital Sketchbook Studio
Description:
Bring a digital touchscreen device with your favorite art app and engage in a variety of fun, introductory and experimental drawing, painting, and composition techniques.

Activities will also include discussion and practice of mindfulness as a part of the creative process.

(The free Sketchbook app is recommended for those new to digital art, but participants may use the drawing app of their choice.  Stylus tool provided.)

Title: Dungeons & Dragons for Teens
Description: Join Dungeon Master Lauren and jump into the magical world of Dungeons & Dragons. Create your own character to journey through a campaign specially created for teens. Beginners welcome! Registration is required.

Title: Family Movie Night: Toy Story 3 (G)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Toy Story 3 came out in the summer of 2010, where it was the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer grossing over $408 million domestically. Come on out in your comfy pjs, bring your fuzzy blankets and have a toy-tastic time watching Toy Story 3! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 1 hour and 43 minutes.

Description: Drop in with projects, questions, or inspiration for an afternoon with expert volunteers who are happy to assist you along your sewing journey.
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Just Dance! (For Tweens)
Description: Calling all Tweens!! Are you ready for a dance off? Come to the Lakewood Ranch Meeting Room A on July 16th from 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm for an afternoon of playing Just Dance! The library has 4 controllers, feel free to bring your own to hook up to our Switch. There is a max of 6 connected controllers at one time.
Categories: Art Instruction > Dance, Fun & Games, Summer Learning

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Adulting 101 Presents: A Little Bit of Everything
Description: Back by popular demand! Teens will be introduced to practical skills for adult life in this fun and interactive series of classes. This week, join Rachel to learn a little bit of everything. We will talk about things like applying for jobs and housing, maintaining your own living space, and things to be aware of.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: WWII on AMI
Description: Troops on the beaches, bombs off Passage Key, aircraft overhead—this was life on Anna Maria Island during World War II. Join Librarian Katie Fleck for a talk about the impact of WWII on our Island and how locals participated in the war effort.

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Drop-in Art for Preschoolers
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 for simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!

Title: Family Storytime
Description: Join us for a fun-filled hour of stories, music, dancing, and crafts! No registration required.
Event Organizer: Keelia M - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Title: Silly Goose Preschool Storytime
Description: Enjoy books, rhymes, songs, and activities with your preschooler. For ages 3-5 with an adult caregiver.

Title: Toddler Time
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Toddler Storytime
Description:
Join Miss Chris for stories and fun! 

Limited to 40 children

Title: 70s Aerobics
Description: Get your disco groove on with this exciting aerobics class!

Title: One-on-One Cricut Machine Learning
Description: Learn the basics of how to use the Cricut Machine and Cricut design space using the resources provided here at the library.
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description: Join us at Palmetto Library on the third Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources. No registration required.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Makerspace Adult Drop-in
Description: This is your time in our makerspace to use Cricut, sewing machines, 3D printers and more!

Title: Meditation with Manching: Path to Inner Peace
Description:
Come join us in this introductory workshop to explore the basics of mindfulness meditation:  Its theory and practice as well as its physical, mental and spiritual benefits.  All levels are welcome.  Taught by Manching Tom, certified Meditation Teacher.  Registration is required.  

Consider bringing a cushion or pillow for additional support in your chair.  This is optional.

***Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed for this workshop.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Musical Motion
Description: Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Title: Sharks & Rays Conservation Research
Description:
What is happening to all the sharks? It's a puzzle 400 hundred million years in the making. Using clues from the past we will uncover why sharks and rays are threatened today and investigate how to save them for the future. From the legacy of Dr. Eugenie Clark to the pioneering research of today's FinPrint, Mote is your guide to the "fintastic" world of shark and ray conservation and research.

Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: Feeding Your Vitality: Exploring the Connection Between Food and Wellness
Description:
We’ve all heard the expression “you are what you eat.” Well, do you really know what’s in your food? In this workshop we’ll learn how to read and understand nutrition labels, what ingredients we should avoid, what foods we should incorporate into our meals, portion size and other aspects about food that either help or hurt our wellness. This workshop will spark your curiosity to learn more about what you eat and how you can really fuel your body well with the right choices.



This is part of a Wellness Workshop Series presented by National Board Certified Health Coach, Carrie Ehrlich (NBC-HWC) of Transform Wellness. Learn more: transformwellnessllc.com

Join us on July 30th for Lifestyle Longevity: Setting Your Course for Lasting Wellness at 6:30 pm presented by Carrie Ehrilich

Title: MSPS Boating Safety Course
Description:
This is an 8 hour couse that continues on Saturday, July 27th. If you register for this course, you are automatically registered for the second class.

Taking this boating class reduces your risk of accidents and injuries, saves you money on boat insurance, and qualifies you for a Florida Boating Safety Education Identification Card. Presented by an experienced mariners of Manatee Sail and Power Squadron.

The Power Squadron gives out a small certificate of completion the final day.  The Florida Fish and Wildlife mails students a Boating Safety Card.

COST IS $30, CASH OR CHECK. Textbook is included with the price. Same family couples can share a text book and only need to pay one $30 registration fee.

 

America’s Boating Course is the most comprehensive, single source, in-person boating course available to give you the skills you need to enjoy your time on the water and boat with confidence.

What You’ll Learn:
•Information about your State Boating Laws, regulations, boat registration, and licensing.

•Required boating safety equipment
•Do’s and Don’ts of boating safely
•Practical Knowledge of navigation and rules of the road
•How to handle medical emergencies onboard and mechanical problems on the water
•The basics of towing and trailering
•Special important information for hunters, anglers, and sports enthusiasts.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Education, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Sports & Leisure

Title: Rooftop Yoga

Title: 20s and 30s Book Club: Crazy Rich Asians
Description:
Looking to meet others in their 20s and 30s? Join us this month as we discuss the humorous romance novel Crazy Rich Asians by Kevin Kwan. Attendees are also encouraged to watch the 2018 movie adaptation of Crazy Rich Asians by director Jon M. Chu for some additional conversation. Copies of both are available through the Manatee County Public Library system, so reserve yours today! 



Whether you loved it, liked it, or hated it, we hope to see you for a fun and interesting discussion!



This event is intended for those aged 20-39. Registration is required.

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.

Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Needle Arts Studio-Open Sew and Knit

Participants must bring their own fabric, patterns, thread, and notions necessary for their personal projects, but tools will be provided. We have 4 Janome sewing machines, 2 sergers, and large cutting mats.
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Adulting 101 Presents: Basic Auto Maintenance
Description: Back by popular demand! Teens will be introduced to practical skills for adult life in this fun and interactive series of classes. Do you have a car? Do you know when to get an oil change? How about replacing your windshield wiper fluid? If not, join us for the extra special session of Adulting 101 to learn everything you need to know about owning a car.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Memory Cafe
Description: A memory cafe is a comfortable social gathering that welcomes people with memory loss and their loved ones. We gather to help you connect, socialize, and build new support groups in a stigma-free environment. The cafe is free, but registration is required—maximum of ten couples.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Kids will be introduced to the concept of water safety and learn tips on how to avoid dangers in and around the water. Their fun mascot, Bubbles, will be onhand, and all children will receive a take-home goodie bag.

Come help excavate a “shipwreck” and uncover the details of the past.

Title: MSPS Boating Safety Course
Description:
This is an 8 hour couse that continues on Saturday, July 27th. If you register for this course, you are automatically registered for the second class.

Taking this boating class reduces your risk of accidents and injuries, saves you money on boat insurance, and qualifies you for a Florida Boating Safety Education Identification Card. Presented by an experienced mariners of Manatee Sail and Power Squadron.

The Power Squadron gives out a small certificate of completion the final day.  The Florida Fish and Wildlife mails students a Boating Safety Card.

COST IS $30, CASH OR CHECK. Textbook is included with the price. Same family couples can share a text book and only need to pay one $30 registration fee.

 

America’s Boating Course is the most comprehensive, single source, in-person boating course available to give you the skills you need to enjoy your time on the water and boat with confidence.

What You’ll Learn:
•Information about your State Boating Laws, regulations, boat registration, and licensing.

•Required boating safety equipment
•Do’s and Don’ts of boating safely
•Practical Knowledge of navigation and rules of the road
•How to handle medical emergencies onboard and mechanical problems on the water
•The basics of towing and trailering
•Special important information for hunters, anglers, and sports enthusiasts.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: Education, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Sports & Leisure

Title: Meditation with Isha Foundation
Description:
In this one-hour session you will learn Isha Kriya, a simple 12-18 minute practice, to help you to become meditative effortlessly.  

Attain health, clarity, and joy! Isha Kriya does not require previous experience with meditation and can be done sitting in a chair.

Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Description: Let's craft friendship keychains. All materials provided.
Audiences: Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years)
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Title: Introduction to FamilySearch
Description:
Please join us for a one-hour introduction class on FamilySearch offered by Regina Negrycz. We will be learning how to research ship passenger records, military records, census records, and how to use the FamilySearch Wiki.

FamilySearch is a website offering genealogical records operated by the LDS Church. They maintain a collection of records, resources, and services designed to help people learn more about their family history. Registration is required, thank you!

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club

Title: Musical Motion
Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Description:
Get together with friends and family and get creative! Each week will be a different craft that is appropriate for ages 10+. Hosted by local artist, Enith Marin. Supplies are provided. Registration is required. 

Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library.

Description: Here's your opportunity to give the gift of blood. The Suncoast bloodmobile will be parked in the Rocky Bluff Library parking lot from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Online appointments are encouraged. Donors will be entered for a chance to win a 300$ Amazon gift card! To make an appointment to donate, please visit https://donorportal.suncoastblood.org/index.php/drive?view=employeesearch&id_employee=140

Title: End of Summer Party
Description: End the summer with a fun-filled party. Join us for games, crafts, and treats!
Categories: Fun & Games, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Summer Learning

Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Level Up at the Library!
Description: Join us this month for a Smash Bros Tournament on the Switch! Please register for this special event.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Lifestyle Longevity: Setting Your Course for Lasting Wellness
Description:
Due to popular demand, we're bringing this workshop back for an evening edition!

It’s one thing to live a long life but how can we live it well? In this workshop, we’ll discuss components of a healthy lifestyle that can enhance our longevity and areas where a few small changes may yield big results in the quality of our lives long-term. You’ll come away with some ideas of how to readily apply some improvements to your life that set you on a healthy course. 



This is part of a Wellness Workshop Series presented by National Board Certified Health Coach, Carrie Ehrlich (NBC-HWC) of Transform Wellness. Learn more: transformwellnessllc.com

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: End of Summer Learning Celebration
Description:
Come celebrate with us in our outdoor lawn space for the whole family to finish off our summer learning program with sidewalk chalk, music, and backyard lawn games! Kona Ice, Bite Me Cookies by Cindy, and Wow Wow Lemonade will be out back where you'll be able to purchase shaved ice, various types of fresh baked cookies and homemade ice cream sandwiches, and lemonade from 10 am to 12 pm. 

Meet Marty the Marauder in our Kids Space for a photo op! Bat City Comic will be in our Workshop from 10 am to 12 pm where you create your own comic!

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Description: Enjoy books, rhymes, songs, and activities with your preschooler. For ages 3-5 with an adult caregiver.

Title: Back to School Cricut Craft
Description: It's that time of year again-Back to School! You'll arrive in style, while keeping your gear organized with these easy DIY custom draw string backpacks made with a Cricut and iron-on vinyl! Personalize yours with your name, a monogram, a fun phrase, or an image. If you're not familiar with Cricut technology, don't worry! Our skilled presenter, Steve Aldrich, will be here to support you the whole way. LWR Library will provide all materials. Registration is required.
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Cozy Game Night
Description: Do you own a Nintendo Switch and Cozy Games like Animal Crossing, Stardew Valley, or Spiritfarer? Looking to meet fellow players and make friends? Do you just love to game? If so, come mingle with others, play games, and relax. Snacks and refreshments will be provided.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Crafty Attic Series
Description: Come join us in the Palmetto Makerspace where we do crafts that would remind you of what you can find in your grandparents attic! Something old? Something new? Who knows. Different innovative craft every month. Registration required.

Title: Knitting and Crochet Club
Description: Come join us for our knitting and crochet club. All levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Description: Join the Sarasota Gulf Chapter of the American Sewing Guild for a monthly sewing club. Each month, a Guild member will demonstrate a project which everyone will then work on together.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Digitizing for Disaster
Description: As hurricane season rolls in you may be thinking about stocking up on water and flashlights. Have you thought about your documents and family heirlooms? Learn best practices for protecting your paper records from natural disaster in the Archive Lab.
Event Organizer: Ericka Dow- Manatee County Public Library

Title: Who Was Alexander Hamilton?
Description: This presentation provides an overview of the life and accomplishments of Alexander Hamilton, one of the United States of America’s most important founders. It covers his time as a soldier in the American Revolution, his career as a lawyer, his role as the first Secretary of the Treasury, and much more!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Family Lego Day
Description: Have fun with Legos, Blocks, and Puzzles, plus an exciting craft!

LOCATED IN THE CONFERENCE ROOM.

Title: CANCELED: Tai Chi
Description: Tai Chi was originally developed as a martial art in the 13th century. It is a gentle non-impact exercise. Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: CANCELED: Meditation with Isha Foundation
Description:
In this one-hour session you will learn Isha Kriya, a simple 12-18 minute practice, to help you to become meditative effortlessly.  

Attain health, clarity, and joy! Isha Kriya does not require previous experience with meditation and can be done sitting in a chair.

Description: Certified service dogs are coming to visit the library, and they want you to read to them! Perfect for those who want to practice their reading skills in a low-stress environment. These super affectionate dogs are all ears!

Title: CANCELED: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.


Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: CANCELLED: Introduction to Ancestry.com
Description:
Please join us for a one-hour introduction class on Ancestry.com offered by Regina Negrycz. Ancestry is a subscription website for family history with over 40 billion records. While it is a subscription site, there are some free resources. We will be learning how to research passenger records, military records, census records, and more. Registration is required, thank you!

This class will be offered again on Monday, August 19th at 11:00 am if you are unable to attend this session. Please click on this link to register.

Title: CANCELLED: Movie Night: Wonder Woman (PG-13)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! Wonder Woman came out in the summer of 2017 where it was the first ever female led superhero film. It was also the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer, grossing over $409 million domestically. So come on out and enjoy a wonderful movie! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 2 hours and 21 minutes.

Title: CANCELLED: Jazzercise on the Rooftop!
Description:
What IS Jazzercise? We're a fun, effective full body workout set to the best music! We're heart pumping cardio, muscle sculpting & mood boosting stretching! We’re the original group fitness class but we're current & change with the times! Seriously, we know what we're doing! Is Jazzercise for you? We're for everyBODY, every age, stage & fitness level. 

We’re excited to bring Jazzercise to the rooftop! Join us for a super fun sweat sesh packed with dance cardio, strength training & stretching! It’s our HIIT class we call Power Sculpt! Dress to sweat, bring water, a yoga mat, and handheld weights (optional: class can be done all standing without weights). Our studio is located at 9009 Town Center Parkway, we have 27 classes, morning and night, 7 days a week! For more information, please visit www.jazzerciselwr.com

Please note: This is a donation-based class, we appreciate your generosity and cash donations are appreciated! Thank you!

Title: Star Jars (ADULTS & TEENS CRAFT)
Description:
Write down messages onto paper strips, then fold these strips into little origami stars. We will then put these little stars into star shaped glass jars, and put labels on them. 

Color options are gold (pictured), or rainbow. All supplies provided.

PLEASE NOTE: This program is for ages 13+. These crafts have a difficulty targeting an older age group. Please do not sign up if you are below age 13. Thank you!
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources.

Title: 'Murder by the Book' Book Club: Sworn to Silence, by Linda Castillo
Description: In the sleepy rural town of Painters Mill, Ohio, the Amish and “English” residents have lived side by side for two centuries. But sixteen years ago, a series of brutal murders shattered the peaceful farming community. In the aftermath of the violence, the town was left with a sense of fragility, a loss of innocence. Kate Burkholder, a young Amish girl, survived the terror of the Slaughterhouse Killer but came away from its brutality with the realization that she no longer belonged with the Amish. Now, a wealth of experience later, Kate has been asked to return to Painters Mill as chief of police. Her Amish roots and big city law enforcement background make her the perfect candidate. She’s certain she’s come to terms with her past―until the first body is discovered in a snowy field. Kate vows to stop the killer before he strikes again. But to do so, she must betray both her family and her Amish past―and expose a dark secret that could destroy her. (Goodreads)

Learn about the painting, how it was discovered, how it was restored – and was it really by Leonardo da Vinci? Kids get to draw and color various paintings and drawings by Leonardo and others.

Title: Literary Travel Through the US Book Club--Maine: Olive Kitteridge, by Elizabeth Strout

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Book Discussion Group: The Women, by Kristin Hannah
Description: The Women is the story of one woman gone to war, but it shines a light on all women who put themselves in harm’s way and whose sacrifice and commitment to their country has too often been forgotten. A novel about deep friendships and bold patriotism, The Women is a richly drawn story with a memorable heroine whose idealism and courage under fire will come to define an era.

Title: Gardening Club
Description:
Join us at the Palmetto Library to help weed, plant, and maintain the new library learning garden! Water, gardening gloves, and some tools provided, but feel free to bring your own, too. 


All ages welcome, but 12 and under need parent/guardian to participate with them. Sponsored by the Palmetto Friends of the Library. 
*May be cancelled at any time due to unforeseen circumstances.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Drop-in Art for Preschoolers
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 for simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Title: Preschool Yoga (Mats provided)

Mats are provided! WAIVER ATTACHED FOR DOWNLOAD. PLEASE SIGN AND BRING TO THE SESSION.

Title: Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club - The Henna Artist by Alka Joshi
Description:
Vivid and compelling in its portrait of one woman’s struggle for fulfillment in a society pivoting between the traditional and the modern, The Henna Artist opens a door into a world that is at once lush and fascinating, stark and cruel.

Escaping from an abusive marriage, seventeen-year-old Lakshmi makes her way alone to the vibrant 1950s pink city of Jaipur. There she becomes the most highly requested henna artist—and confidante—to the wealthy women of the upper class. But trusted with the secrets of the wealthy, she can never reveal her own…

Known for her original designs and sage advice, Lakshmi must tread carefully to avoid the jealous gossips who could ruin her reputation and her livelihood. As she pursues her dream of an independent life, she is startled one day when she is confronted by her husband, who has tracked her down these many years later with a high-spirited young girl in tow—a sister Lakshmi never knew she had. Suddenly the caution that she has carefully cultivated as protection is threatened. Still she perseveres, applying her talents and lifting up those that surround her as she does. (From Goodreads).
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Science Fiction/Fantasy Book Club: The Many Deaths of Laila Starr #1, by Ram V
Description: Come read with us across galaxies and through enchanted forests by joining our Science Fiction/Fantasy book group!  This book club meets the third Saturday of every month. We read not only sci-fi and fantasy classics, but also newer and more diverse voices in the genre. We’ll read graphic novels and short story collections, too! In August, we'll be discussing the graphic novel The Many Deaths of Laila Starr #1 by Ram V.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.


Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Introduction to Ancestry.com
Description: Please join us for a one-hour introduction class on Ancestry.com offered by Regina Negrycz. Ancestry is a subscription website for family history with over 40 billion records. While it is a subscription site, there are some free resources. We will be learning how to research passenger records, military records, census records, and more. Registration is required, thank you!

Description: Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.
