For ages 0-5!

Title: Digital Sketchbook Studio
Description:
Bring a digital touchscreen device with your favorite art app and engage in a variety of fun, introductory and experimental drawing, painting, and composition techniques.

Activities will also include discussion and practice of mindfulness as a part of the creative process.

(The free Sketchbook app is recommended for those new to digital art, but participants may use the drawing app of their choice.  Stylus tool provided.)

Title: FINANZAS CON SENAY
Description: FINANZAS CON SENAY, EL OBJETIVO DE ESTAS CHARLAS ES COMENZAR A VER LAS FINANZAS DESDE OTRAS PERSPECTIVAS, NO SOLAMENTE FINANCIERAS, AUNQUE APRENDERAS TECNICAS ECONOMICAS, QUE TE AYUDARAN A MEJORAR TU SITUACION FINANCIERA, PERO LO MAS IMPORTANTE ES COMENZAR A OBSERVAR DESDE DONDE VIENEN ESOS CONDICIONAMIENTOS QUE NO TE DEJAN TENER LA VIDA QUE SUEÑAS, DE ALLI QUE ES IMPORTANTE, TOMAR CONSCIENCIA DE ELLO Y A LA VEZ IR APRENDIENDO A IDENTIFICAR ESE PROGRAMA  MENTAL  ACERCA DEL DINERO, QUE NOS RIGE LA VIDA

Title: Family Movie Night: E.T. the Extraterrestrial (PG)
Description: Join us in celebrating Summer Movie Blockbusters from the past! E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial came out in the summer of 1982 where it was the #1 highest grossing movie of the summer, grossing over $238 million domestically. It is one of the rare movies to be shot mostly in chronological order, in order to help the actors deliver out of this world performances. So come on out in your comfy pjs! Bring your fuzzy blankets! And enjoy E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:15 pm and will run for 1 hour and 55 minutes.
Categories: Film, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

PLEASE NOTE: This program is for ages 13+. These crafts have a difficulty targeting an older age group. Please do not sign up if you are below age 13. Thank you!

Title: Getting Started with Podcasting
Description: Take a dive into the basics of podcasting, from coming up with topics, to brainstorming, to the basics of the different varieties of tools and technology are available. Take some time to learn and ask questions about how to get started.

Title: Needle Arts Studio-Open Sew and Knit
Description: Do you sew, knit, quilt, crochet, do handwork or English paper piecing? Bring your projects and join us! Get some inspiration or assistance if needed. Participants must bring their own fabric, patterns, thread, and notions necessary for their personal projects, but tools will be provided. We have 4 Janome sewing machines, 2 sergers, and large cutting mats.
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Toy Parachute Rooftop Drop!
Description:
All Tweens (ages 8-12) are welcome to the LWR Branch STEAM Tuesday's!

On August 20th, you will design and create your own parachute in the Makerspace Workshop using twine or string, tissues or papers of sorts, and a 3-d printed toy figurine. Then, head to the rooftop and drop them down to the ground! 


	Limit to 20 tweens. Registration will open 1 month in advance.
	Registration is required with spots held for only 15 minutes after start time; Waitlisted guests will fill in spots in the order of registration.
	Parents/Guardians must remain in the library building at all times while tweens are participating in the event; The responsibility for the safety and behavior of children in the library rests with the parent/care giver and not the library personnel.
	Supplies are provided by the library during the event and are available while supplies last.

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed.
Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed:
•    Plastic tablecloth
•    Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12
•    Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent)
•    Rubbing alcohol
•    Acrylic rod
•    Tissue blades for cutting clay
•    Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags)
•    Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade
•    Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Celebrating Women's Equality Day - a historical presentation of the Suffragist movement
Description:
In celebration of Women’s Equality Day, the public is invited to a free historical presentation on the decades long campaign by Suffragists to gain the right to vote for women in the U.S.  Women's Equality Day is held on August 26 each year.  The date was chosen to commemorate the day in 1920 when  Secretary of State Bainbridge Colby signed the proclamation granting American women the constitutional right to vote. 



The League of Women Voters Manatee County (LWVMC) presentation will introduce participants to the leaders of the Suffragist movement in our country, lay out key dates and events in the 72 year timeline to gain the right to vote for women, and share a few historical photos from the struggle.
Presenter: Terri Kondos, Chairman of the LWVMC Voter Services Action Team

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years)

Title: One Blood Bloodmobile
Description:
The One Blood Bus will be available in Palmetto Branch's north parking lot to all those who would like to donate blood.

Online appointments are encouraged. 

There are health benefits of donating blood. Below are just a few of the Benefits:

1. A Healthier Heart System and Vascular System: Helps to decrease blood pressure

2. A Calorie-Free Snack – Your body burns about 500 calories while replacing the blood you donated

3. Lowers the Risk for: Liver, lung, colon, stomach and throat cancer

4. Stimulation of New Blood Cells – New Cells help to Oxygenate your body better.

5. Loss of Wight – You can lose 1% of your body weight

6. Iron – For those that have higher levels of iron, donating helps to decrease the level of iron to healthier level.

7. Cholesterol – Helps to reduce cholesterol levels

8.  Each donations helps to save up to  3 lives.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Career Quest (TEENS)
Description: Embark on your career journey at Career Quest, a dynamic fair tailored for young adults at the local library. Explore diverse career paths with informational tables hosted by professionals from various industries, while also engaging with representatives from schools to discover educational opportunities. Don't miss this chance to gain valuable insights and make connections that could shape your future success! This event is designed with middle and high school students in mind but is open to all ages. If you would like more information about this event, please email Jenn.Leland@mymanatee.org.

Title: Drop-in Virtual Reality
Description: : Join us for games, stories, and educational experiences with the Oculus Quest virtual reality headset! For your safety, we require all participants to be over the age of 13, and we advise those with motion sickness, migraines, or any other conditions that could be exacerbated by VR to exercise caution.

Title: Just Dance! (For Tweens)
Description: Calling all Tweens!! Are you ready for a dance off? Come to the Lakewood Ranch Meeting Room A from 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm for an afternoon of playing Just Dance! The library has 4 controllers, feel free to bring your own to hook up to our Switch. There is a max of 6 connected controllers at one time.
Presenter: Jill Franxman, Miranda Johnson, Julia Richardson, Melanie Velazquez & Brianna Wilson

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Mandarin I Chinese Classes
Description: This class is designed for people who have no previous Mandarin Chinese language experience,  but have a desire to explore the language and culture of China. We will begin with the introduction to the four fundamental building blocks of study: listening comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing. In addition, we also will introduce the culture of China and investigate the meaning of Chinese characters

Books on Tap is a monthly book club that meets at 3 Keys Brewing & Eatery, 2505 Manatee Ave. E. in Bradenton. We have a very informal and relaxed setup. Come ready to talk about any book you’re reading, ask for recommendations, or just enjoy some bookish company. 

Anyone 21 and up is welcome to join us!

Enjoy good books, good beer, and good conversation!

Join us at the Palmetto Library for a fun-filled hour of play! 

The more you play the more you learn. Play is so good for us. It feeds the brain. It builds skills and knowledge. During play, children engage with and learn about the world around them. No registration required!

Title: Creative Aging: Painting Techniques
Description:
We’ll learn different techniques as well as how to get the most out of your paintings. You learn different strokes, the difference between watercolor and gauche, and how to achieve specific results using the different techniques.

This series is for Seniors, 55+. Students are encouraged to bring their own paints and brushes, however the instructor will have supplies and paper available.

Register once to be automatically registered for all classes.  Classes include:

Class 1- Perspectives on perspective- diving deeper into how learning perspective affects your composition.

Class 2 – “Expanding” Your Art – Learning the basics of gridding to be able to make accurate larger piece.

Class 3 – Made in the Shade – Learn how shading, blending and learn about how light and shadows enhance your art

Class 4 – Shading Techniques – Learn about crosshatching, blending and discussion of pointillism

Class 5 – Untangling Zentangle, - Learn how to create Zentangles, a way to draw as well as relax

Class 6 – Drawing Mandalas – Learn how to draw Mandalas
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Intro to Cricut Certification Class
Description:
For DIY enthusiasts who want to begin creating crafts that are both professional-quality and easy to make, the Cricut is the greatest tool to achieve your goal. In this beginner's course, you'll discover the basics behind the materials, tools, and resources you'll need to get started. (Participants must be at least 13 years old and sign a Workshop Waiver, acknowledging user and safety guidelines. This course is a prerequisite to attending Cricut Open Hours at a later date, even if you have previous experience using a Cricut.) 

Presented by Steve Aldrich

This class will go through the parts, terms, and basic uses of both laptop and desktop computers including hardware, typing, using a mouse, and several types of software. Bring along your laptop and be ready for hands on practice. A few devices are available to borrow for those with desktop computers. Please email Kaitlynn to check for device availability and reservation: Kaitlynn.bosley@mymanatee.org

This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed.

Please, bring your own mat.

Description:
In this one-hour session you will learn Isha Kriya, a simple 12-18 minute practice, to help you to become meditative effortlessly.  

Attain health, clarity, and joy! Isha Kriya does not require previous experience with meditation and can be done sitting in a chair.

Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.


Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Sound Healing
Description:
Are you looking for a way to relax and rejuvenate your mind, body, and spirit? Join us for a transformative sound healing session and let the vibrations of sound bring you into a state of deep relaxation and wellbeing. This unique experience can help you to connect with your inner self, find inner peace and harmony, and gently wash away stress and tension. Sign up for this sound healing session and embark on a journey of self-discovery and healing. 

Yoga mats are recommended for sitting on the floor, but not required.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: 3D Printer Drop In
Description: Come by to check out our 3D printer during open hours in our makerspace room, Tinker Tank 26. Here you can make something and take it home.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Board Game Night for Tweens
Description: Come play some board games with new friends! Bring your own or have fun with ours! Intended for ages 8-12.

Title: Chef Warren’s One Pot Meals
Description: Whether you’re cooking in a crock pot or Dutch oven, you’ll find yourself making these incredible one-pot meals for your family or dinner guests.

Title: Rocky Bluff Trivia NIght

Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Adult Book Discussion Group: The Personal Librarian by Marie Benedict
Description: In her twenties, Belle da Costa Greene is hired by J. P. Morgan to curate a collection of rare manuscripts, books, and artwork for his newly built Pierpont Morgan Library. Belle becomes a fixture on the New York society scene and one of the most powerful people in the art and book world, known for her impeccable taste and shrewd negotiating for critical works as she helps build a world-class collection. But Belle has a secret, one she must protect at all costs. (Description by GoodReads)
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Making Sense of Medicare
Description:
Ready to Navigate the Medicare Waters? Are you feeling a bit adrift when it comes to Medicare? About to hit the big 65 or preparing to set sail into retirement? Choosing the right Medicare plan can feel like navigating unchartered waters, but don’t worry — I’m here to be your trusty compass on this journey! Join us for a FREE interactive and educational session where we’ll unravel the complexities of Medicare and help you make sense of it all! 

Your guide, Amy McCarthy of Waterside Insurance Solutions, is a licensed Independent Insurance Agent specializing in Medicare. She’ll help ensure that your journey through the Medicare seas is smooth sailing! In this fun and informative session, we will help answer your questions as we guide you to:

Understand Original Medicare: Learn what traditional Medicare is (and isn’t).

Unravel the ABCDs of Medicare: Dive into Parts A, B, C & D.

Choose Your Path: Discover the differences between Medicare Supplements and Medicare Advantage Plans.

Dodge the Fees: Learn when to enroll – and how to avoid penalties!

But wait – there’s more! All attendees will be entered into a raffle! You can earn one extra raffle ticket for each person you invite who attends with you! Attendees will also enjoy delicious treats while you learn! 

For accommodations of persons with special needs at meetings call 941-258-9440 or 711 (TTY)

Title: Creative Aging: Painting Techniques
Description:
We’ll learn different techniques as well as how to get the most out of your paintings. You learn different strokes, the difference between watercolor and gauche, and how to achieve specific results using the different techniques.

This series is for Seniors, 55+. Students are encouraged to bring their own paints and brushes, however the instructor will have supplies and paper available.

Register once to be automatically registered for all classes.  Classes include:

Class 1- Perspectives on perspective- diving deeper into how learning perspective affects your composition.

Class 2 – “Expanding” Your Art – Learning the basics of gridding to be able to make accurate larger piece.

Class 3 – Made in the Shade – Learn how shading, blending and learn about how light and shadows enhance your art

Class 4 – Shading Techniques – Learn about crosshatching, blending and discussion of pointillism

Class 5 – Untangling Zentangle, - Learn how to create Zentangles, a way to draw as well as relax

Class 6 – Drawing Mandalas – Learn how to draw Mandalas
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Fall Writing Workshop
Description:
Attention new and experienced writers! Join us for a monthly workshop to celebrate our writing and improve our craft. The first half of the workshop will be an interactive lesson on one aspect of writing and will include prompts to help you tap into your creativity.

For the second half of the workshop, attendees will read excerpts of each other’s writing and give constructive, positive feedback. Writers who do not have a writing sample to share with the group can still attend the first half of the workshop. Please email up to five double-spaced pages of writing for feedback to stephaniekatz@live.com the night before each workshop. 

Please note, this workshop is for writers of all experience levels, including aspiring writers who have not yet started a writing project. While this workshop is focused on prose writing (both fiction such as novels and nonfiction such as memoirs), poets can still attend. *Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library*

Title: Murder By the Book: Adult Book Club: All the Devils Are Here by Louise Penny
Description: On their first night in Paris, the Gamaches gather as a family for a bistro dinner with Armand's godfather, the billionaire Stephen Horowitz. Walking home together after the meal, they watch in horror as Stephen is knocked down and critically injured in what Gamache knows is no accident, but a deliberate attempt on the elderly man's life. When a strange key is found in Stephen's possession it sends Armand, his wife Reine-Marie, and his former second-in-command at the Sûreté, Jean-Guy Beauvoir, from the top of the Tour d'Eiffel, to the bowels of the Paris Archives, from luxury hotels to odd, coded, works of art. It sends them deep into the secrets Armand's godfather has kept for decades. (Description by GoodReads)

	Supplies are provided by the library during the event and are available while supplies last.

Title: Yarn Hour
Description: For fiber crafters to get together and work on projects and share knowledge and learn new techniques.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: American Sewing Guild
Description: This community sewing guild is associated with the Sarasota Gulf Coast Chapter of the American Sewing Guild. The "Creative Sassy Sewers," as they call themselves, make items for anyone in need: babies, children, adults, seniors, and pets! If you sew, come join them as they look for opportunities to give, using their talents, time, and interest.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Family Stroller Strides with FIT4MOM Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota
Description:
Join us for a special family Stroller Strides "Family Day class" from 9:30 am to 10:30 am for babies and toddlers hosted by FIT4MOM Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota! This event is FREE but please register ahead of time as space is limited. We will have bubbles, sidewalk chalk, music, and MORE! 

Stroller Strides® is a 60-minute total-body workout with strength, cardio, and core training, all while engaging the little ones in a stroller! You'll leave class feeling strong, empowered, connected, and energized - no matter your stage of motherhood.

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a donation-based group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Ask a Master Gardener
Description: Master Gardener volunteers from the local UF/IFAS Extension Office will be available to answer your questions and share information on flora and landscaping in Florida.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Paint a Wooden Pumpkin
Description: Calling all crafty kiddos! Join the Youth Services staff in painting your wooden pumpkins. REGISTRATION IS REQUIRED.

Title: Polymer Clay
Description:
Monthly meeting of guild members working on various polymer clay projects. Newcomers are welcome. It is highly recommended to bring your own supplies. The library may or may not have everything needed. 

Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed: 


	
	Plastic tablecloth 
	
	
	Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12 
	
	
	Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent) 
	
	
	Rubbing alcohol 
	
	
	Acrylic rod 
	
	
	Tissue blades for cutting clay 
	
	
	Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags) 
	
	
	Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade 
	
	
	Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Intro to Archive Lab
Description: Want to digitize your family photos, scrapbooks, or VHS videos but not sure where to start? Learn best practices for organizing, scanning, and saving your family heirlooms. You’ll have a chance to practice on each of the Archive Lab’s equipment and leave prepared to start your own scanning project.

Title: Little World Traveler's: Storytime
Description: Come and travel around the world with us. Join us for story time, songs and interactive playing for kids ages 4-7. Registration is required.
Categories: Culture, International, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks

Title: Drop-in Knitting
Description: Join other knitters for an afternoon of knitting. We’ll meet in the new Maker Space and you may bring your knitting projects. This program suitable for knitters of all levels; needles and yarn available for on-site use.

Title: So You Want To Run An RPG?
Description: Learn how to get started running a roleplaying game to play with friends or family. No experience necessary, just bring your imagination! Get free resources and find out how easy it is to run a campaign! All ages.

Title: Author Talk: James R. Benn, The Phantom Patrol
Description: Meet local author James R. Benn and discuss his new book, The Phantom Patrol, a Billy Boyle WWII Mystery. The series overall is beloved by historical fiction readers, military buffs, espionage fans and critics alike, with praise from authors such as Louise Penny, Lee Child, and Megan Abbott. The New York Times has described this historical detective series as “extremely well tended by an author who clearly dotes on his hero. As do we.”

Title: ¡Juguemos Lotería! Let’s play Lotería! (Bilingüe / Bilingual)
Description:
Únase a nosotros para celebrar el Mes de la Herencia Hispana con Lotería. Los juegos se jugarán tanto en español como en inglés, ¡así que todos pueden unirse para tener la oportunidad de ganar algunos premios!



Join us as we celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month with Lotería, a traditional game of chance similar to bingo enjoyed by many in Latin-American countries. Games will be played in both Spanish and English, so everyone is welcome to join for a chance to win some prizes!

Title: Teen Advisory Board
Description:
Teens: Do you want to have an impact on your library? We want to hear from YOU! Join the Teen Advisory Board to earn volunteer hours, build leadership experience, and get involved with your local libraries. 

Email Rachel to begin application process: Rachel.scharbo@mymanatee.org

Title: Tai Chi
Description: Tai Chi was originally developed as a martial art in the 13th century. It is a gentle non-impact exercise. Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Baby Storytime
Description:
Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Basic Spanish Class
Description: Join instructor Ginett Luby for an introduction to the Spanish language in this weekly series. This class is limited to 10 participants.

Title: Gentle Yoga
Description:
Enjoy this gentler style of hatha yoga practice with yoga instructor, Delphine. Gentle Yoga is performed at a slower pace, with less intense positions, and usually includes extended time for meditation, yogic breath work, and relaxation.

Please, bring your own mat.

Title: Public Health Information Lobby Table: Suicide Prevention; Healthy Aging; Prostate Health
Description: Representatives from the Florida Department of Health in Manatee County will be on hand to share info and handouts about the following topics: Suicide Prevention Month, Healthy Aging Month, Prostate Health Month.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Introduction to MyHeritage.com
Description: Please join us for a one-hour introduction class on MyHeritage.com offered by Regina Negrycz. MyHeritage is the second largest subscription website for family history.  While it is a subscription site, there are some free resources.  We will be learning how to research ship passenger records, military records, census records and more. Registration is required, thank you!

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description:
Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.  

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Musical Motion
Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Title: Introductory Crochet Class Series
Description:
A series of classes to teach absolute beginners the foundations of crochet. Over this six-part series, we will learn the basics of crochet and how you can create one-of-a-kind gifts, clothing, and toys. Crochet hooks and yarn will be provided during the first class, though bringing one's own supplies is accepted and encouraged.

Once you register, you will be registered for all classes in the series: Sept 16, 30, Oct 7, 21, Nov 4, 18.
Categories: Crafts, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Family Movie Nights: Coco
Description: In celebration of National Hispanic Month National, please join us in watching Coco! Come on out in your comfy pjs, bring your fuzzy blankets and have a fun time! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:30 pm and will run for 1 hour and 49 minutes.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families, Toddlers (18 months-3 years)
Categories: Film, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Drawing for Adults
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a four-week course on drawing for adults!  When you sign up for the first class, you will be registered for all four!

 

Class 1 – Learning Perspective – Learn about perspective in drawing

Class 2 – Composition – Understanding how to compose a drawing for the best effect.

Class 3 – Gesture Drawing – A fun class using multiple models 

Class 4 – Drawing From the Heart – Learning to use inspiration and freehand drawing what you’re “thinking”.

 

All materials provided!

Title: English as a Second Language (ESL) Classes (REGISTRATION LINK PROVIDED)
Description:
English tutoring and conversational classes. Presented by the Manatee Literacy Council. Clases de tutorial y conversacion gratutas para adultos. Audience: 18+

Limited to 15 people.

Please register using this link: https://secure.lglforms.com/form_engine/s/xugw38WAzbDqxk9JXFTv8Q
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: English as a Second Language (ESL) Classes (REGISTRATION LINK PROVIDED)
Description:
English tutoring and conversational classes. Presented by the Manatee Literacy Council. Clases de tutorial y conversacion gratutas para adultos. Audience: 18+

Limited to 15 people.

Please register using this link: https://secure.lglforms.com/form_engine/s/xugw38WAzbDqxk9JXFTv8Q

Title: Jazzercise on the Rooftop!
Description:
What IS Jazzercise? We're a fun, effective full body workout set to the best music! We're heart pumping cardio, muscle sculpting & mood boosting stretching! We’re the original group fitness class but we're current & change with the times! Seriously, we know what we're doing! Is Jazzercise for you? We're for everyBODY, every age, stage & fitness level. 

We’re excited to bring Jazzercise to the rooftop! Join us for a super fun sweat sesh packed with dance cardio, strength training & stretching! It’s our HIIT class we call Power Sculpt! Dress to sweat, bring water, a yoga mat, and handheld weights (optional: class can be done all standing without weights). Our studio is located at 9009 Town Center Parkway, we have 27 classes, morning and night, 7 days a week! For more information, please visit www.jazzerciselwr.com

Please note: This is a donation-based class, we appreciate your generosity and cash donations are appreciated! Thank you!

Title: Trivia Night!
Description: Join the fun! Come as a team or come alone and team up with a few others to play a few rounds of trivia! A different theme each month. Winners receive a prize book! Presenters are seasoned trivia hosts.

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play - Central Branch
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Title: Basic Spanish Class
Description: Join instructor Ginett Luby for an introduction to the Spanish language in this weekly series. This class is limited to 10 participants.

Title: Daisy Seed Bracelets (ADULTS & TEENS CRAFT)
Description:
Create seed bracelets. Featuring a daisy pattern participants can learn how to do if they wish. All supplies provided.

PLEASE NOTE: This program is for ages 13+. These crafts have a difficulty targeting an older age group. Please do not sign up if you are below age 13. Thank you!
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System
Presenter: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Digital Reads & More on Your Device
Description:
Learn how to check out e-books, e-audiobooks, movies, TV shows, and electronic magazines using the library apps Libby and Hoopla.

Location: Central Library Meeting Room
Event Organizer: Bethany Stevens - Manatee County Public Library
Presenter: Bethany Stevens - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Family Storytime
Description: Calling all families for creative play and interactive fun.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Families, Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Makerspace Adult Drop-in
Description:
This is your time in our makerspace to use Cricut, sewing machines, 3D printers and more.

Registration encouraged, but not required.
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Toddler Storytime
Description:
Join us for stories, songs, and rhymes and lots of movement for ages 18 months to 3 years. 

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Toddler Storytime
Description: Join Ms. Jenn for a magical journey through beloved stories followed by engaging activities designed to spark creativity and imagination in our youngest adventurers. From colorful crafts to interactive play, toddlers will delight in a fun-filled experience that fosters learning, laughter, and the joy of storytelling!

Title: Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and wear clothes you can stretch and move in. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified yoga teacher.

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description:
Sign up online or call 941-727-6079 to schedule a half hour session with staff. We can give instruction on using library downloads and databases and also offer basic instruction on laptops, tablets and smart-phones.

NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: Toddler Storytime
Description:
Join us for stories, songs, and rhymes and lots of movement for ages 18 months to 3 years. 

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Mahjong at Rocky Bluff
Description:
Callling all Mahjong players! Come play with new friends and neighbors at the Rocky Bluff Branch every Tuesday.

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Mahjong for Experienced Players
Description: Mahjong Club for experienced players. This program is intended for those who already know how to play.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play - South Manatee Branch
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description:
Sign up online or call 941-727-6079 to schedule a half hour session with staff. We can give instruction on using library downloads and databases and also offer basic instruction on laptops, tablets and smart-phones.

NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play - Palmetto Branch
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Housing Law--Know Your Rights!
Description: Representatives from Gulfcoasst Legal Services will be on-hand to discuss your rights as a tenant.

Title: Sewing Lab with the American Sewing Guild
Description:
Bring projects, questions, or inspiration for an afternoon with expert volunteers who are happy to assist you along your sewing journey.

Registration required due to limited number of sewing machines in the Makerspace.

We look forward to having you join us!
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Needle Arts Studio-Open Sew and Knit
Description: Do you sew, knit, quilt, crochet, do handwork or English paper piecing? Bring your projects and join us! Get some inspiration or assistance if needed. Participants must bring their own fabric, patterns, thread, and notions necessary for their personal projects, but tools will be provided. We have 4 Janome sewing machines, 2 sergers, and large cutting mats.
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Make a Paper Circuit!
Description:
All Tweens (ages 8-12) are welcome to the LWR Branch STEAM Tuesday's!

On September 17th, you will create a paper circuit that lights up an LED and is powered by a battery. 


	Limit to 20 tweens. Registration will open 1 month in advance.
	Registration is required with spots held for only 15 minutes after start time; Waitlisted guests will fill in spots in the order of registration.
	Parents/Guardians must remain in the library building at all times while tweens are participating in the event; The responsibility for the safety and behavior of children in the library rests with the parent/care giver and not the library personnel.
	Supplies are provided by the library during the event and are available while supplies last.

Title: Young Adult Writer's Workshop
Description: Dive into the world of words at our Writers Workshop! This interactive session invites teens to engage with fellow young writers, offering a chance to explore different genres, develop unique voices, and refine writing skills through workshops and peer feedback. It's the perfect space to transform your ideas into stories, receive encouragement, and discover the endless possibilities of storytelling.

Title: Sweat and Swagger
Description: Join Sweat & Swagger instructor Adrienne Quarlena for a heart pumping cardio dance workout that will have you dripping with sweat and leaving with swag.

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Curiosity Club: Birding Basics
Description:
Kids, come learn about the joys of birdwatching from Manatee Audubon Society. Each week our instructor will teach us about birds from different habitats around the county.

This is a series of 3 classes culminating in a field trip to the Felts Audubon Preserve, so please only sign up if you can attend all 4 events. This program is designed for school-ages children and their families.
Presenter: Tony Ford from Manatee Audubon Society
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families

Title: Drop-in Art for Preschoolers
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 for simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!

Title: Family Storytime
Description: Join us for a fun filled hour of stories, music, dancing, and crafts! No registration required.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Line Dancing - Beginners
Description:
Join instructor Jean Marcley for a fun-filled hour of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.


	Learn to dance
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social


*Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library*

Title: Resin Succulents
Description: Interested in resin? Have a hard time keeping plants alive? Come make your own resin succulent that will make a great addition to any area in the home.

Title: Silly Goose Preschool Storytime
Description: Enjoy books, rhymes, songs, and activities with your preschooler. For ages 3-5 with an adult caregiver.

Title: Toddler Storytime
Description:
Join Miss Chris for stories and fun! 

Limited to 40 children

Title: Toddler Time
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Tracing Your Roots: One-on-One Genealogy Assistance
Description: Bring your family information to make your pedigree chart. SueAnn Carpenter, Genealogist, DAR member, will provide one-on-one assistance to create your free family tree online. SueAnn will show you how to maneuver the site plus various links to verify documents (birth, marriage, death) and build the story of your ancestors.

Title: Library 101
Description: Discover the in's and out's of library technology in this informative presentation. Discover how to navigate our catalog, databases, self-checkout machines, Libby, Hoopla, and much more. Libraries are constantly evolving, so sieze the opportunity to maximize your library experience today!

Title: Line Dancing - Advanced
Description:
Join instructor Jean Marcley for a fun-filled hour of line dancing! If you've been line dancing for a while, this class is for YOU! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.


	Learn new dance moves
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social


*Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library*

Title: Musical Motion
Description: Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers' social skills, language skills, motor skills, and more.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description:
Join us at Palmetto Library on the third Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources. 

To register, call 800-272-3900.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Makerspace Adult Drop-in
Description:
This is your time in our makerspace to use Cricut, sewing machines, 3D printers and more!

Registration encouraged, but not required.

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description: Rocky Bluff Library invites little explorers to join us for an exciting session of interactive storytelling intertwined with captivating activities and crafts. Delve into enchanting tales that spark curiosity, followed by hands-on activities and crafty creations perfectly tailored for preschoolers.

Description:

Title: Read Around the Globe Book Club: The Inheritance of Orquídea Divina, by Zoraida Córdova
Description: The Inheritance of Orquídea Divina is an enchanting novel about what we knowingly and unknowingly inherit from our ancestors, the ties that bind, and reclaiming your power. The novel focuses on Ecuadorean culture.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Canvas Kids
Description: Kids! Explore the world around you with art as you create your own themed masterpieces.

Title: Mandarin I Chinese Classes
Description: This class is designed for people who have no previous Mandarin Chinese language experience,  but have a desire to explore the language and culture of China. We will begin with the introduction to the four fundamental building blocks of study: listening comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing. In addition, we also will introduce the culture of China and investigate the meaning of Chinese characters
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Teens Create: Word Art
Description: How can we get our words out into our local community in a direct way without relying on other people to publish us? Word art! These sessions will briefly review how various artists use words in their work. Teens will then have the opportunity to publish their own words in the form of stickers, buttons, and posters.

Title: The ABCs of Money-Attitudes, Budgeting, and Credit for Teens
Description: It is often said that money makes the world go around. Have you ever thought about your relationship to money? Are you more of a spender or a saver? In this interactive session, Jill and Jordan Perlin will tee up this conversation. They’ll also talk about the importance of having a budget, and tracking what you make and what you spend. They’ll also discuss credit – how it works, how to establish a good credit score, and how not to get into trouble. Jill and Jordan do a lot of work with teenage students to understand these important topics. Join them for this informative and timely session.

Title: Creative Aging: Painting Techniques
Description:
We’ll learn different techniques as well as how to get the most out of your paintings. You learn different strokes, the difference between watercolor and gauche, and how to achieve specific results using the different techniques.

This series is for Seniors, 55+. Students are encouraged to bring their own paints and brushes, however the instructor will have supplies and paper available.

Register once to be automatically registered for all classes.  Classes include:

Class 1- Perspectives on perspective- diving deeper into how learning perspective affects your composition.

Class 2 – “Expanding” Your Art – Learning the basics of gridding to be able to make accurate larger piece.

Class 3 – Made in the Shade – Learn how shading, blending and learn about how light and shadows enhance your art

Class 4 – Shading Techniques – Learn about crosshatching, blending and discussion of pointillism

Class 5 – Untangling Zentangle, - Learn how to create Zentangles, a way to draw as well as relax

Class 6 – Drawing Mandalas – Learn how to draw Mandalas
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: The Many Origins of Sarasota
Description:
How old is Sarasota? That depends on what you're asking. Sarasota is a city, a county, and a bay - each with its own origin story. 

Join the staff of the Sarasota County History Center for a closer look at the history of Sarasota in all its forms, a story that stretches back to the Spanish colonial era and ties in with some of the most exciting developments of Florida's fascinating past. 

The program will feature maps, photographs, and archival records from the History Center's collections. 

Image Credit: Manatee County Public Library Historical Image Digital Collection

Title: Art Talk: Claude Monet & Impressionism
Description:
Claude Monet was an Impressionist painter who started out in painting in Normandy. He painted for over 80 years and his painting Impressions: Sunrise gave the name to Impressionism. Learn about the roots of Impressionism, Monet’s use of color, his critical relationship with his brother, who gave Monet a leg up on all the other Impressionists. One hundred years before Andy Warhol, Claude Monet serialized his painting, painting large series of landscapes at Etretat, haystacks, poplar trees, church facades under different light and finally water lilies in a pond. His final works in the 1920s set the stage for the artistic revolution called Modern Art. *Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library*

Nick Hauser is a former diplomat, technology executive and educator and currently does onsulting on international business. He has traveled extensively, having visited over 50 countries and having lived or worked in seven different countries. He is the author of numerous articles and technical papers. For the past seven years he has shared his experiences with the residents of Manatee County.

Title: Alexander Hamilton and the U.S. Constitution
Description: To celebrate Constitution Week, learn about Alexander Hamilton’s lesser known role in advocating for, and forming the United States Constitution. This presentation will cover Hamilton’s role at the Constitutional Convention, his advocacy for the Constitution's ratification, and his role shaping the early American Republic.

Title: Author Talk: 100 Things to Do in Sarasota Before You Die by Kelly Stilwell
Description:
Sarasota is known for its powdery white sand beaches and clear blue water. Nature lovers flock to the area to see dolphins, manatees, and a plethora of seabirds. But there is so much more than the beach in this west coast parcel of the Sunshine State. Sarasota is also known as Florida’s Culture Coast for its plethora of arts, theaters, and museums. With so much to do, think of 100 Things to Do in Sarasota Before You Die as your guide to exploring the area, checking off all those bucket list items as you go.

Join author Kelly Stilwell for this dynamic presentation featuring her exciting book.
Categories: Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Know Before You Vote: Constitutional Amendments on the 2024 Ballot
Description:
There are 6 Florida constitutional amendments on the November ballot. There are 2 local tax referenda on the ballot. Make sure you understand these amendments and referenda AND their implications before you vote!

 


	Amendments 1,2,5 and 6 were put on the ballot by the legislature.
	Amendments 3 and 4 are citizen initiatives by petition. 
	Renewal of the Manatee School District 1 mil ad valorem tax millage
	An additional 1 percent tax on short term rentals (bed tax)


 

Get each amendment fully explained, find out what happens if it passes and what happens if it does not, what supporters and opponents say and which organizations support or oppose each amendment. 

In addition, we will be covering voting basics for the 2024 election, common voting mistakes and where to find nonpartisan voting information.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description:
Sign up online or call 941-727-6079 to schedule a half hour session with staff. We can give instruction on using library downloads and databases and also offer basic instruction on laptops, tablets and smart-phones.

NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play - Palmetto Branch
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Watercolor Painting
Description: Would you like to learn how to paint with watercolor? It's easier than you might think! Using watercolor paper and good quality paint, each person will be taught basic techniques to create free flowing works of art. All materials are provided.

Title: Memoir Group
Description: Join other memoir writers working on personal stories. This collaborative group of writers contribute stories and provide a friendly supportive working team. Registration is for all sessions.

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Celebrating Hispanic Heritage Month: Papel Picado/ Celebrando el mes de la herencia hispana: Papel picado (Bilingüe / Bilingual)
Description:
Join us as we continue to celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month with papel picado! Papel picado is a traditional Mexican folk craft in which paper is cut with designs and strung together to make a banner often used as decoration for festivities and homes. All materials will be provided, and registration is required.



¡Únase a nosotros mientras continuamos nuestra celebración del mes de la herencia hispana con papel picado! Papel picado es un arte popular tradicional mexicano en cual papel es cortado con diseños y pegados para crear una pancarta utilizada como decoración en calles y hogares en días de celebración. Se proporcionará todo el material y se requiere registro.

Title: Level Up at the Library!
Description: Come join us as we play cool games and take part in occasional tournaments.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Beginner Sewing Class
Description:
During this beginner sewing class, you will learn how to operate a sewing machine, understand basic tools, properly measure and cut fabric, and sew a simple pillowcase project to keep or gift. The library will provide machines and tools, but please bring your own non-directional 100% cotton fabric. If you own a sewing machine and would like to learn on it, you may bring it. 

Fabric Requirements:

*Non-directional fabric is a print that looks the same no matter which way it's turned. 

Main fabric-1 yard

Fabric for cuff-1/2 yard

Fabric for trim-1/8 yard

Please see the image below for an example of what you will be making. Let your creativity fly! 



Presented by Roxane Sergi
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Sweat and Swagger
Description: Join Sweat & Swagger instructor Adrienne Quarlena for a heart pumping cardio dance workout that will have you dripping with sweat and leaving with swag.

Title: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Curiosity Club: Birding Basics
Description:
Kids, come learn about the joys of birdwatching from Manatee Audubon Society. Each week our instructor will teach us about birds from different habitats around the county.

This is a series of 3 classes culminating in a field trip to the Felts Audubon Preserve, so please only sign up if you can attend all 4 events. This program is designed for school-ages children and their families.
Presenter: Tony Ford from Manatee Audubon Society
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families

Title: Drop-in Art for Preschoolers
Description: Join us every Wednesday at 10:00 for simple open art project. Helps fine motor as well as creative skills!

Title: Family Storytime
Description: Join us for a fun-filled hour of stories, music, dancing, and crafts! No registration required
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Meals on Wheels Plus
Description:
Join us for a community event hosted by Meals on Wheels PLUS of Manatee! We invite everyone to stop by our tabletop display to learn more about our vital services, including home-delivered meals, food pantries, and assistance programs that help fight hunger and loneliness in our community.

This event will provide information on how individuals and families can access fresh produce, groceries, and nutritious meals, as well as ways to get involved by volunteering. Whether you're seeking assistance, looking for volunteer opportunities, or simply want to know more about how we support our community, our team will be on hand to answer any questions and provide helpful resources.

Highlights of the Event:


	Information on food assistance programs and eligibility
	Details on how to sign up for home-delivered meals
	Volunteer opportunities to support our mission
	Resources for seniors and families in need
	Tips on maintaining a healthy diet with limited resources


Come by and discover how Meals on Wheels PLUS of Manatee is making a difference in our local area, and how you can be a part of our mission to fight hunger and provide essential services to those in need. We look forward to meeting you!

For more information, visit our website: https://mealsonwheelsplus.org

Title: Silly Goose Preschool Storytime
Description: Enjoy books, rhymes, songs, and activities with your preschooler. For ages 3-5 with an adult caregiver.

Limited to 40 children

Title: Tracing Your Roots: One-on-One Genealogy Assistance
Description: Bring your family information to make your pedigree chart. SueAnn Carpenter, Genealogist, DAR member, will provide one-on-one assistance to create your free family tree online. SueAnn will show you how to maneuver the site plus various links to verify documents (birth, marriage, death) and build the story of your ancestors.

Title: Mandarin I Chinese Classes
Description: This class is designed for people who have no previous Mandarin Chinese language experience,  but have a desire to explore the language and culture of China. We will begin with the introduction to the four fundamental building blocks of study: listening comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing. In addition, we also will introduce the culture of China and investigate the meaning of Chinese characters
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: CANCELED: Teens Unwind the Mind: Create Fall Zentangles
Description:
Being a teen can be tough and sometimes you just need a break to recharge mentally. Stop by any time between 5 and 6 pm to sip a hot beverage, listen to soothing music, create art, and decompress with your peers. Tonight we will be creating fall-themed zentangles!

Zentangles are abstract drawings that involve creating intricate patterns (tangles) to fill a space. Zentangles can help reduce stress and anxiety, improve concentration, and promote a sense of calm.
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Makerspace, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: CLASS FULL: Creative Aging: Painting Techniques
Description:
We’ll learn different techniques as well as how to get the most out of your paintings. You learn different strokes, the difference between watercolor and gauche, and how to achieve specific results using the different techniques.

This series is for Seniors, 55+. Students are encouraged to bring their own paints and brushes, however the instructor will have supplies and paper available.

Register once to be automatically registered for all classes.  Classes include:

Class 1- Perspectives on perspective- diving deeper into how learning perspective affects your composition.

Class 2 – “Expanding” Your Art – Learning the basics of gridding to be able to make accurate larger piece.

Class 3 – Made in the Shade – Learn how shading, blending and learn about how light and shadows enhance your art

Class 4 – Shading Techniques – Learn about crosshatching, blending and discussion of pointillism

Class 5 – Untangling Zentangle, - Learn how to create Zentangles, a way to draw as well as relax

Class 6 – Drawing Mandalas – Learn how to draw Mandalas
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: CANCELED Tech Class: Write to the Point--Creating Letters, Resumes, and Other Communication Documents
Description: Learn the basics of creating digital documents using word processing software such as Microsoft Word, Google Docs, and Open Office. This class will go through the steps to find a template, format text and spacing, make your document reader friendly, and how to save your document in .doc and PDF formats. Bring along your laptop and be ready for hands on practice. A few devices are available to borrow for those with desktop computers. Please email Kaitlynn to check for device availability and reservation: Kaitlynn.bosley@mymanatee.org

Title: Acting 101: For 2nd Graders (Ages 7-8)
Description:
Please join us for a 45-minute Acting 101 class for 2nd graders that teaches children the basics of acting by stepping into the world of imagination based on Method Acting techniques. 

Please note: Registration is limited (you just need to register your 2nd grader) and to avoid any distractions and outside noise, we ask any adults attending with their child to please silence their cell phones and watch quietly in the back of the room during this time. Any questions, please e-mail Callie. Thank you!

Instructor Bio: Gina found her love of the arts working at The Shubert Theatre on Broadway at age 15. Gina is the CEO & Founder of  Gina Fata Coaching, has her BFA in Theatre Arts from Point Park University, earned her MA from Columbia University in Exercise Physiology/Nutrition, and studied at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts, and The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute. Some credits include Film/TV: The Mothman Prophecies, Unsolved Mysteries. Stage: Sylvia, 42nd Street, Anything Goes, Bird of Quintain, My One and Only. Gina is also a proud member of SAG-AFTRA.
Categories: Art Instruction > Performing Arts, Arts & Entertainment

Title: Creative Kids

Title: Tai Chi
Description: Tai Chi was originally developed as a martial art in the 13th century. It is a gentle non-impact exercise. Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed. This class is closed to new attendees.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Baby Storytime
Description:
Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Basic Spanish Class
Description: Join instructor Ginett Luby for an introduction to the Spanish language in this weekly series. This class is limited to 10 participants.

Title: CANCELLED: Gentle Yoga
Description:
Enjoy this gentler style of hatha yoga practice with yoga instructor, Delphine. Gentle Yoga is performed at a slower pace, with less intense positions, and usually includes extended time for meditation, yogic breath work, and relaxation.

Please, bring your own mat.

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: CANCELED: Introduction to MyHeritage.com
Description: Please join us for a one-hour introduction class on MyHeritage.com offered by Regina Negrycz. MyHeritage is the second largest subscription website for family history.  While it is a subscription site, there are some free resources.  We will be learning how to research ship passenger records, military records, census records and more. Registration is required, thank you!

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description:
Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.  

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Musical Motion
Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Title: Introductory Crochet Class Series
Description: A series of classes to teach absolute beginners the foundations of crochet. Over this six-part series, we will learn the basics of crochet and how you can create one-of-a-kind gifts, clothing, and toys. Crochet hooks and yarn will be provided during the first class, though bringing one's own supplies is accepted and encouraged.

Title: Teen Advisory Board (TAB)
Description:
Want to have an impact on your library? We want to hear from YOU! Join the Teen Advisory Board to earn volunteer hours, build leadership experience, and get involved with your local libraries. Must be 16+ to receive volunteer hour credit.

Email Jenn Leland to apply: Jenn.Leland@mymanatee.org

Title: Drawing for Adults
Description:
Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a four-week course on drawing for adults!  When you sign up for the first class, you will be registered for all four!

 

Class 1 – Learning Perspective – Learn about perspective in drawing

Class 2 – Composition – Understanding how to compose a drawing for the best effect.

Class 3 – Gesture Drawing – A fun class using multiple models 

Class 4 – Drawing From the Heart – Learning to use inspiration and freehand drawing what you’re “thinking”.

 

All materials provided!

Title: Know Before You Vote: Constitutional Amendments on the 2024 Ballot
Description:
There are 6 Florida constitutional amendments on the November ballot. There are 2 local tax referenda on the ballot. Make sure you understand these amendments and referenda AND their implications before you vote!

 


	Amendments 1,2,5 and 6 were put on the ballot by the legislature.
	Amendments 3 and 4 are citizen initiatives by petition. 
	Renewal of the Manatee School District 1 mil ad valorem tax millage
	An additional 1 percent tax on short term rentals (bed tax)


 

Get each amendment fully explained, find out what happens if it passes and what happens if it does not, what supporters and opponents say and which organizations support or oppose each amendment. 

In addition, we will be covering voting basics for the 2024 election, common voting mistakes and where to find nonpartisan voting information.

Title: 40 Carrots Partners in Play - Central Branch
Description: Drop in to enjoy a special uninterrupted playtime with your child in our FREE Partners in Play® (PIP) groups. Meet our friendly Parenting Educators and discover how play and learning go hand-in-hand. First come, first serve. Limit of 12 families.

Title: Basic Spanish Class
Description: Join instructor Ginett Luby for an introduction to the Spanish language in this weekly series. This class is limited to 10 participants.

Title: Ghost in a Jar (ADULTS & TEENS CRAFT)
Description:
Using mason jars, cheese cloth, lye, and dowels, create your own spooky ghost in a jar to decorate for Spooky Season! All supplies provided.

PLEASE NOTE: This program is for ages 13+. These crafts have a difficulty targeting an older age group. Please do not sign up if you are below age 13. Thank you!

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Needle Arts Studio-Open Sew and Knit
Description: Do you sew, knit, quilt, crochet, do handwork or English paper piecing? Bring your projects and join us! Get some inspiration or assistance if needed. Participants must bring their own fabric, patterns, thread, and notions necessary for their personal projects, but tools will be provided. We have 4 Janome sewing machines, 2 sergers, and large cutting mats.

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description:
Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources. 

*(This is the only session in the series that ends at 11 AM instead of Noon)
