Title: Macramé Air Plant Hanger Workshop
Description: Join us for a creative and relaxing Macrame Air Plant Hanger Workshop! In this hands-on class, you'll learn the art of macrame, crafting a beautiful and unique hanger perfect for displaying air plants. Our experienced instructor will guide you step-by-step through essential knots and techniques, ensuring you leave with a completed project and the skills to create more at home. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your macrame skills, this workshop is a wonderful way to explore your creativity and add a touch of boho charm to your decor. All materials are provided, and no prior experience is necessary. Come enjoy a fun, social, and crafty session! Several color options will be available.

Title: Mat Pilates for Beginners
Description:
Pilates training is a system of knowledge and exercises for anyone interested in improving core strength, flexibility, mobility, muscle balance, physical endurance, posture, effective breathing, and body awareness. 

This donation-based mat pilates class is designed for any age and fitness level, but does require participants to have the ability to move on and off the floor. Please check back in the next couple months for additional pilates class offerings.

It is recommended that individuals bring 1-2 mats (as we will be lying and sitting on the ground) and comfortable and loose clothing. Optional equipment: Yoga blocks (for comfort while sitting), yoga socks, and an exercise band.

Description: Representatives from the Florida Department of Health in Manatee County will be on hand to share info and handouts about the following topics: National Dental Hygiene Month, Breast Cancer Awareness, SUID Awareness and Infant Safe Sleep.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Supporting Our Families Educational Seminar
Description:
Join a representative from Groover Funeral Home for a candid conversation about making final arrangements in advance. When you plan ahead, you make your wishes known and ease the way for the people who love you. Though you can’t protect your family from grief, you can help lessen their burden.

What to expect:

* Learn how and what to prepare.

* Review frequently asked questions.

* Discover resources to help you through a time of loss.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Mandarin I Chinese Classes
Description: This class is designed for people who have no previous Mandarin Chinese language experience,  but have a desire to explore the language and culture of China. We will begin with the introduction to the four fundamental building blocks of study: listening comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing. In addition, we also will introduce the culture of China and investigate the meaning of Chinese characters

Title: 2024 Alliance Gives Back @ LWR Library
Description:
In partnership with the Lakewood Ranch Business Alliance, the Lakewood Ranch Library, as part of the Community & Veteran's Services Department, will be hosting a letter and card writing campaign to support the Southwest Florida Honor Flight on October 15th, 2024. 

Please join us and the LWR Business Alliance in honoring the 95 veterans who will be on the October 15th Honor Flight from Punta Gorda to Washington DC for Mission XXI where they will be welcomed and honored at their respective memorials. The Workshop will be open to the community from 11:00am-1:00pm each day from October 3rd-5th to write a letter, a card and/or draw a picture to be sent with Honor Flight to our veterans. 

For more information about the LWR Business Alliance's, Annual Alliance Gives Back Volunteer Days please see their website.

For additional information about SWFL Honor Flight please click here to see their website.

Title: CLASS FULL: Creative Aging: Painting Techniques
Description:
We’ll learn different techniques as well as how to get the most out of your paintings. You learn different strokes, the difference between watercolor and gauche, and how to achieve specific results using the different techniques.

This series is for Seniors, 55+. Students are encouraged to bring their own paints and brushes, however the instructor will have supplies and paper available.

Register once to be automatically registered for all classes.  Classes include:

Class 1- Perspectives on perspective- diving deeper into how learning perspective affects your composition.

Class 2 – “Expanding” Your Art – Learning the basics of gridding to be able to make accurate larger piece.

Class 3 – Made in the Shade – Learn how shading, blending and learn about how light and shadows enhance your art

Class 4 – Shading Techniques – Learn about crosshatching, blending and discussion of pointillism

Class 5 – Untangling Zentangle, - Learn how to create Zentangles, a way to draw as well as relax

Class 6 – Drawing Mandalas – Learn how to draw Mandalas
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Creative Aging Art Classes
Description:
A 4 week course of Figurative Drawing.  Figurative art, sometimes written as figurativism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. 

Students are encouraged to bring their drawing own supplies. Paper will be provided. 

Class 1- Learning about drawing from life. 

Class 2 – The human form and interpreting movement. 

Class 3 – Learning the art of drawing draping materials. 

Class 4 – Putting the lessons on paper

Title: 2024 Alliance Gives Back @ LWR Library
Description:
In partnership with the Lakewood Ranch Business Alliance, the Lakewood Ranch Library, as part of the Community & Veteran's Services Department, will be hosting a letter and card writing campaign to support the Southwest Florida Honor Flight on October 15th, 2024. 

Please join us and the LWR Business Alliance in honoring the 95 veterans who will be on the October 15th Honor Flight from Punta Gorda to Washington DC for Mission XXI where they will be welcomed and honored at their respective memorials. The Workshop will be open to the community from 11:00am-1:00pm each day from October 3rd-5th to write a letter, a card and/or draw a picture to be sent with Honor Flight to our veterans. 

For more information about the LWR Business Alliance's, Annual Alliance Gives Back Volunteer Days please see their website.

For additional information about SWFL Honor Flight please click here to see their website.

Title: Intro to Cricut Certification Class
Description:
For DIY enthusiasts who want to begin creating crafts that are both professional-quality and easy to make, the Cricut is the greatest tool to achieve your goal. In this beginner's course, you'll discover the basics behind the materials, tools, and resources you'll need to get started. (Participants must be at least 13 years old and sign a Workshop Waiver, acknowledging user and safety guidelines. This course is a prerequisite to attending Cricut Open Hours at a later date, even if you have previous experience using a Cricut.) 

Presented by Steve Aldrich
Event Organizer: Sabrina Hornyak - Manatee County Public Library System

Description:
A weekly hands-on informative practice series designed to boost typing form, speed, and confidence.  Bring along your laptop and be ready for hands on practice. Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a donation-based group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Curiosity Club: Birding Basics
Description:
Kids, come learn about the joys of birdwatching from Manatee Audubon Society. Each week our instructor will teach us about birds from different habitats around the county.

This is a series of 3 classes culminating in a field trip to the Felts Audubon Preserve, so please only sign up if you can attend all 4 events. This program is designed for school-ages children and their families.

Note: The instructor asks that you wear sneakers with socks to avoid fire ants, and bring or use bug spray.
Presenter: Tony Ford from Manatee Audubon Society
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families

Movie: Turning Red

Title: Pins & Needles Neighbor Sewing Group

Title: Scratch Coding Workshop (Ages 7-10)
Description:
This class does not require any prior coding experience. Students, 7-10, will be introduced to the Scratch platform and its features. They will learn core engineering concepts such as loops, variables, and conditional logic, which are essential to programming. These concepts will be taught in a fun and engaging way that is designed to encourage curiosity and exploration. By the end of the workshop, attendees will have built their own video game using Scratch. Examples of games that kids may create include a Flappy Bird clone, a coin collector, or a maze-style game. 

FUNDED BY THE FRIENDS OF THE CENTRAL LIBRARY
Categories: Sponsored by the Friends of the Library, Technology

Title: ¡Juguemos Lotería! Let’s play Lotería! (Bilingüe / Bilingual)

Únase a nosotros para celebrar el Mes de la Herencia Hispana con Lotería. Los juegos se jugarán tanto en español como en inglés, ¡así que todos pueden unirse para tener la oportunidad de ganar algunos premios!



Join us as we celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month with Lotería, a traditional game of chance similar to bingo enjoyed by many in Latin-American countries. Games will be played in both Spanish and English, so everyone is welcome to join for a chance to win some prizes!

Title: Tai Chi

Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed. This class is closed to new attendees.

Title: CANCELED Drawing for Adults

Join teaching artist, Karalee Hammes, for a four-week course on drawing for adults!  When you sign up for the first class, you will be registered for all four!

 

Class 1 – Learning Perspective – Learn about perspective in drawing

Class 2 – Composition – Understanding how to compose a drawing for the best effect.

Class 3 – Gesture Drawing – A fun class using multiple models 

Class 4 – Drawing From the Heart – Learning to use inspiration and freehand drawing what you’re “thinking”.

 

All materials provided!

Title: CANCELED: Jazzercise on the Rooftop!
Description:
Due to the weather and incoming hurricane, we are taking the proper precautions and canceling Jazzercise on the rooftop. Thank you for your understanding and stay safe.

What IS Jazzercise? We're a fun, effective full body workout set to the best music! We're heart pumping cardio, muscle sculpting & mood boosting stretching! We’re the original group fitness class but we're current & change with the times! Seriously, we know what we're doing! Is Jazzercise for you? We're for everyBODY, every age, stage & fitness level. 

We’re excited to bring Jazzercise to the rooftop! Join us for a super fun sweat sesh packed with dance cardio, strength training & stretching! It’s our HIIT class we call Power Sculpt! Dress to sweat, bring water, a yoga mat, and handheld weights (optional: class can be done all standing without weights). Our studio is located at 9009 Town Center Parkway, we have 27 classes, morning and night, 7 days a week! For more information, please visit www.jazzerciselwr.com

Title: CANCELED: Spanish Conversation
Description:
CANCELED

The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: CANCELED Know Before You Vote: Constitutional Amendments on the 2024 Ballot
Description:
There are 6 Florida constitutional amendments on the November ballot. Make sure you understand these amendments and their implications before you vote!

Amendments 1,2,5 and 6 were put on the ballot by the legislature and Amendments 3 and 4 are citizen initiatives. Get each amendment fully explained, find out what happens if it passes and what happens if it does not, what supporters and opponents say and what organizations support or opposed each amendment. 

In addition, we will be covering voting basics for the 2024 election, common voting mistakes and where to find nonpartisan voting information.  

League of Women Voters members will be on hand to register voters, check voter registration and answer election questions. Vote informed!

Title: CANCELED Rocky Bluff Trivia NIght

Description:
Learn about Manatee County’s ghost towns! This presentation will cover the history of many ghost towns and forgotten stories from Manatee County’s past. The presentation will highlight the history of these towns, and the stories of the people who lived in them.

Image Credit: Manatee County Public Library Historical Image Digital Collection

Title: CANCELED Adult Book Discussion Group: The Heaven & Earth Grocery Store by James Mcbride
Description: In 1972, when workers in Pottstown, Pennsylvania, were digging the foundations for a new development, the last thing they expected to find was a skeleton at the bottom of a well. Who the skeleton was and how it got there were two of the long-held secrets kept by the residents of Chicken Hill, the dilapidated neighbourhood where immigrant Jews and African Americans lived side by side and shared ambitions and sorrows. McBride shows us that even in dark times, it is love and community-heaven and earth-that sustain us. (Description by GoodReads)
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: CANCELED: Tracing Your Roots: One-on-One Genealogy Assistance

Title: CANCELED Palmetto Friends of the Library Book Club
Description:
In the waning days of the Civil War, brothers Prentiss and Landry—freed by the Emancipation Proclamation—seek refuge on the homestead of George Walker and his wife, Isabelle. Parallel to their story runs a forbidden romance between two Confederate soldiers. 

With candor and sympathy, debut novelist Nathan Harris creates an unforgettable cast of characters, depicting Georgia in the violent crucible of Reconstruction. Equal parts beauty and terror, as gripping as it is moving, The Sweetness of Water is an epic whose grandeur locates humanity and love amid the most harrowing circumstances. (Amazon)

 

Book Club List:

Sept 11 - The Light Pirate by Lily Brooks 

Oct 9 - The Sweetness of Water by Nathan Harris 

Nov 13 - Yellow Wife by Sadequa Johnson 

Dec 11 - Our Souls at Night by Kent Haruf

Title: CANCELED CLASS FULL: Creative Aging: Painting Techniques
Description:
We’ll learn different techniques as well as how to get the most out of your paintings. You learn different strokes, the difference between watercolor and gauche, and how to achieve specific results using the different techniques.

This series is for Seniors, 55+. Students are encouraged to bring their own paints and brushes, however the instructor will have supplies and paper available.

Register once to be automatically registered for all classes.  Classes include:

Class 1- Perspectives on perspective- diving deeper into how learning perspective affects your composition.

Class 2 – “Expanding” Your Art – Learning the basics of gridding to be able to make accurate larger piece.

Class 3 – Made in the Shade – Learn how shading, blending and learn about how light and shadows enhance your art

Class 4 – Shading Techniques – Learn about crosshatching, blending and discussion of pointillism

Class 5 – Untangling Zentangle, - Learn how to create Zentangles, a way to draw as well as relax

Class 6 – Drawing Mandalas – Learn how to draw Mandalas
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Art Instruction > Painting, Drawing, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: CANCELED Murder By the Book: Adult Book Club: The Lying Game by Ruth Ware
Description: On a cool June morning, a woman is walking her dog in the idyllic coastal village of Salten along a tidal estuary known as the Reach. Before she can stop him, the dog charges into the water to retrieve what first appears to be a wayward stick, but to her horror, turns out to be something much more sinister...The next morning, three women in and around London, Fatima, Thea, and Isabel receive the text they had always hoped would NEVER come, from the fourth in their formerly inseparable clique, Kate, that says only, “I need you.” (Description by GoodReads)

Title: CANCELED Creative Aging Art Classes
Description:
A 4 week course of Figurative Drawing.  Figurative art, sometimes written as figurativism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. 

Students are encouraged to bring their drawing own supplies. Paper will be provided. 

Class 1- Learning about drawing from life. 

Class 2 – The human form and interpreting movement. 

Class 3 – Learning the art of drawing draping materials. 

Class 4 – Putting the lessons on paper

Title: CANCELED Literary Travel through the U.S. – Maryland: A Spool of Blue Thread by Anne Tyler

Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: CANCELED: Making Sense of Medicare
Description:
Ready to Navigate the Medicare Waters? Are you feeling a bit adrift when it comes to Medicare? About to hit the big 65 or preparing to set sail into retirement? Choosing the right Medicare plan can feel like navigating unchartered waters, but don’t worry — I’m here to be your trusty compass on this journey! Join us for a FREE interactive and educational session where we’ll unravel the complexities of Medicare and help you make sense of it all! 

Your guide, Amy McCarthy of Waterside Insurance Solutions, is a licensed Independent Insurance Agent specializing in Medicare. She’ll help ensure that your journey through the Medicare seas is smooth sailing! In this fun and informative session, we will help answer your questions as we guide you to:

Understand Original Medicare: Learn what traditional Medicare is (and isn’t).

Unravel the ABCDs of Medicare: Dive into Parts A, B, C & D.

Choose Your Path: Discover the differences between Medicare Supplements and Medicare Advantage Plans.

Dodge the Fees: Learn when to enroll – and how to avoid penalties!

But wait – there’s more! All attendees will be entered into a raffle! You can earn one extra raffle ticket for each person you invite who attends with you! Attendees will also enjoy delicious treats while you learn! 

For accommodations of persons with special needs at meetings call 941-258-9440 or 711 (TTY)

Description:

Basic Polymer Clay Supplies needed: 


	
	Plastic tablecloth 
	
	
	Work surface - glass or smooth ceramic tile approx. 12x12 
	
	
	Sculpey Premo Clay (white, black, red, yellow, blue and translucent) 
	
	
	Rubbing alcohol 
	
	
	Acrylic rod 
	
	
	Tissue blades for cutting clay 
	
	
	Clay storage (saran wrap, zip-lock bags) 
	
	
	Exacto Craft knife with #11 blade 
	
	
	Needle tool (can use sewing needles and toothpicks)

Title: CANCELED Celebrating Hispanic Heritage Month: Sugar Skull Painting/ Celebrando el mes de la herencia hispana:
Description:
Join us as we continue to celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month by painting your own 3-D printed sugar skull! Sugar skulls or calaveras are crafted skulls used in the Mexican holiday of Day of the Dead or Dia de Muertos which is observed November 1st and 2nd. Materials will be provided and registration is required.



¡Únase a nosotros mientras continuamos celebrando el Mes de la herencia hispana pintando su propia calavera impresa en 3D! Las calaveras se utilizan en la festividad mexicana del Día de los Muertos. Se proporcionarán los materiales y se requiere registro.
Categories: Crafts, Holiday, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: CANCELED: Scared Sweet: Breaking Free from Halloween's Sugar Spell
Description:
Halloween is all about treats, but the real trick is managing the sugar overload! In this session, we'll explore the impact of sugar on your health and give you practical tips for enjoying Halloween without falling into a sugar trap. Discover healthier treat options and strategies to keep your energy up and cravings down, so you can indulge mindfully and stay on track with your wellness goals.

This is part of a “Healthy Thru the Holidays” Wellness Workshop Series presented by National Board Certified Health & Wellness Coach, Carrie Ehrlich (NBC-HWC) of Transform Wellness. Learn more: transformwellnessllc.com



Please join us on November 5 for "Feast without the Guilt: Mastering Healthy Holiday Gatherings"

Please join us on December 13 for "Joyful Connections: Finding Wellness in the Holiday Spirit"

Title: CANCELED: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: CANCELED- Halloween STEAM and Sweets
Description:

At our Tween STEAM Workshop during October, kids aged 8-12 will dive into the delicious world of candy making while exploring the fascinating principles of chemistry and engineering. From creating a take home jar of growing rock candy to melting ghost marshmellows to making up dna shapes with candy pieces, this hands-on event will blend creativity with learning.


	Limit to 20 tweens. Registration will open 1 month in advance.
	Registration is required with spots held for only 15 minutes after start time; Waitlisted guests will fill in spots in the order of registration.
	Parents/Guardians must remain in the library building at all times while tweens are participating in the event; The responsibility for the safety and behavior of children in the library rests with the parent/care giver and not the library personnel.
	Supplies are provided by the library during the event and are available while supplies last.

Title: CANCELED: Know Before You Vote: Constitutional Amendments on the 2024 Ballot
Description:
There are 6 Florida constitutional amendments on the November ballot. There are 2 local tax referenda on the ballot. Make sure you understand these amendments and referenda AND their implications before you vote!

REGISTER HERE: https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZcldOygrTovG9JGqrUBVo_girEWVg3uKuun#/registration

 


	Amendments 1,2,5 and 6 were put on the ballot by the legislature.
	Amendments 3 and 4 are citizen initiatives by petition. 
	Renewal of the Manatee School District 1 mil ad valorem tax millage
	An additional 1 percent tax on short term rentals (bed tax)


 

Get each amendment fully explained, find out what happens if it passes and what happens if it does not, what supporters and opponents say and which organizations support or oppose each amendment. 

In addition, we will be covering voting basics for the 2024 election, common voting mistakes and where to find nonpartisan voting information.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: CANCELED: Medicare Prescription Drug Plan Changes in 2025
Description:
Significant changes will be coming to Medicare Part D Prescription Drug plans starting January 1, 2025 as result of the Inflation Reduction Act. All Medicare beneficiaries with prescription drug coverage should be informed of these changes as they will affect your benefits and coverage in 2025.

Join us for a free informative session on the upcoming changes to learn how they may affect your out-of-pocket costs next year and what you need to do to prepare.

We’ll cover:

1.       Overview of the Inflation Reduction Act

2.       New out-of-pocket spending cap

3.       Elimination of the Coverage Gap phase ("donut hole")

4.       Introduction to the new Prescription Payment Plan

Bonus: All attendees will be entered into a raffle drawing! Bring a friend and earn an extra raffle ticket for each person who attends with you. Light refreshments will be served. 

For accommodations of persons with special needs at meetings call 941-258-9440 or 711 (TTY).

Title: CANCELED: Creative Aging Art Classes
Description:
A 4 week course of Figurative Drawing.  Figurative art, sometimes written as figurativism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. 

Students are encouraged to bring their drawing own supplies. Paper will be provided. 

Class 1- Learning about drawing from life. 

Class 2 – The human form and interpreting movement. 

Class 3 – Learning the art of drawing draping materials. 

Class 4 – Putting the lessons on paper

Title: CANCELED: Coiled Basket Weaving Workshop
Description:
Discover the art of basket weaving in our Coiled Basket Workshop! This engaging and hands-on class is perfect for beginners and those looking to expand their crafting skills. Our skilled instructor will guide you through the process of creating a beautiful, coiled basket using natural raffia, twine and other fibers. You'll learn essential techniques such as coiling, stitching, and shaping, ensuring you leave with a stunning, handmade basket and the confidence to continue weaving at home. All materials are provided, and no prior experience is necessary. Join us for a relaxing and creative experience and take home a unique piece that adds a touch of rustic charm to your space! *Multiple color options will be available

*Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library*

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

This event is FREE but please register ahead of time as space is limited. After class, we will be presenting a story time with a Halloween theme! Let's talk pumpkins, apple cider, and hayrides as we head into fall!!

Stroller Strides® is a 60-minute total-body workout with strength, cardio, and core training, all while engaging the little ones in a stroller! You'll leave class feeling strong, empowered, connected, and energized - no matter your stage of motherhood.

Title: CANCELED: Flags: An Introduction to Vexillology
Description:
Flags, pennants, guidons and roundels have been used throughout history to represent countries, military units and ships at sea. Vexillology is the study of flags. Solve a flag puzzle published in a national magazine, do some flag trivia, then learn the history of flags, pennants, guidons and roundels. View the flags of all the countries of the world, some not-so-countries and some cities. Learn about the fascinating career of vexillology, which is exploding due to computer gaming. We will design a flag online using flag design software. Kids get to draw or make a flag of a country and then using general principle of vexillology, make their own personal flag to rally their forces to defeat armies of trolls, goblins and zombies.

Presenters: Nick and Louise Hauser, Nick is a former technology executive and diplomat and Louise has been on TV (Jeopardy and Who Wants to be a Millionaire). *Sponsored by Friends of the Island Library*

Title: Getting Your Body in Balance
Description:
Unfortunately, Balance declines with age but that doesn't mean falling is acceptable! Join  Nichole Harold, Physical Therapist, Health Coach and Co-owner of Body in Balance Inc.,  for this hour-long program where you'll learn:


	How balance works: vision, sense of touch, inner ear
	How to make balance tasks easier: walking, transfers
	How to compensate for a blance deficit
	When and how to use a cane or walker
	What is vertigo/dizziness and how to control it
	Fall prevention tips

Title: Creative Aging Art Classes
Description:
A 4 week course of Figurative Drawing.  Figurative art, sometimes written as figurativism, describes artwork (particularly paintings and sculptures) that is clearly derived from real object sources and so is, by definition, representational. 

Students are encouraged to bring their drawing own supplies. Paper will be provided. 

Class 1- Learning about drawing from life. 

Class 2 – The human form and interpreting movement. 

Class 3 – Learning the art of drawing draping materials. 

Class 4 – Putting the lessons on paper

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description:
Please join us on the rooftop for weekly yoga! This is a donation-based group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. 

This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Author Talk: Seeing Colors, by Tirena Say
Description: The Author was told she would probably never work again, that the odds were against her ever living a normal life, that in all likelihood she would get sick again, and end up in a psychiatric ward for the rest of her life. Somehow, Tirena brought herself back from this bleak future of mental and emotional sickness. This is a true, turn-around story of how a young woman brought herself back – not just back to a level of normal functioning – but to enjoy a prosperous, joyous, and happy life that anyone would want. Seeing Colors tells you her inspiring story, but also how you can do it too!
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Mixed Media Class: Photo Transfer
Description: Learn how to photo transfer onto an art piece you create. Teaching artist, Polly Tetrault, will help you transfer a 4 x 4 size photo onto a 6” square cradle board you create. Photos and all materials provided!

Title: CANCELED: Author Talk: Unwavering by Judy Silverstein Gray
Description: Local author Judy Silverstein Gray will discuss her book Unwavering: The Wives Who Fought to Ensure No Man is Left Behind, set in the 1960s when women were more comfortable remaining on the sidelines, had little access to credit, and when military wives generally played a quiet, supporting role to their husbands. Against the backdrop of 1960s seismic cultural and socioeconomic upheaval, a small cadre of these wives evolved into passionate advocates. Join us for a lively discussion as we learn about their little known and heroic story.

Title: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: One Blood Bloodmobile
Description:
The One Blood Bus will be available in Palmetto Branch's north parking lot to all those who would like to donate blood.

Online appointments are encouraged. 

There are health benefits of donating blood. Below are just a few of the Benefits:

1. A Healthier Heart System and Vascular System: Helps to decrease blood pressure

2. A Calorie-Free Snack – Your body burns about 500 calories while replacing the blood you donated

3. Lowers the Risk for: Liver, lung, colon, stomach and throat cancer

4. Stimulation of New Blood Cells – New Cells help to Oxygenate your body better.

5. Loss of Wight – You can lose 1% of your body weight

6. Iron – For those that have higher levels of iron, donating helps to decrease the level of iron to healthier level.

7. Cholesterol – Helps to reduce cholesterol levels

8.  Each donations helps to save up to  3 lives.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Bring your challenge coins and share in a discussion of lore and nostalgia in honor of our nations Armed Forces.

Title: CANCELED: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Author Talk: "Twenty-Five Years" by Michael Berquist
Description:
Local author, Michael Berquist, will be giving a book talk on his book, "Twenty-Five Years." A Q&A will follow as well as book signings. Books will be available for purchase. 

The book follows the author's father, Kenneth, from birth. He grows to adulthood during some of the darkest times of the 20th century. As Kenneth reaches adulthood, he makes decisions and choices about his life going forward. After high school graduation he is faced with decisions regarding college and going to work in a full-time job. And then, a call to duty when World War Two begins. Turning points which all evolve within a year. The twenty-five-year clock starts ticking. Kenneth starts his journey with the Navy. He serves in both the Atlantic and the Pacific Wars. Life takes him from North Africa to the coast of Indochina. Actual stories from his war diary; the humorous, the tedious, as well as the grim, are retold. After the war he returns to his hometown where he meets the woman who will become his wife. We follow his life further. His Conversion to Catholicism. His marriage. His homes. His cars. His nieces. His nephews. His hopes and his dreams. And then, finally, children of his own. Time's up. The story unfolds during an age of innocence.

Title: Presentation: Frank Lloyd Wright
Description: Frank Lloyd Wright continues to impact the way we live, from the Unitarian house that became the ranch house many of us live in today to the first building designated as a skyscraper and Prairie Design, which is still the only American school of design. The Robie house in Chicago was heralded as the finest example of Prairie Design and the beginning of the modern era. The Guggenheim Museum in New York and the Unitarian Chapel in Oak Park, Illinois, are considered the foremost early masterpieces in the use of concrete. Falling Waters is and will always be considered to be the most beautiful house in the world.

Title: “A Summer of Mass Murder” Author Talk
Description: The summer of 1941 ushered in a chain of events that had no precedent in the rapidly unfolding history of World War II and the Holocaust. In six weeks, more than twenty thousand Hungarian Jews were forcefully deported to Galicia and summarily executed. In exploring the fate of these Hungarian Jews and their local coreligionists, A Summer of Mass Murder transcends conventional history by introducing a multitude of layers of politics, culture, and, above all, psychology―for both the victims and the executioners. Dr. George Eisen discusses his latest book and the chain of events that led to the writing of this hitherto untold chapter of the Holocaust.
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: History & Genealogy, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks

Title: The History and Future of Oysters in the Manatee River
Description:
Join us for an evening with Damon Moore, the founder and Executive Director of Oyster River Ecology, Inc. Damon will present the fascinating history of oysters in our area, their decline, and provide a detailed look at the exciting future of large-scale oyster habitat restoration in the Manatee River and beyond. From historical references dating back to the 1700s (when the Manatee River was called the Oyster River) to current efforts to restore this important natural resource, this presentation will be informative and entertaining!



About Oyster River Ecology, Inc.

Serving Manatee, Sarasota, Hillsborough, & Pinellas Counties on Florida's Gulf Coast, Oyster River Ecology’s mission is to restore ecosystems and preserve ecological functions while increasing the understanding of the natural systems on which we all rely. ORE is a results-focused 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to habitat restoration, stewardship, beautification, and understanding of the environment to benefit the quality of life for humans and wildlife alike, both now and for generations to come.



About Damon Moore

Damon Moore is a habitat restoration practitioner with 20 years of experience developing and implementing local habitat restoration projects. His career has included ten years working in private-sector consulting and ten years working for Manatee County Government within the Natural Resources Department. Damon played an instrumental role in local large-scale habitat restoration projects including the restoration of Perico Preserve and the Robinson Preserve Expansion Project, among many other habitat improvement projects across the region. He is a Certified Ecological Restoration Practitioner (CERP) through the Society for Ecological Restoration. Damon enjoys spending time with his lovely wife and daughter as well as fishing, hiking, uploading plant and insect observations in iNaturalist, and volunteering on habitat restoration projects.

This class does not require any prior coding experience. Students, 7-10, will be introduced to the Scratch platform and its features. They will learn core engineering concepts such as loops, variables, and conditional logic, which are essential to programming. These concepts will be taught in a fun and engaging way that is designed to encourage curiosity and exploration. By the end of the workshop, attendees will have built their own video game using Scratch. Examples of games that kids may create include a Flappy Bird clone, a coin collector, or a maze-style game.

Title: CANCELED: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Adult Book Discussion Group: The Remains of the Day by Kazuo Ishiguro

Title: Making Sense of Medicare
Description:
Ready to Navigate the Medicare Waters? Are you feeling a bit adrift when it comes to Medicare? About to hit the big 65 or preparing to set sail into retirement? Choosing the right Medicare plan can feel like navigating unchartered waters, but don’t worry — I’m here to be your trusty compass on this journey! Join us for a FREE interactive and educational session where we’ll unravel the complexities of Medicare and help you make sense of it all! 

Your guide, Amy McCarthy of Waterside Insurance Solutions, is a licensed Independent Insurance Agent specializing in Medicare. She’ll help ensure that your journey through the Medicare seas is smooth sailing! In this fun and informative session, we will help answer your questions as we guide you to:

Understand Original Medicare: Learn what traditional Medicare is (and isn’t).

Unravel the ABCDs of Medicare: Dive into Parts A, B, C & D.

Choose Your Path: Discover the differences between Medicare Supplements and Medicare Advantage Plans.

Dodge the Fees: Learn when to enroll – and how to avoid penalties!

But wait – there’s more! All attendees will be entered into a raffle! You can earn one extra raffle ticket for each person you invite who attends with you! Attendees will also enjoy delicious treats while you learn! 

For accommodations of persons with special needs at meetings call 941-258-9440 or 711 (TTY)

Attendees of this “Polo 101” session at the LWR Library will have the chance to take their polo knowledge one step further with a "Part 2" behind-the-scenes session at the Sarasota Polo Club on Saturday, 12/7/24. 


	
	All ages welcome. A parent must accompany any minors.  
	



	
	Pre-register to reserve your spot. Limited to 50 persons.  
	



	
	Plan to attend the “Part 2” session at Sarasota Polo Club, 8201 Polo Club Lane, Sarasota FL 34240 on Saturday, Dec. 7th, 2024 at 1:00 pm.
Presenter: Paige Lautzenheiser, Director of Operations for SPC

Title: Murder By the Book: Adult Book Club: Vicious Circle by CJ Box
Description: The plane circled in the dark. Joe Pickett could just make out down below a figure in the snow and timber, and then three other figures closing in. There was nothing he could do about it. And Joe knew that he might be their next target. The Cates family had always been a bad lot. Game warden Joe Pickett had been able to strike a fierce blow against them when the life of his daughter April had been endangered, but he’d always wondered if there’d be a day of reckoning. He’s not wondering any longer. Joe knows they’re coming after him and his family now. He has his friend Nate by his side, but will that be enough this time? All he can do is prepare . . . and wait for them to make the first move. (Description by GoodReads)

Title: Making Sense of Medicare & Medicare Enrollment
Description: In this educational discussion and interactive Q&A, Medicare expert Christopher Alesevich will break down the components of Medicare and its enrollment opportunities, and answer any questions you may have about your Medicare situation. Description: FINANZAS CON SENAY, EL OBJETIVO DE ESTAS CHARLAS ES COMENZAR A VER LAS FINANZAS DESDE OTRAS PERSPECTIVAS, NO SOLAMENTE FINANCIERAS, AUNQUE APRENDERAS TECNICAS ECONOMICAS, QUE TE AYUDARAN A MEJORAR TU SITUACION FINANCIERA, PERO LO MAS IMPORTANTE ES COMENZAR A OBSERVAR DESDE DONDE VIENEN ESOS CONDICIONAMIENTOS QUE NO TE DEJAN TENER LA VIDA QUE SUEÑAS, DE ALLI QUE ES IMPORTANTE, TOMAR CONSCIENCIA DE ELLO Y A LA VEZ IR APRENDIENDO A IDENTIFICAR ESE PROGRAMA  MENTAL  ACERCA DEL DINERO, QUE NOS RIGE LA VIDA

Title: Adult Drop-in Art: DIY Tote Bag

Unleash your creativity and design your very own custom tote bag—perfect for carrying your library books! Using stencils and fabric paint, you’ll have the opportunity to craft a one-of-a-kind design. All supplies are provided and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Please note: this is a self-guided session, offering you a space to explore your artistic side at your own pace. 

Looking for a fun and simple craft project? Want to exercise your creative muscles? Every month we are doing a different craft, so come drop-in between the times of 6pm and 7pm for a fun art project!

Title: Literary Travel through the U.S. - Massachusetts: The Storied Life of A. J. Fikry by Gabrielle Zevin
Description: Funny, tender, and moving, The Storied Life of A. J. Fikry reminds us all exactly why we read and why we love."* A. J. Fikry's life is not at all what he expected it to be. He lives alone, his bookstore is experiencing the worst sales in its history, and now his prized possession, a rare collection of Poe poems, has been stolen. But when a mysterious package appears at the bookstore, its unexpected arrival gives Fikry the chance to make his life over—and see everything anew. "
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Readin’ at the Ranch Book Club: Island of Sea Women, by Lisa See
Description: A long friendship & shared history helped two women persevere through colonialism and two wars but can it withstand a future that threatens to destroy their way of life?

Title: How to Find Your New Favorite Mystery
Description:
So many mysteries, and so little time! If you’re looking for suggestions for your next mystery novel, we’ll help you identify the genres and the style you most enjoy: How about a cozy? Or a great detective, chief inspector, local caterer, Navajo American police officer, thriller? 

Using the 5 W’s (Who, What, When, Where, Why) —and the How—of solid detective work, we’ll help you unearth some authors you may not have heard of. Presented by: Sylvia Sarrett (English Instructor, Consultant AP/IB) and Lindsay McSweeney (Culinary and Business Editor)

Title: Thankful Thanksgivings – The No-Fuss No-Muss Way to Enjoy the Holiday
Description:
Learn dozens of tips to ensure that your Thanksgiving meal is a success – From roasting a turkey, preparing sides, and creating delicious leftovers. 



Warren Caterson is a chef and full-time writer who studied at the Southeast Institute of Culinary Arts. He is the award-winning author of “Table for Two – The Cookbook for Couples”, "Table for Two - Back for Seconds”, and "Cooking Outside the Lines - Musings of an Extemporaneous Chef " (Winfield & Scott Press).

Title: Hike with a Librarian
Description:
Meet us at Robinson Preserve! 

We will discuss a nature themed nonfiction book with a Manatee County Librarian while enjoying Florida's scenery. After our book discussion, a Manatee County Parks & Natural Resources guide will talk about the local fauna and flora as we walk around the preserve at a leisurely pace. 

Hike with a Librarian programs involve easier walks through local preserves. Further instruction on the meet-up spot and trails will be emailed closer to the event date. 

Book title: Nature's Best Hope: A New Approach to Conservation That Starts in Your Yard

We have 2 paper copies, and it is available for everyone on Hoopla as an e-book as well!
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System
Presenter: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Protect Our Wildlife
Description: Come join the adventure and learn how to protect our native habitat and animals from environmental pollution!

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.

Title: Unified Mindfulness: Meditation on the Rooftop
Description: Please join us on the rooftop for a Unified Mindfulness donation-based meditation class that will help you cultivate focus, clarity, and balance. This introduction course is suitable for beginners and consists of a four-week cycle covering four basic techniques to begin learning how to work more skillfully with thoughts and feelings. It is recommended to bring a yoga mat and/or cushion and water. These classes will be instructed by Samala, a Unified Mindfulness Teacher/Coach.

Title: Lakewood Ranch Library: Holiday Photoshoot
Description:
It's getting to be a lot like that time of year when we're all scrambling to find the perfect family photo to share on our holiday cards. Do not panic! Lakewood Ranch Library and professional photographers, Bill Mills and Jim Eichen, are here to help with your own mini-photoshoot just in time to make your family look amazing this holiday season. Each individual or family will be emailed copies of their photos after editing is completed. Registration is required for this event. 

To reserve a session slot please follow this link https://manateelibrary.libcal.com/reserve/LWRPhotoShoot and navigate to November 16th to see available session. 

Please reserve only one session per family and unfortunately, at this time, no pets.

Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.

Title: CANCELED: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Canceled: Wellness Wandering Book Club: Braving the Wilderness, by Brene Brown
Description:
Join us for the Wellness Wanderings Book Club, where literature meets wellness! Each month, we will discuss a book focused on mental and physical wellness and alternate between fitness trail walks and yoga sessions. In partnership with the Sports and Leisure Department, this program not only fosters community connections but also invites you to discover the beautiful county parks in our area.

This month's book: Braving the Wilderness, Brene Brown

“True belonging doesn’t require us to change who we are. It requires us to be who we are.” Social scientist Brené Brown, PhD, MSW, has sparked a global conversation about the experiences that bring meaning to our lives—experiences of courage, vulnerability, love, belonging, shame, and empathy. In Braving the Wilderness, Brown redefines what it means to truly belong in an age of increased polarization. With her trademark mix of research, storytelling, and honesty, Brown will again change the cultural conversation while mapping a clear path to true belonging. (Amazon)

Location: Buffalo Creek Park (7550 69th St E, Palmetto, FL)

Activity: Trail Walk
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks

Title: You Are Not Alone for the Holidays--Peer Support at the Library
Description:
This holiday season, join us for a supportive gathering designed to foster connection and community. Hosted at the library, this event offers a safe, inclusive space for individuals seeking understanding, conversation, and mental health support. Come connect, share experiences, and find comfort among peers. Everyone is welcome!

Presented by NAMI Sarasota and Manatee County in partnership with Manatee County Library. NAMI Sarasota and Manatee Counties is a non-profit organization that offers support, education, and advocacy for people with mental illness, their families, and caregivers. NAMI Sarasota Manatee is an affiliate of the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI), the largest grassroots mental health organization in the United States.

Title: CANCELED: Spanish Conversation
Description:
The Spanish conversation class will be for people who studied Spanish and may have forgotten it, or who used to live in a Spanish-speaking country and now want to practice the language again, or for somebody that studied Spanish in school but doesn’t have the chance to practice conversation.

 

The class will be based on a weekly main subject.

There will be educational materials like short text, pictures, short videos, audios or famous quotes to be discussed.

Activities like: description, opinion, reflections, examples, question and answer, or personal experiences about the subject 

Each class will close with a recap of the lesson, questioning the students about what they just learned, including new vocabulary and to give homework or recommendations to improve their pronunciation or grammar.

Title: Mandarin I Chinese Classes
Description: This class is designed for people who have no previous Mandarin Chinese language experience,  but have a desire to explore the language and culture of China. We will begin with the introduction to the four fundamental building blocks of study: listening comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing. In addition, we also will introduce the culture of China and investigate the meaning of Chinese characters
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: George Washington’s Presidency and Administration
Description: This presentation covers the presidency of George Washington, and his administration. Learn about the key individuals who helped to shape the early years of our country, the challenges that arose during Washington’s presidency, and the debates that helped form the United States of America. Presentation by USF History Graduate Madi Frick.

Note: You may come in anytime/anyday during open hours in the month of December to make your guess. Winner will be chosen on January 2nd and notified. 

Prize sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library.

Title: Tai Chi
Description: Tai Chi was originally developed as a martial art in the 13th century. It is a gentle non-impact exercise. Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed.

Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Title: Holiday Themed Stroller Strides & Storytime with FIT4MOM Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota
Description:
Join us for a Stroller Strides class in the back lawn space from 9:30 am to 10:30 am for babies and toddlers hosted by FIT4MOM Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota! This event is FREE but please register ahead of time as space is limited. After class, we will be presenting a story time with a holiday theme!

Stroller Strides® is a 60-minute total-body workout with strength, cardio, and core training, all while engaging the little ones in a stroller! You'll leave class feeling strong, empowered, connected, and energized - no matter your stage of motherhood.

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Branch Library on the first Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources.

Title: Wellness Wandering Book Club: Better than Before, by Gretchen Rubin
Description:
Join us for the Wellness Wandering Book Club, where literature meets wellness! Each month, we will discuss a book focused on mental and physical wellness and alternate between different activities. In partnership with the Sports and Leisure Department, this program fosters community connections and invites you to discover the beautiful county parks in our area.

We'll kick things off with lively book discussions, then shift gears for some fun activities guided by our friends from the Sports and Leisure Department.



This month's book: Better than Before, by Gretchen Rubin

Most of us have a habit we’d like to change, and there’s no shortage of expert advice. But as we all know from tough experience, no magic, one-size-fits-all solution exists. It takes work to make a habit, but once that habit is set, we can harness the energy of habits to build happier, stronger, more productive lives. (Amazon)

Location: Lakewood Ranch Soccer Pavilion in Back of Parking Lot

Activity: Pickleball technique program

Title: CANCELED: You Are Not Alone for the Holidays--Peer Support at the Library
Description:
This holiday season, join us for a supportive gathering designed to foster connection and community. Hosted at the library, this event offers a safe, inclusive space for individuals seeking understanding, conversation, and mental health support. Come connect, share experiences, and find comfort among peers. Everyone is welcome!

Presented by NAMI Sarasota and Manatee County in partnership with Manatee County Library. NAMI Sarasota and Manatee Counties is a non-profit organization that offers support, education, and advocacy for people with mental illness, their families, and caregivers. NAMI Sarasota Manatee is an affiliate of the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI), the largest grassroots mental health organization in the United States.

Title: Lakewood Ranch Library: Holiday Photoshoot

It's getting to be a lot like that time of year when we're all scrambling to find the perfect family photo to share on our holiday cards. Do not panic! Lakewood Ranch Library and professional photographers, Bill Mills and Jim Eichen, are here to help with your own mini-photoshoot just in time to make your family look amazing this holiday season. Each individual or family will be emailed copies of their photos after editing is completed. Registration is required for this event. 

To reserve a session slot please follow this link https://manateelibrary.libcal.com/reserve/LWRPhotoShoot and navigate to December 7th to see available session. 

Please reserve only one session per family and unfortunately, at this time, no pets.

To register for the December 21st event, please click here!

Title: Adult Arts Wellness Workshop: Music for Healing, presented by the Sarasota Performing Arts Foundation (SPAF)
Description:
This initiative is in response to the recent devastation from Hurricane's Helene and Milton. SPAF saw an opportunity to provide arts wellness programs to help support our community in this time of rebuilding. SPAF Foundation has been providing therapeutic and reflective arts workshops in partnership with The Resilient Retreat since 2020, with participants continuously citing the workshops as teaching new skills and lowering stress.

This interactive experience explores various world instruments and sounds, such as singing bowls, tuning forks, chimes, steel drums, world percussion, and voice. The program is conducted in three phases: 1. Educate participants about the principles of sound therapy, its benefits, and how to integrate sound healing into daily life—discovering their why. 2. Healing Sound Bath allows the participants to experience meditation and a relaxing environment. (Facilitator plays the instruments) 3. Allow the participants to play the instrument, recognizing their synchronization with the energy and compatibility of the instruments.
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

¡Únase a nosotros para jugar Lotería! Los juegos se jugarán tanto en español como en inglés, ¡así que todos pueden unirse para tener la oportunidad de ganar algunos premios!



Join us to play Lotería, a traditional game of chance similar to bingo which is enjoyed by many in Latin-American countries. Games will be played in both Spanish and English, so everyone is welcome to join for a chance to win some prizes!

Title: Needle Arts Studio-Open Sew and Knit
Description: Do you sew, knit, quilt, crochet, do handwork or English paper piecing? Bring your projects and join us! Get some inspiration or assistance if needed. Participants must bring their own fabric, patterns, thread, and notions necessary for their personal projects, but tools will be provided. We have 4 Janome sewing machines, 2 sergers, and large cutting mats.

Title: Welcome to Our World: A Free Drop-in Group for Parents and Infants
Description: Forty Carrots Family Center presents the free drop-in group "Welcome to Our World," for parents and infants. Bringing a baby into the world can fill our hearts with joy and love, and our minds with questions and wonder. Join other families navigating the newborn phase in a supportive and informative group to explore topics that are relevant to you and your family as you begin the journey of raising a healthy and happy child.

Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Adult Arts Wellness Workshop: Becoming Picasso, presented by the Sarasota Performing Arts Foundation (SPAF)
Description:
This initiative is in response to the recent devastation from Hurricane's Helene and Milton. SPAF saw an opportunity to provide arts wellness programs to help support our community in this time of rebuilding. SPAF Foundation has been providing therapeutic and reflective arts workshops in partnership with The Resilient Retreat since 2020, with participants continuously citing the workshops as teaching new skills and lowering stress.

This workshop offers a transformative experience, empowering participants to expand their capacity to know and understand themselves. Through a series of engaging exercises inspired by theater directors Boal and Stanislavski, as well as ancient wisdom from the Yoga Sutras, participants will actively explore and challenge their thoughts, uncovering the ones that masquerade as facts and significantly influence their behaviors. By taking an inventory of their consciousness, examining their intelligence, outer mind, senses, and ego, participants will break free from habitual thinking patterns and step into the vast space of infinite possibilities in the present moment. This workshop brings together a wealth of knowledge and expertise. Tap into your inner Picassos, discovering your unique creative potential and embarking on a personal journey of self-discovery.
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rocky Bluff Trivia NIght
Description: Trivia night returns to Rocky Bluff Library! Bring a team or join a team.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Adult Book Discussion Group: Birnam Wood by Kazuo by Eleanor Catton
Description: Five years ago, Mira Bunting founded a guerrilla gardening group: Birnam Wood. An undeclared, unregulated, sometimes-criminal, sometimes-philanthropic gathering of friends, this activist collective plants crops wherever no one will notice: on the sides of roads, in forgotten parks, and neglected backyards. For years, the group has struggled to break even. Then Mira stumbles on an answer, a way to finally set the group up for the long term: a landslide has closed the Korowai Pass, cutting off the town of Thorndike. Natural disaster has created an opportunity, a sizable farm seemingly abandoned. But Mira is not the only one interested in Thorndike. (Description by GoodReads)
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Thriving Through Transition: Nutrition for Perimenopause & Menopause
Description:
Join us for a presentation on Nutrition for Perimenopause and Menopause with Ashley McIntyre, MS, CNS, LDN a Clinical Nutritionist and Holistic Health Coach. Navigate the transformative phases of perimenopause and menopause with confidence in our insightful session. This talk is designed to empower individuals with the knowledge and tools to optimize their nutrition during these pivotal life stages. Join us to embrace this transition with a proactive approach to nutrition, equipping yourself with the knowledge to thrive and maintain vitality during perimenopause and menopause. Let’s empower ourselves to navigate this journey with grace and resilience!

Ashley's Website: www.theelevatedplate.com

Title: Literary Travel through the U.S.  – Michigan: Middlesex by Jeffrey Eugenides
Description:
In the spring of 1974, Calliope Stephanides, a student at a girls' school in Grosse Pointe, Michigan, finds herself drawn to a chain-smoking, strawberry blonde classmate with a gift for acting. 



The passion that furtively develops between them--along with Callie's failure to develop--leads Callie to suspect that she is not like other girls. In fact, she is not really a girl at all.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Making Sense of Medicare
Description:
Ready to Navigate the Medicare Waters? Are you feeling a bit adrift when it comes to Medicare? About to hit the big 65 or preparing to set sail into retirement? Choosing the right Medicare plan can feel like navigating unchartered waters, but don’t worry — I’m here to be your trusty compass on this journey! Join us for a FREE interactive and educational session where we’ll unravel the complexities of Medicare and help you make sense of it all! 

Your guide, Amy McCarthy of Waterside Insurance Solutions, is a licensed Independent Insurance Agent specializing in Medicare. She’ll help ensure that your journey through the Medicare seas is smooth sailing! In this fun and informative session, we will help answer your questions as we guide you to:

Understand Original Medicare: Learn what traditional Medicare is (and isn’t).

Unravel the ABCDs of Medicare: Dive into Parts A, B, C & D.

Choose Your Path: Discover the differences between Medicare Supplements and Medicare Advantage Plans.

Dodge the Fees: Learn when to enroll – and how to avoid penalties!

But wait – there’s more! All attendees will be entered into a raffle! You can earn one extra raffle ticket for each person you invite who attends with you! Attendees will also enjoy delicious treats while you learn! 

For accommodations of persons with special needs at meetings call 941-258-9440 or 711 (TTY)

Title: Joyful Connections: Finding Wellness in the Holiday Spirit
Description:
The holidays are a time for joy, but they can also be stressful. This session will show you how to foster meaningful connections and find true happiness amidst the holiday hustle. We'll dive into the importance of relationships for your well-being, how to protect your energy, and how to embrace the holiday season with joy and mindfulness. Learn how to create lasting memories and make this holiday season your healthiest yet!

This is part of a “Healthy Thru the Holidays” Wellness Workshop Series presented by National Board Certified Health & Wellness Coach, Carrie Ehrlich (NBC-HWC) of Transform Wellness. Learn more: transformwellnessllc.com

Please join us on January 30 for "Sweet Surrender: Free Yourself from Sugar Cravings"

Description: Come and travel around the world with us. Join us for story time, songs and interactive playing for kids ages 4-7. Registration is required.
Categories: Culture, International, Literacy > Book Clubs & Author Talks

Title: Dipnetting with a Librarian (Adult Program)
Description:
Join us in dipnetting at Emerson Point Preserve!
First we will discuss the nature guide that is our assigned book for this event with the librarian lead, then the naturalist Elena Burke will provide supplies so that we may dip nets in the water to discover and identify nymphs, fish, and other water creatures. Waivers must be signed at the beginning of this event when you arrive, as we will be wading and walking in water.

Location: Emerson Point Preserve

Book: Florida's living beaches : a guide for the curious beachcomber (if this one is unavailable, check out the older version instead: Florida's living beaches : a guide for the curious beachcomber)

NOTE: Please wear old sneakers, wading shoes, or water shoes along with clothes that can get wet to this event (and please bring a towel).
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System
Presenter: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Drop-in Knitting
Description: Join other knitters for an afternoon of knitting. We’ll meet in the new Maker Space and you may bring your knitting projects. This program suitable for knitters of all levels; needles and yarn available for on-site use.

Title: Parrish Playworks Presents: In One Basket
Description: Please join us on December 14th for a special performance by the Parrish Playworks! Selections from In One Basket (by Shirley Pugh) a collection of little-known folk and fairy tales will be performed as storybook theater, and will include a bit of audience participation!!
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), All Ages, Families
Categories: Arts & Entertainment, Special Event, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Holiday Music: Aloha Ukulele Group! Program presented by: The Friends of Rocky Bluff Branch Library
Description: A variety of all of our favorite music for the holidays performed by the Aloha Ukulele group, a large chorus of singers and musicians playing the Ukulele and other instruments.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
Categories: CONCERT, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Paper Crafting
Description: Registration is required. Instructor-Led by: MaryKate Scott. Please note: the image is not what we'll be making. The same project will be completed on Friday and Saturday of each month, no need to register for both days.

Title: Holidays Around the World! Sponsored by Braden River's Teen Advisory Board
Description: Please join us to learn more about different holidays celebrated around the word. Members of our Teen Advisory Board will present different traditions in the form of crafts, activities, and food. All ages are welcome to come celebrate!
Categories: Crafts, Food & Beverage, Fun & Games, Teen Advisory Board (TAB)

Title: Family Movie Night
Description:
Enjoy a family-friendly movie at the library. Popcorn and drinks provided. Feel free to bring additional snacks for your family. The movie starts at 3:30 pm. We will be watching The Grinch, rated PG.
*Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library

Title: DIY Fantasy Maps for Teens
Description: Fantasy fans will create maps of their own worlds using pens, rice, tea bags and of course their imaginations.

Title: Just Believe - Polar Express Challenge
Description:
Have a chance to win your very own copy of “The Polar Express” and a toy train set. All you must do is submit your guess of how many bells are in the jar. The closest guess wins! 

Note: You may come in anytime/anyday during open hours in the month of December to make your guess. Winner will be chosen on January 2nd and notified. 

Prize sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library.
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years)

Title: Tai Chi
Description: Tai Chi was originally developed as a martial art in the 13th century. It is a gentle non-impact exercise. Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: Join us for interactive story-times with age-appropriate themes and activities.

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health. For intermediate and advanced participants only.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Soar in 4
Description:
Soar in 4 is Manatee County’s monthly movement to ensure all early learners and their families have the opportunities and support they need for success in preschool, school and beyond. Soar in 4 is a collaborative effort to ensure all children are reading on grade level by the end of third grade with reading and activities.


Join Soar and 4 representatives in the library for some fun songs, books, and information.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: CANCELED: Musical Motion
Description:
Presented by Parenting Matters

Musical Motion is a fun parent-child learn & play class that encourages bonding while developing early learning and literacy skills in children. Sessions focus on creative activities that enhance brain development and build preschoolers’ social skills, language skills,  motor skills, and more. In English and Spanish.

For ages 0-5!

Title: Holiday Music: Aloha Ukulele Group!
Description: A variety of all of our favorite music for the holidays performed by the Aloha Ukulele group, a large chorus of singers and musicians playing the Ukulele and other instruments.

Title: Intro to Herbal Remedies
Description:
In this class, we will explore simple and effective uses for everyday herbs that you pass by in the grocery store, or even have in your kitchen cabinet already. Herbs not only add great flavor to your meals, they also have beneficial healing properties.  Get ready to see these everyday herbs in a new light! Presented by Kristin Pelletier, Certified Health and Wellness Coach. 

*Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library*
Event Organizer: Sylva Osbourne- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Ukulele: Beyond Beginner (Level 2)
Description: Join Kathleen Reynolds, Leader of the Bradenton Ukulele Movement (BUMs), for this dynamic beginners ukulele class! You will learn chords and strumming patterns, shuffle and island. Music will be 60s Rock & Roll and folk music--Peter, Paul, and Mary; Ricky Nelson; Bob Dylan, etc. Come join the fun!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Family Movie Nights: The Muppet Christmas Carol (PG)
Description: Join us in watching The Muppet Christmas Carol! Come on out in your comfy pjs, bring your fuzzy blankets and have a fun time! Popcorn and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own snacks. The movie will start at 5:30 pm and will run for 1 hour and 22 minutes.
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years), Families, Toddlers (18 months-3 years)
Categories: Film, Holiday, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Description: Join the fun! Come as a team or come alone and team up with a few others to play a few rounds of trivia! A different theme each month. Winners receive a prize book! Presenters are seasoned trivia hosts.

From colorful crafts to interactive play, toddlers will delight in a fun-filled experience that fosters learning, laughter, and the joy of storytelling!

Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: December Tween STEAM: Make Your Own Paper!
Description:
Join us for an exciting hands-on workshop where tweens will unleash their creativity while learning about sustainability! At December's Tween STEAM Program, participants will discover the art and engineering of making their own paper by using recycled materials. All equipment and materials will be provided by the library. 


	
	Limit to 20 tweens. Registration will open 1 month in advance. 
	



	
	Registration is required with spots held for only 15 minutes after start time; Waitlisted guests will fill in spots in the order of registration. 
	



	
	Parents/Guardians must remain in the library building at all times while tweens are participating in the event; The responsibility for the safety and behavior of children in the library rests with the parent/care giver and not the library personnel. 
	



	
	Supplies are provided by the library during the event and are available while supplies last.

Title: Rooftop Zumba
Description: If you love Dancing, you will LOVE this Zumba class. All the Zumba happy vibes, with a dash of classic and contemporary moves. Come and join instructor Juan Baquero for this HIGH INTENSITY class on the Lakewood Ranch Library rooftop.

Title: CANCELED: Chair Yoga
Description: Please, join certified yoga instructor, Donna Laughlin, as she leads you in gentle chair/supported yoga. Bring blocks and straps if you have them.

Title: Gentle Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 blocks, and clothes you can stretch and move in. Explore basic yoga movements to develop strength, flexibility and balance in supporting your journey to mind-body health and wellness. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified Yoga Instructor.  Sponsored by the Friends of Braden River Library. Waiver Forms will be available and must be completed once by each new participant before the class.
