Title: Make Your Own Snow Globe! Drop-in Craft
Description:
Drop-in between 10:00 AM and 12:00 PM to make your very own snow globe! Choose what cute festive decorations to put inside along with different types of glitter. Then fill and seal a mix of water and glycerin. Librarian Rin will be there to assist.

While supplies last.
Event Organizer: Rin H - Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Tracing Your Roots: One-on-One Genealogy Assistance
Description: Bring your laptop if possible and family information to make your pedigree chart. SueAnn Carpenter, Genealogist, DAR member, will provide one-on-one assistance to create your free family tree online. SueAnn will show you how to maneuver the site plus various links to verify documents (birth, marriage, death) and build the story of your ancestors.

Title: Alzheimer's Association Caregiver Support Group
Description:
Join us at Palmetto Library on the third Wednesday of each month. Alzheimer's Association support groups are conducted by trained facilitators. These meetings are a safe place to develop a support system, exchange practical information on challenges and possible solutions, talk through issues and ways of coping, share feelings, needs, and concerns, and learn about community resources. 

To register, call 800-272-3900.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Read Around the Globe Book Club: Verity, by Colleen Hoover
Description:
Lowen Ashleigh is a struggling writer in New York on the brink of financial ruin. When she accepts the job offer of a lifetime, Lowen uncovers an unfinished autobiography which leads to serious consequences.

Description:
Get ready to craft, learn, and have fun with a like-minded community! From beginners to simple cardmaking, learn how to make a couple cards! Registration is required for this event - Adults only. This class will start promptly at 10:00 am - if you are on the attendance list, you are welcome to arrive fifteen minutes early.

Join us at the Palmetto Library for a fun-filled hour of play! 

The more you play the more you learn. Play is so good for us. It feeds the brain. It builds skills and knowledge. During play, children engage with and learn about the world around them. No registration required!

Title: Adult Drop-in Art: Mini Wreath Ornaments & Gift Wrapping
Description:
Join us to create your very own Mini Wreath Ornaments! Using hot glue, ribbons, and a variety of fun materials, you’ll craft a charming wreath perfect for any season. Also feel free to bring gifts to wrap becasue we’ll have wrapping paper and ribbon available if you'd like to wrap some holiday gifts while you're here! 

All supplies are provided and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Please note: this is a self-guided session, offering you a space to explore your artistic side at your own pace. 

    

Looking for a fun and simple craft project? Want to exercise your creative muscles? Every month we are doing a different craft, so come drop-in between the times of 6pm and 7pm for a fun art project!

Description: Certified service dogs are coming to visit the library, and they want you to read to them! Perfect for those who want to practice their reading skills in a low-stress environment. These super affectionate dogs are all ears!

Title: Holiday Music: Aloha Ukulele Group! Program presented by: The Friends of Braden River Library
Description: A variety of all of our favorite music for the holidays performed by the Aloha Ukulele group, a large chorus of singers and musicians playing the Ukulele and other instruments.
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library
Categories: CONCERT, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: Rooftop Sound Bath
Description: ✨ Join Janet Raines from Sun Tuned Wellness for a donation-based Rooftop Sound Bath event on December 21st at 11:00am! Relax under the sky as the soothing sounds of crystal and Tibetan bowls, along with other calming instruments, wash over you. Bring a yoga mat or blanket for added comfort, and experience a peaceful escape. ✨

Title: CANCELED: Ask a Master Gardener
Description: Master Gardener volunteers from the local UF/IFAS Extension Office will be available to answer your questions and share information on flora and landscaping in Florida.
Event Organizer: Chelsea B. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Chair Yoga with Manching - Rescheduled Date
Description: A new class designed for absolutely everyone regardless of age or fitness level. Taught by Manching Tom, Certified Yoga Instructor. This is a perfect class for anyone who’s new to yoga or coming back from any injury.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Drop-in Knitting
Description: Join other knitters for an afternoon of knitting. We’ll meet in the new Maker Space and you may bring your knitting projects. This program suitable for knitters of all levels; needles and yarn available for on-site use.

Title: Origami Class
Description: Come join us as we learn the art of origami. Supplies are furnished.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Family Movie Matinee
Description: Join us for a family-friendly movie the first Saturday of the month.

Title: Imagination Playground: Blue Block Play
Description: Build and create your own town using pieces from Imagination Playground! The blue blocks were generously funded by our Friends of the Lakewood Ranch Library through this year's Giving Challenge.

Title: Sweet Seasons: A Holiday Chocolate Workshop
Description:
Join the Fudge Factory of Anna Maria Island for a holiday themed chocolate making extravanganza! You will be able to select from a variety of holiday chocolate molds and make your own chocoalte treats. Each participant will also get to take home both their chocolates and molds. 

 

All children ages 6 & up are welcome. Registration is required. *Sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library*
Presenter: Fudge Factory of Anna Maria Island
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years)

Title: Creative Kids: Holidays
Description: Get creative with Ms. Jenn! Each month we’ll have a special project for kids to make with their parents. This week we're making festive paper bag vests, ornaments and cards for the winter holidays. This program is designed for kids ages 5-12. Registration is preferred, but not required.

Title: Science Fiction/Fantasy Book Club: A Psalm for the Wild-Built, by Becky Chambers
Description:
Come read with us across galaxies and through enchanted forests by joining our Science Fiction Fantasy book club! A book club that meets once a month and reads not only sci-fi and fantasy classics, but also newer and more diverse voices in the genre. We’ll read graphic novels and short story collections,  too! Everyone 16+ is welcome!

In September, we’ll be discussing An Absolutely Remarkable Thing by Hank Green.

Title: Just Believe - Polar Express Challenge
Description:
Have a chance to win your very own copy of “The Polar Express” and a toy train set. All you must do is submit your guess of how many bells are in the jar. The closest guess wins! 

Note: You may come in anytime/anyday during open hours in the month of December to make your guess. Winner will be chosen on January 2nd and notified. 

Prize sponsored by the Friends of the Island Library.
Audiences: Children (4-7 years), Tweens (8-12 years), Teens (13-18 years)

Title: Tai Chi
Description: Tai Chi was originally developed as a martial art in the 13th century. It is a gentle non-impact exercise. Besides to improve your balance and lower your risk of falls,  it also enhances your body awareness, coordination, strength, and flexibility. This class is for beginners and no previous experience needed.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Baby Storytime
Description:
Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for babies ages 0-18 Months. We will also have optional play time after to connect with other new parents and caregivers!

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health. For intermediate and advanced participants only.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Preschool Storytime
Description:
Join us for songs, rhymes, and stories for children ages 3-5.  

Please note: Our Storytime Room has a capacity limit of 40 people. When you enter the Kids Space, please see the library staff member at the desk to pick up a number (#1-40) to secure your spots for this event.

Title: Rocky Bluff Bridge Club
Description: Join us at Rocky Bluff Library for weekly Bridge games. Bridge, known as the ultimate trick-taking card game, is played in groups of 4 and is always a fun time. All skill levels are welcome!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Memoir Group
Description: Join other memoir writers working on personal stories. This collaborative group of writers contribute stories and provide a friendly supportive working team. Registration is for all sessions.

Title: Chair Yoga with Manching
Description: A new class designed for absolutely everyone regardless of age or fitness level. Taught by Manching Tom, Certified Yoga Instructor. This is a perfect class for anyone who’s new to yoga or coming back from any injury.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Kids Playgroup (0-5)
Description:
Join us at the Palmetto Library for a fun-filled hour of play! 

The more you play the more you learn. Play is so good for us. It feeds the brain. It builds skills and knowledge. During play, children engage with and learn about the world around them. No registration required!
Audiences: Babies (0-18 months), Preschool (3-5 years), Toddlers (18 months-3 years)

Title: Game Day
Description: Game Day is a combination of Scrabble, Mahjong and Bridge. Beginners, Intermediate and Skilled players are welcome.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: CANCELED: Tai Chi/Qigong Class
Description: Participants will be led through a variety of Tai Chi and Qigong movements for physical and mental health.

Title: One-on-One Tech Help
Description: One-on-One tech assistance: androids, iPhones, tablets, laptops, e-books/audiobooks, and more. NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: Makerspace Adults Drop-in
Description:
This is your time in our makerspace to use Cricut, sewing machines, 3D printers and more.

Registration encouraged, but not required.
Event Organizer: Cathy L. - Manatee County Public Library

Title: Rocky Bluff Book Club
Description: Every month come and discuss a different title. Even if you haven't read the book, you will enjoy the discussion and may want to read it later.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Baby Storytime
Description: We sing, play, dance, rhyme and read all while promoting your baby’s development and literacy skills. No registration required.

Title: CANCELED: Line Dancing--Beginners
Description:
Join instructor Jean Marcley for a fun-filled hour of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.


	Learn to dance
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social

Title: Mahjong Club
Description: Beginners and experienced players welcome! Game sets are not provided by the library.

Title: Preschool Yoga (Mats provided)
Description:
Join Certified Yoga Instructor, Bee Nguyen of Bumblebee Yoga, for an hour of relaxing pre-school yoga. Limited to 12 families. Parent or Care-giver, please register once for family unit. 

Mats are provided! WAIVER ATTACHED FOR DOWNLOAD. PLEASE SIGN AND BRING TO THE SESSION.

Title: Wiggle Worms Storytime (BABIES TO 5 YEARS)
Description: Bring your little one to Wiggle Worms Family Storytime every Friday of every month. This fun and interactive story-time will have you and your little one reading, singing, and learning.

Title: CANCELED: Line Dancing--Advanced
Description:
Join instructor Jean Marcley for a fun-filled hour of line dancing! If you've been line dancing for a while, this class is for YOU! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.


	Learn new dance moves
	Improve balance
	Boost memory
	Get your heart pumping
	Get social

Title: Mahjong for Experienced Players
Description: Mahjong Club for experienced players. This program is intended for those who already know how to play.

Title: Chess Club
Description: Come play with friends and friends-to-be every Friday!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Mindfulness Meditation
Description:
Join author/instructor Ruth Fishel to learn how to incorporate mindfulness meditation into your life. 

Audience: 18+
Categories: Health/Fitness/Wellness, Sponsored by the Friends of the Library

Title: One-on-One Tech Help (English)
Description:
Sign up online or call 941-727-6079 to schedule a half hour session with staff. We can give instruction on using library downloads and databases and also offer basic instruction on laptops, tablets and smart-phones.

NOTE: We cannot repair devices and cannot fill out forms for patrons.

Title: Tech Class: New Device? What now?
Description: Learn how to set up and care for a brand-new device step-by-step from box to use. Bring your device is you can, otherwise please bring the user manual and/or a picture of the box. Either way, bring any questions you have about its use and care.

Title: Beginning Line Dancing
Description: Join dance Instructor Chako Isgro for a fun-filled ninety minutes of beginning line dancing! The practice of line dancing is great for your overall health and well-being.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Manatee Patchworkers
Description: Manatee Patchworkers is a group of quilters ranging from beginner to expert how make items such as quilts, dog beds, cat mats, and other items to donate to local groups. Come help us make things for those in need!
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Rooftop Yoga
Description: Join us on the roof for weekly rooftop yoga! This is a donation-based group class designed to inspire and invigorate one and all. Beginners are welcome as are seasoned Yogi’s. This is an instructor led vinyasa that focuses on balancing effort and ease through breath work and postures to promote strength and clarity. Please bring a yoga mat!

Title: Ask a Master Gardener
Description: Master Gardener volunteers from the local UF/IFAS Extension Office will be available to answer your questions and share information on flora and landscaping in Florida.
Event Organizer: Hal Harmon- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Say Yes to Chess!
Description: Open chess play for Tweens. All levels welcome; build and/or share your knowledge. First come, first served to play on one of our eight chess boards, or bring your own. Registration encouraged, but not required.

Title: CANCELED: Yoga with Manching
Description: Bring a mat, 2 yoga blocks, and wear clothes you can stretch and move in. All levels welcome. Taught by Manching Tom, certified yoga teacher.

Title: Drop-in Virtual Reality
Description: Join us for games, stories, and educational experiences with the Oculus Quest virtual reality headset! For your safety, we require all participants to be over the age of 13, and we advise those with motion sickness, migraines, or any other conditions that could be exacerbated by VR to exercise caution.
Event Organizer: David Breakfield, South Manatee Library Supervisor

Title: Glam Champagne Flutes
Description: Decorate and personalize champagne flutes just in time for New Years eve. Decorate your glass using glitter and gems for an extra sparkly NYE. Cheers!

Title: Just Dance! (For Tweens)
Description: Calling all Tweens!! Are you ready for a dance off? Come to the Lakewood Ranch Meeting Room A from 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm for an afternoon of playing Just Dance! The library has 4 controllers, feel free to bring your own to hook up to our Switch. There is a max of 6 connected controllers at one time.
Presenter: Jill Franxman, Miranda Johnson, Julia Richardson, Melanie Velazquez & Brianna Wilson

Title: Mahjong at Rocky Bluff
Description:
Callling all Mahjong players! Come play with new friends and neighbors at the Rocky Bluff Branch every Tuesday.

*Mah Jongg instruction is not being offered at this time. This program is intended for those who already know how to play. Audience 18+.
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System

Title: Decorate a Calendar for the New Year!
Description: Kick off the New Year with some fun! Create a calendar to take you into the New Year!

Title: Rocky Bluff Library Pinochle + More
Description: Stop by the Rocky Bluff Library for a friendly game of Pinochle. All experience levels are welcome to join. If you don't know how to play, come and learn! Now join us for more fun and games, including Euchre and Hand and Foot card games!
Event Organizer: Jessica Franklin- Manatee County Public Library System
